original: shar phyogs kyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag tu song zhing /
analyzed: shar phyogs kyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag tu song zhing /
translated: They go to the buddhafields in the east, as numerous as the sands of the Ganges river,

original: sems can rnams la chos ston pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams la bsnyen bkur byed pa dang / chos kyang nyan pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i dge 'dun dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi yon tan bkod pa dag kyang mthong bar byed cing /
analyzed: sems can rnams la chos ston pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams la bsnyen bkur byed pa dang / chos kyang nyan pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i dge 'dun dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi yon tan bkod pa dag kyang mthong bar byed cing /
translated: and teach the Dharma to the sentient beings there, and they serve the tathagatas, the arhats, the fully enlightened buddhas, and they listen to the Dharma, and they see the bodhisattva saṅgha and the arrays of the qualities of the buddhafields.

original: de dag gis sangs rgyas kyi zhing de dag gi mtshan ma yongs su bzung nas de bas kyang rgya che ba dang / khyad par du 'phags pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing mang po yongs su sgrub cing /
analyzed: de dag gis sangs rgyas kyi zhing de dag gi mtshan ma yongs su bzung nas de bas kyang rgya che ba dang / khyad par du 'phags pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing mang po yongs su sgrub cing /
translated: They take up the signs of those buddhafields, and they create many buddhafields that are even vaster and more sublime than those.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing de dag tu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po skye ba gcig gis thogs pa sha stag sgrub par byed pa dag kyang yod do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing de dag tu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po skye ba gcig gis thogs pa sha stag sgrub par byed pa dag kyang yod do //
translated: And they create those buddhafields in which there are only bodhisattva mahāsattvas who are impeded by only one birth.

original: de bzhin du lho dang / nub dang / byang dang; byang shar dang / shar lho dang / lho nub dang / nub byang dang / 'og dang / steng gi phyogs kyi phyogs re rer yang sangs rgyas kyi zhing gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag tu song zhing //
analyzed: de bzhin du lho dang / nub dang / byang dang; byang shar dang / shar lho dang / lho nub dang / nub byang dang / 'og dang / steng gi phyogs kyi phyogs re rer yang sangs rgyas kyi zhing gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag tu song zhing //
translated: In the same way, they go to as many buddhafields as there are sand particles in the Gaṅgā river in the south, west, north, northeast, southeast, southwest, northwest, below, and above,

original: @62b sems can rnams la chos ston pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams la bsnyen bkur byed pa dang / chos nyan pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i dge 'dun dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi yon tan bkod pa dag mthong bar byed cing /
analyzed: @62b sems can rnams la chos ston pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams la bsnyen bkur byed pa dang / chos nyan pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i dge 'dun dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi yon tan bkod pa dag mthong bar byed cing /
translated: and they teach the Dharma to beings, serve the tathāgatas, the worthy ones, the perfectly complete buddhas, listen to the Dharma, see the bodhisattva saṅgha and the arrays of qualities of the buddhafields.

original: de dag gis sangs rgyas kyi zhing de dag gi mtshan mar yongs su bzung nas /
analyzed: de dag gis sangs rgyas kyi zhing de dag gi mtshan mar yongs su bzung nas /
translated: They take the signs of those buddhafields as their object.

original: de bas kyang rgya che ba dang; khyad par du 'phags pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing mang po yongs su sgrub cing /
analyzed: de bas kyang rgya che ba dang; khyad par du 'phags pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing mang po yongs su sgrub cing /
translated: They accomplish many buddhafields that are even vaster and more exalted.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing de dag tu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po skye ba gcig gis thogs pa sha stag sgrub par byed pa dag kyang yod do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing de dag tu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po skye ba gcig gis thogs pa sha stag sgrub par byed pa dag kyang yod do //
translated: having attained the four unhindered discernments,

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: having attained the four kinds of fearlessness,🔽having attained the four unshared qualities of a buddha,🔽having attained the eighteen distinctive qualities of a buddha,🔽having attained the great love,🔽having attained the great compassion,🔽having attained the great rejoicing,🔽having attained the great equanimity,🔽having attained the ten powers of a buddha,🔽having attained the four kinds of intrepid confidence,🔽having attained the four kinds of correct knowledge,🔽having attained the eighteen distinctive qualities of a buddha,🔽having attained the thirty-two major marks of a superior man,🔽having attained the eighty minor marks,🔽having attained the five eyes,🔽having attained the six supernormal knowledges,🔽having attained the four kinds of unhindered discernment,🔽having attained the four kinds of correct knowledge,🔽having attained the four kinds of fearlessness,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod cing /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod cing /
translated: having attained the great love,🔽having attained the great compassion,🔽having attained the great rejoicing,🔽having attained the great equanimity,🔽having attained the ten powers of a buddha,🔽having attained the four kinds of intrepid confidence,🔽having attained the eighteen distinctive qualities of a buddha,🔽having attained the thirty-two major marks of a superior man,

original: skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang ldan par byas te /
analyzed: skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang ldan par byas te /
translated: having attained the eighty minor marks,🔽having attained the five eyes,🔽having attained the six supernormal knowledges,🔽having attained the four kinds of unhindered discernment,🔽having attained the four kinds of correct knowledge,

original: dbang po gsal zhing yongs su dag pa rnams dang ldan par gyur nas /🔽de dag lus yongs su dag pa de dag gis skye bo mang po dga' zhing dad pa skyed par byed de /
analyzed: dbang po gsal zhing yongs su dag pa rnams dang ldan par gyur nas / de dag lus yongs su dag pa de dag gis skye bo mang po dga' zhing dad pa skyed par byed de /
translated: having attained the four kinds of fearlessness,🔽having attained the great love,🔽having attained the great compassion,🔽having attained the great rejoicing,

original: de dag skye bo mang po'i yid du 'ong zhing dga' bar gyur nas /
analyzed: de dag skye bo mang po'i yid du 'ong zhing dga' bar gyur nas /
translated: having attained the great equanimity,🔽having attained the ten powers of a buddha,🔽having attained the four kinds of intrepid confidence,🔽having attained the eighteen distinctive qualities of a buddha,🔽having attained the thirty-two major marks of a superior man,

original: sems can de dag kyang sems rab tu dad par gyur pa de nyid kyi dge ba'i rtsa bas theg pa gsum po dag gis rim gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar byed pa dag kyang yod de /
analyzed: sems can de dag kyang sems rab tu dad par gyur pa de nyid kyi dge ba'i rtsa bas theg pa gsum po dag gis rim gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar byed pa dag kyang yod de /
translated: having attained the eighty minor marks,🔽having attained the five eyes,🔽having attained the six supernormal knowledges,🔽having attained the four kinds of unhindered discernment,🔽having attained the four kinds of correct knowledge,🔽having attained the four kinds of fearlessness,🔽having attained the great love,🔽having attained the great compassion,🔽having attained the great rejoicing,🔽having

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas lus yongs su dag pa la bslab par @63a *//
analyzed: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas lus yongs su dag pa la bslab par @63a *//
translated: in this way, bodhisattva mahāsattvas practicing the perfection of wisdom should train in the purification of the body,

original: bya'o; ;ngag yongs su dag pa dang / yid yongs su dag pa la bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: bya'o; ;ngag yongs su dag pa dang / yid yongs su dag pa la bslab par bya'o //
translated: and should train in the purification of speech and mind.

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod cing /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod cing /
translated: there are bodhisattva mahāsattvas who, practicing the six perfections,

original: dbang po gsal ba dag thob par gyur nas de dag dbang po gsal ba de dag gis bdag la bstod par mi byed cing /
analyzed: dbang po gsal ba dag thob par gyur nas de dag dbang po gsal ba de dag gis bdag la bstod par mi byed cing /
translated: having attained clear faculties, do not praise themselves with those clear faculties,

original: gzhan la smod par mi byed pa dag kyang yod do //
analyzed: gzhan la smod par mi byed pa dag kyang yod do //
translated: and do not disparage others.

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems dang po bskyed phyin chad sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas nas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems dang po bskyed phyin chad sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas nas /
translated: from the first production of the thought of awakening, bodhisattva mahāsattvas, abiding in the perfection of generosity and the perfection of moral discipline,

original: phyir mi ldog pa'i sa thob kyi bar du nam yang dbul por mi 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa'i sa thob kyi bar du nam yang dbul por mi 'gyur zhing /
translated: They will never be poor until they attain the irreversible stage.

original: ngan song ngan 'gro log par mi ltung ba dag kyang yod do //
analyzed: ngan song ngan 'gro log par mi ltung ba dag kyang yod do //
translated: They will not fall into the lower realms of the evil destinies.

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems dang po bskyed phyin chad /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems dang po bskyed phyin chad /
translated: there are bodhisattva great beings who, from the first production of the thought of awakening,

original: phyir mi ldog pa'i sa thob kyi bar du nam yang dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam mi gtong ba dag kyang yod do //
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa'i sa thob kyi bar du nam yang dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam mi gtong ba dag kyang yod do //
translated: never abandon the path of the ten virtuous actions until they attain the irreversible stage.

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing /
translated: there are bodhisattva great beings who, abiding in the perfection of generosity and the perfection of moral discipline,

original: 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal por gyur nas /
analyzed: 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal por gyur nas /
translated: become universal monarchs,

original: sems can rnams dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam rnams la 'god cing /
analyzed: sems can rnams dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam rnams la 'god cing /
translated: and establish sentient beings in the path of the ten virtuous actions.

original: sbyin pa dang / snyan par smra bas sems can rnams sdud pa dag kyang yod do //
analyzed: sbyin pa dang / snyan par smra bas sems can rnams sdud pa dag kyang yod do //
translated: They gather sentient beings through generosity and pleasant speech.

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la @63b gnas shing /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la @63b gnas shing /
translated: “Bodhisattva mahāsattvas who are established in the perfections of generosity and of conduct,

original: 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal srid du ma yongs su bzung nas 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal srid brgya stong du ma byed du 'jug cing /
analyzed: 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal srid du ma yongs su bzung nas 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal srid brgya stong du ma byed du 'jug cing /
translated: who have taken up many universal monarchies and who have caused many hundreds of thousands of universal monarchies to be established,

original: de la gnas nas sangs rgyas bye ba khrag khrig phrag 'bum phrag du ma mnyes par byed de /
analyzed: de la gnas nas sangs rgyas bye ba khrag khrig phrag 'bum phrag du ma mnyes par byed de /
translated: who, having been established in that, have pleased many quintillions of buddhas,

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag la yo byad thams cad dang / mchod pa thams cad kyis bsti stang du byed /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag la yo byad thams cad dang / mchod pa thams cad kyis bsti stang du byed /
translated: and who have honored those buddha bhagavāns with all requisites and all worship,

original: bla mar byed /
analyzed: bla mar byed /
translated: who have revered them,

original: ri mor byed cing mchod pa byed pa dag kyang yod de; sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: ri mor byed cing mchod pa byed pa dag kyang yod de; sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: who have made offerings to them, and who have made those offerings to those buddha bhagavāns with the thought of the Śākya Lion,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug la gnas nas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug la gnas nas /
translated: “Bodhisattva mahāsattvas who are established in the six perfections

original: sems can log par lta bu'i mun pa can rnams la sangs rgyas kyi chos kyis snang bar byed cing /
analyzed: sems can log par lta bu'i mun pa can rnams la sangs rgyas kyi chos kyis snang bar byed cing /
translated: They illuminate the darkness of wrong views for sentient beings.

original: bdag nyid kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas kyi bar du nam yang sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi snang ba de dang mi 'bral bar byed pa dag kyang yod de /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas kyi bar du nam yang sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi snang ba de dang mi 'bral bar byed pa dag kyang yod de /
translated: And they do not lose that illumination of the Buddha’s teachings until they fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect buddhahood.

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams la 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams la 'byung ba yin no //
translated: this is the arising of the bodhisattva great beings’ Buddha-dharmas.

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: de lta bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa'i lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyi las rnams kyi go mi dbye'o ////
analyzed: de lta bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa'i lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyi las rnams kyi go mi dbye'o ////
translated: therefore bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom should not engage in physical, verbal, or mental actions that are accompanied by wrongdoing.”🔽The Noble Great Vehicle Sūtra

original: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khri brgyad stong pa /
analyzed: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khri brgyad stong pa /
translated: The Perfection of Wisdom in Eighteen Thousand Lines

original: bam po bzhi pa /
analyzed: bam po bzhi pa /
translated: Chapter 4

original: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: The Blessed One having said that, the venerable Śāriputra said this to the Blessed One:

original: bcom ldan 'das /🔽byang chub sems dpa' @64a *//
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das / byang chub sems dpa' @64a *//
translated: “Blessed One,🔽what is the physical action with moral defilement,

original: sems dpa' chen po'i lus kyi las kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa dang / ngag gi las kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa dang / yid kyi las kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa gang lags /
analyzed: sems dpa' chen po'i lus kyi las kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa dang / ngag gi las kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa dang / yid kyi las kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa gang lags /
translated: the verbal action with moral defilement, and the mental action with moral defilement of bodhisattva great beings?

original: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: ” The Blessed One said to the venerable Śāriputra:

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: “Śāriputra,

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang gi tshe /
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang gi tshe /
translated: when bodhisattva great beings think like this:

original: 'di snyam du 'di ni lus yin te /
analyzed: 'di snyam du 'di ni lus yin te /
translated: ‘This is the body,

original: des lus kyi rtsom pa byed /
analyzed: des lus kyi rtsom pa byed /
translated: it creates the composition of the body.

original: 'di ni ngag yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni ngag yin te /
translated: This is speech,

original: des ngag gi rtsom pa byed /
analyzed: des ngag gi rtsom pa byed /
translated: it creates the composition of speech.

original: 'di ni yid yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni yid yin te /
translated: This is the mind,

original: des yid kyi rtsom pa byed do //
analyzed: des yid kyi rtsom pa byed do //
translated: it creates the composition of the mind.

original: snyam du sems na; sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: snyam du sems na; sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: ’ Śāriputra,

original: de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyi las rtsom pa kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa yin te /
analyzed: de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyi las rtsom pa kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa yin te /
translated: verbal, and mental activity.

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni lus mi dmigs /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni lus mi dmigs /
translated: the bodhisattva mahāsattva who practices the perfection of wisdom does not apprehend a body,

original: ngag mi dmigs /
analyzed: ngag mi dmigs /
translated: does not apprehend speech,

original: yid mi dmigs so //
analyzed: yid mi dmigs so //
translated: and does not apprehend mind.

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa la gal te lus dmigs pa dang / ngag dmigs pa dang / yid dmigs pa yod par gyur na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa la gal te lus dmigs pa dang / ngag dmigs pa dang / yid dmigs pa yod par gyur na /
translated: if the bodhisattva mahāsattva who practices the perfection of wisdom were to apprehend a body, apprehend speech, and apprehend mind,

original: de de'i tshe lus dang ngag dang yid des ser sna'i sems bskyed par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: de de'i tshe lus dang ngag dang yid des ser sna'i sems bskyed par 'gyur zhing /
translated: then at that time he would develop a miserly mind with regard to that body, speech, and mind,🔽and

original: 'chal pa'i tshul khrims kyi sems dang / gnod sems kyi sems dang / le lo'i sems dang / rnam par g-yeng ba'i sems dang / 'chal pa'i shes @64b rab kyi sems kyang bskyed par 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: 'chal pa'i tshul khrims kyi sems dang / gnod sems kyi sems dang / le lo'i sems dang / rnam par g-yeng ba'i sems dang / 'chal pa'i shes @64b rab kyi sems kyang bskyed par 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: He would not arouse a thought of immorality, a thought of malice, a thought of laziness, a thought of distraction, or a thought of stupidity.

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: de ltar na rig par mi bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar na rig par mi bya ste /
translated: it is not like that.

original: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyi gnas ngan len skyed pa de ni gnas med do //
analyzed: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyi gnas ngan len skyed pa de ni gnas med do //
translated: Because it is not possible that a bodhisattva great being practicing the perfection of wisdom would arouse the physical, verbal, or mental bad practices.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why is that?

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod pa ni lus kyi gnas ngan len sbyong ba dang / ngag gi gnas ngan len sbyong ba dang / yid kyi gnas ngan len sbyong bar byed pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod pa ni lus kyi gnas ngan len sbyong ba dang / ngag gi gnas ngan len sbyong ba dang / yid kyi gnas ngan len sbyong bar byed pa'i phyir te /
translated: it is because bodhisattva great beings practicing the six perfections purify the bad physical practices, purify the bad verbal practices, and purify the bad mental practices.

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las kha na ma tho ba med pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las kha na ma tho ba med pa yin no //
translated: This is the bodhisattva-mahāsattva’s unerring physical, verbal, and mental activity.

original: sh'a ri'i bus gsol pa /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bus gsol pa /
translated: Śāriputra said:

original: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ji ltar na lus dang ngag dang yid kyi gnas ngan len sbyong bar bgyid pa lags /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ji ltar na lus dang ngag dang yid kyi gnas ngan len sbyong bar bgyid pa lags /
translated: “Blessed One, how do bodhisattva-mahāsattvas purify the negative tendencies of body, speech, and mind?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: “Śāriputra,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'di ltar lus mi dmigs pa dang / ngag mi dmigs pa dang / yid mi dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'di ltar lus mi dmigs pa dang / ngag mi dmigs pa dang / yid mi dmigs pa ste /
translated: bodhisattva-mahāsattvas do not apprehend the body, do not apprehend speech, and do not apprehend the mind.

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyi gnas ngan len sbyong bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyi gnas ngan len sbyong bar byed pa yin no //
translated: in this way, bodhisattva-mahāsattvas purify the negative tendencies of body, speech, and mind.

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems dang po bskyed phyin chad dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam yang dag par blangs nas gnas te /
analyzed: gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems dang po bskyed phyin chad dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam yang dag par blangs nas gnas te /
translated: If a bodhisattva great being, from the time of their first arousal of the mind of awakening, takes up and follows the path of the ten virtuous actions,

original: nyan thos kyi sems sam /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi sems sam /
translated: and does not arouse the mindsets of the śrāvakas

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi @65a *//
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi @65a *//
translated: or pratyekabuddhas,

original: sems mi skyed par de rtag par sems can thams cad la snying rje chen po'i sems nye bar 'jog par byed na /🔽de lta bu ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyi gnas ngan len yongs su dag pa yin no //
analyzed: sems mi skyed par de rtag par sems can thams cad la snying rje chen po'i sems nye bar 'jog par byed na / de lta bu ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyi gnas ngan len yongs su dag pa yin no //
translated: and always keeps in mind the mindset of great compassion for all sentient beings,

original: zhes nga smra'o /
analyzed: zhes nga smra'o /
translated: I say that such a bodhisattva great being will purify the negative tendencies of body, speech, and mind.

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa byang chub kyi lam yongs su spyod pa ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa byang chub kyi lam yongs su spyod pa ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
translated: when bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom practice the path to awakening, they practice the perfection of generosity, the perfection of ethical discipline,

original: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dag kyang yod do //
analyzed: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dag kyang yod do //
translated: There are those who practice the perfection of patience, the perfection of diligence, the perfection of concentration, and the perfection of wisdom.

original: sh'a ri'i bus gsol pa /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bus gsol pa /
translated: Śāriputra said,

original: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi byang chub kyi lam gang lags /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi byang chub kyi lam gang lags /
translated: “Blessed One, what is the bodhisattva great beings’ path to awakening?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: “Śāriputra,

original: byang chub kyi lam gang la spyod na /
analyzed: byang chub kyi lam gang la spyod na /
translated: when they practice the path to awakening,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams lus mi dmigs /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams lus mi dmigs /
translated: bodhisattva great beings do not apprehend a body,

original: ngag mi dmigs /
analyzed: ngag mi dmigs /
translated: do not apprehend speech,

original: yid mi dmigs /
analyzed: yid mi dmigs /
translated: do not apprehend a mind,

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa mi dmigs /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa mi dmigs /
translated: do not apprehend the perfection of generosity,

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mi dmigs /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mi dmigs /
translated: do not apprehend the perfection of discipline,

original: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa mi dmigs /
analyzed: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa mi dmigs /
translated: do not apprehend the perfection of patience,

original: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mi dmigs /
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mi dmigs /
translated: do not apprehend the perfection of diligence,

original: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa mi dmigs /
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa mi dmigs /
translated: do not apprehend the perfection of concentration,🔽and

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mi dmigs /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mi dmigs /
translated: the perfection of wisdom is non-apprehensible,

original: nyan thos kyi theg pa @65b mi dmigs /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi theg pa @65b mi dmigs /
translated: the vehicle of the śrāvakas is non-apprehensible,

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa mi dmigs /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa mi dmigs /
translated: the vehicle of the pratyekabuddhas is non-apprehensible,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa mi dmigs /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa mi dmigs /
translated: the vehicle of the bodhisattvas is non-apprehensible,

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi theg pa mi dmigs shing /
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi theg pa mi dmigs shing /
translated: and the vehicle of the genuinely perfect buddhas is non-apprehensible.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: chos thams cad dmigs su med pa 'di ni /
analyzed: chos thams cad dmigs su med pa 'di ni /
translated: All phenomena are non-apprehensible.

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi byang chub kyi lam yin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi byang chub kyi lam yin te /
translated: this is the bodhisattvas’ path to enlightenment.

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po lam 'di nas 'gro zhing /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po lam 'di nas 'gro zhing /
translated: the bodhisattva great beings who travel this path

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod pa ni /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod pa ni /
translated: and practice the six perfections

original: sus kyang thul bar mi nus so //
analyzed: sus kyang thul bar mi nus so //
translated: cannot be subdued by anyone.

original: sh'a ri'i bus gsol pa /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bus gsol pa /
translated: Śāriputra then asked,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ji ltar spyod pa dag sus kyang mi thul ba lags /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ji ltar spyod pa dag sus kyang mi thul ba lags /
translated: how do the bodhisattva great beings practice so that they cannot be subdued by anyone?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replied,

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: “Śāriputra,

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod pa gzugs la rlom sems su mi byed pa dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa la rlom sems su mi byed pa dang /
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod pa gzugs la rlom sems su mi byed pa dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa la rlom sems su mi byed pa dang /
translated: and they do not falsely project feelings, perceptions, formative predispositions, and consciousness.

original: sa'i khams la rlom sems su mi byed pa dang / chu'i khams dang / me'i khams dang / rlung gi khams dang / nam mkha'i khams dang / rnam par shes pa'i khams la rlom sems su mi byed pa dang / mig dang / gzugs la rlom sems su mi byed pa dang /
analyzed: sa'i khams la rlom sems su mi byed pa dang / chu'i khams dang / me'i khams dang / rlung gi khams dang / nam mkha'i khams dang / rnam par shes pa'i khams la rlom sems su mi byed pa dang / mig dang / gzugs la rlom sems su mi byed pa dang /
translated: They do not falsely project the earth element, and they do not falsely project the water element, the fire element, the wind element, the space element, and the consciousness element. They do not falsely project the eyes and physical forms,

original: rna ba dang / sgra dang / sna dang / dri dang / lce dang / ro dang / lus dang / reg bya dang / yid dang / chos la rlom sems su mi byed pa dang / mig gi khams @66a *//
analyzed: rna ba dang / sgra dang / sna dang / dri dang / lce dang / ro dang / lus dang / reg bya dang / yid dang / chos la rlom sems su mi byed pa dang / mig gi khams @66a *//
translated: and they do not falsely project the ears and sounds, the nose and smells, the tongue and tastes, the body and touchable things, and the mental faculty and mental phenomena. They do not falsely project the sensory element of the eyes,🔽and they do not falsely project the sensory element of sights, the sensory element of eye-consciousness, and the sensory element of visual contact.

original: dang; gzugs kyi khams dang / mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams la rlom sems su mi byed pa dang / de bzhin du rna ba'i khams dang / sgra'i khams dang / rna ba'i rnam par shes pa'i khams dang / sna'i khams dang / dri'i khams dang /🔽sna'i rnam par shes pa'i khams dang / lce'i khams dang / ro'i khams dang / lce'i rnam par shes pa'i khams dang lus kyi khams dang / reg bya'i khams dang / lus kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams la rlom sems su mi byed pa dang /
analyzed: dang; gzugs kyi khams dang / mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams la rlom sems su mi byed pa dang / de bzhin du rna ba'i khams dang / sgra'i khams dang / rna ba'i rnam par shes pa'i khams dang / sna'i khams dang / dri'i khams dang / sna'i rnam par shes pa'i khams dang / lce'i khams dang / ro'i khams dang / lce'i rnam par shes pa'i khams dang lus kyi khams dang / reg bya'i khams dang / lus kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams la rlom sems su mi byed pa dang /
translated: They do not form mental constructs in relation to the form element and the eye-consciousness element. Similarly, they do not form mental constructs in relation to the ear element, the sound element, and the ear-consciousness element; the nose element, the smell element, and the nose-consciousness element; the tongue element, the taste element, and the tongue-consciousness element; the body element, the tangible-object element, and the body-consciousness element.

original: yid kyi khams la rlom sems su mi byed pa dang / chos kyi khams la rlom sems su mi byed pa dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams la rlom sems su mi byed pa dang / dran pa nye bar bzhag pa dang / yang dag par spong ba dang /
analyzed: yid kyi khams la rlom sems su mi byed pa dang / chos kyi khams la rlom sems su mi byed pa dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams la rlom sems su mi byed pa dang / dran pa nye bar bzhag pa dang / yang dag par spong ba dang /
translated: They do not form mental constructs in relation to the mind element, the dharma element, and the mind-consciousness element. They do not form mental constructs in relation to the applications of mindfulness, the right efforts,

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / lam rnams la rlom sems su mi byed pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la rlom sems su mi byed pa dang / tshul khrims dang /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / lam rnams la rlom sems su mi byed pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la rlom sems su mi byed pa dang / tshul khrims dang /
translated: the perfection of ethical discipline,🔽the perfection of patience,🔽the perfection of perseverance,🔽the perfection of concentration,

original: bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la rlom sems su mi byed pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu la rlom sems su mi byed pa dang; mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang /
analyzed: bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la rlom sems su mi byed pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu la rlom sems su mi byed pa dang; mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang /
translated: and the perfection of wisdom. They do not falsely project the ten powers of the tathāgatas, the four fearlessnesses,🔽the four detailed and thorough knowledges, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha. They do not falsely project the result of stream enterer, the result of once-returner,

original: so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la rlom sems su mi byed pa dang / rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la rlom @66b sems su mi byed pa dang / lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang /
analyzed: so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la rlom sems su mi byed pa dang / rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la rlom @66b sems su mi byed pa dang / lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang /
translated: the result of non-returner,

original: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid la rlom sems su mi byed pa dang / rang byang chub la rlom sems su mi byed pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' la rlom sems su mi byed pa dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la rlom sems su mi byed pa ste /
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid la rlom sems su mi byed pa dang / rang byang chub la rlom sems su mi byed pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' la rlom sems su mi byed pa dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la rlom sems su mi byed pa ste /
translated: or unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ltar pha rol tu phyin pa drug gis rnam par 'phel ba ni sus kyang mi thul ba yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ltar pha rol tu phyin pa drug gis rnam par 'phel ba ni sus kyang mi thul ba yin no //
translated: bodhisattva great beings who have thus developed through the six perfections cannot be overcome by anyone.

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug la gnas te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug la gnas te /
translated: bodhisattva great beings standing in the six perfections

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes yongs su rdzogs par byed cing /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes yongs su rdzogs par byed cing /
translated: perfect the knowledge of a knower of all aspects.

original: ye shes de dang ldan pas /
analyzed: ye shes de dang ldan pas /
translated: Endowed with that knowledge,

original: ngan song rnams kyi sgo thams cad gcod pa dang / dbul zhing rgud pa'i mir mi 'gyur ba dang / lus gang gis lha dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten na smad par 'gyur ba de lta bu'i lus yongs su 'dzin par mi 'gyur ba dag kyang yod do //
analyzed: ngan song rnams kyi sgo thams cad gcod pa dang / dbul zhing rgud pa'i mir mi 'gyur ba dang / lus gang gis lha dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten na smad par 'gyur ba de lta bu'i lus yongs su 'dzin par mi 'gyur ba dag kyang yod do //
translated: They will close all the doors to the lower realms. They will not be born in poverty or misfortune. They will not take on a body that is despised by the world and its gods.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the venerable Śāriputra asked the Lord,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Lord,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes gang lags /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes gang lags /
translated: what is the omniscience of bodhisattva great beings?”

original: bcom rnam 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom rnam 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: “Śāriputra,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ye shes de dang ldan pa ni shar phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag na bzhugs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa @67a *//
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ye shes de dang ldan pa ni shar phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag na bzhugs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa @67a *//
translated: bodhisattva great beings endowed with that knowledge see the tathāgatas, worthy ones, perfectly complete buddhas in the world systems in the eastern direction as numerous as the sands of the River Ganges.

original: dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag kyang mthong ngo //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag kyang mthong ngo //
translated: He sees as many arhat, perfect, complete buddhas as there are sand particles in the Gaṅgā River.

original: chos kyang nyan to //
analyzed: chos kyang nyan to //
translated: He hears the Dharma.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i dge 'dun yang mthong ngo; ;sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi yon tan bkod pa rnam par dag pa'ang mthong ngo //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i dge 'dun yang mthong ngo; ;sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi yon tan bkod pa rnam par dag pa'ang mthong ngo //
translated: He sees the bodhisattva saṅgha. He sees the pure array of the qualities of the buddha realm.

original: de bzhin du lho dang / nub dang / byang dang / byang shar dang / shar lho dang / lho nub dang / nub byang dang / 'og dang; steng gi phyogs kyi phyogs re rer yang 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag na bzhugs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag kyang mthong ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du lho dang / nub dang / byang dang / byang shar dang / shar lho dang / lho nub dang / nub byang dang / 'og dang; steng gi phyogs kyi phyogs re rer yang 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag na bzhugs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag kyang mthong ngo //
translated: In the same way, in each of the directions—south, west, north, northeast, southeast, southwest, northwest, below, and above—he sees as many tathāgatas, arhats, perfect, complete buddhas as there are sand particles in the Gaṅgā River.

original: chos kyang nyan to //
analyzed: chos kyang nyan to //
translated: He hears the Dharma.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i dge 'dun yang mthong ngo //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i dge 'dun yang mthong ngo //
translated: He sees the bodhisattva saṅgha.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi yon tan bkod pa rnam par dag pa'ang mthong ngo; ;ye shes de dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams ni sangs rgyas kyi 'du shes mi bskyed do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi yon tan bkod pa rnam par dag pa'ang mthong ngo; ;ye shes de dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams ni sangs rgyas kyi 'du shes mi bskyed do //
translated: Bodhisattva-mahāsattvas who possess that wisdom do not give rise to the notion of a buddha.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i 'du shes mi bskyed do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i 'du shes mi bskyed do //
translated: They do not give rise to the notion of a bodhisattva.

original: nyan thos kyi 'du shes dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi 'du shes dang / bdag gi 'du shes dang / gzhan gyi 'du shes dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi 'du shes mi bskyed do //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi 'du shes dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi 'du shes dang / bdag gi 'du shes dang / gzhan gyi 'du shes dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi 'du shes mi bskyed do //
translated: They do not give rise to the notions of a śrāvaka, a pratyekabuddha, a self, another, or a buddha-field.

original: ye shes de dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing /
analyzed: ye shes de dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing /
translated: Bodhisattvas who possess that wisdom practice the perfection of generosity.

original: de bzhin du tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu @67b phyin pa la'ang spyod de /
analyzed: de bzhin du tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu @67b phyin pa la'ang spyod de /
translated: Similarly, they practice the perfections of discipline, patience, diligence, concentration, and wisdom.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug dag kyang mi dmigs so //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug dag kyang mi dmigs so //
translated: They do not apprehend the six perfections.

original: ye shes de dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni /
analyzed: ye shes de dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni /
translated: The bodhisattva who is endowed with that wisdom

original: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams kyang bsgom la /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams kyang bsgom la /
translated: cultivates the applications of mindfulness,

original: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams kyang mi dmigs so //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams kyang mi dmigs so //
translated: but does not apprehend the applications of mindfulness.

original: yang dag pa'i spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / lam yang bsgom la /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / lam yang bsgom la /
translated: He cultivates the right efforts, the legs of miraculous power, the faculties, the powers, the branches of enlightenment, and the path,

original: yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / lam yang mi dmigs so //
analyzed: yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / lam yang mi dmigs so //
translated: but does not apprehend the right efforts, the legs of miraculous power, the faculties, the powers, the branches of enlightenment, and the path.

original: stobs rnams dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams kyang mi dmigs so //
analyzed: stobs rnams dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams kyang mi dmigs so //
translated: He does not apprehend the ten powers, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, or the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes yin te /
analyzed: de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes yin te /
translated: this is the knowledge of a bodhisattva great being’s aspects of the path.

original: ye shes de dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni /🔽sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byed kyang /
analyzed: ye shes de dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byed kyang /
translated: The bodhisattva mahāsattva who possesses that wisdom🔽perfects all the qualities of the buddhas,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: but does not see any of the qualities of the buddhas.

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /
translated: the bodhisattva mahāsattva who practices the perfection of wisdom

original: mig lnga 'thob pa dang / yongs su sbyong ba dag kyang yod de /
analyzed: mig lnga 'thob pa dang / yongs su sbyong ba dag kyang yod de /
translated: attains and purifies the five eyes.

original: lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are

original: sha'i mig dang / lha'i mig dang / shes rab kyi mig dang / chos kyi mig dang / sangs rgyas kyi mig go /
analyzed: sha'i mig dang / lha'i mig dang / shes rab kyi mig dang / chos kyi mig dang / sangs rgyas kyi mig go /
translated: the flesh eye, the divine eye, the wisdom eye, the Dharma eye, and the buddha eye.

original: sh'a ri'i bus gsol pa /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bus gsol pa /
translated: Śāriputra said,

original: bcom @68a *// ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom @68a *// ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sha'i mig yongs su dag pa gang lags /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sha'i mig yongs su dag pa gang lags /
translated: what is the bodhisattva mahāsattva’s pure flesh eye?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: “Śāriputra,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sha'i mig gis dpag tshad brgya mthong ba yod do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sha'i mig gis dpag tshad brgya mthong ba yod do //
translated: There are bodhisattva great beings whose flesh eye sees for a hundred yojanas.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sha'i mig gis dpag tshad nyis brgya mthong ba yod do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sha'i mig gis dpag tshad nyis brgya mthong ba yod do //
translated: There are bodhisattva great beings whose flesh eye sees for two hundred yojanas.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sha'i mig gis dzambu'i gling mthong ba yod do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sha'i mig gis dzambu'i gling mthong ba yod do //
translated: There are bodhisattva great beings whose flesh eye sees Jambudvīpa.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sha'i mig gis dzambu'i gling gnyis mthong ba yod do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sha'i mig gis dzambu'i gling gnyis mthong ba yod do //
translated: There are bodhisattva great beings whose flesh eye sees two Jambudvīpas.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sha'i mig gis gling bzhi pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams mthong ba yod do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sha'i mig gis gling bzhi pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams mthong ba yod do //
translated: There are bodhisattva great beings whose flesh eye sees a four-continent world system.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sha'i mig gis stong gi 'jig rten gyi khams mthong ba yod do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sha'i mig gis stong gi 'jig rten gyi khams mthong ba yod do //
translated: There are bodhisattva great beings whose flesh eye sees a world system of a billion worlds.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sha'i mig gis stong gnyis pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams mthong ba yod do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sha'i mig gis stong gnyis pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams mthong ba yod do //
translated: There are bodhisattva great beings whose flesh eye sees a double-billion world system.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sha'i mig gis stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams mthong ba yod de /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sha'i mig gis stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams mthong ba yod de /
translated: There are bodhisattva great beings whose flesh eye sees a triple-billion world system.

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sha'i mig yongs su dag pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sha'i mig yongs su dag pa yin no //
translated: this is the bodhisattva-mahāsattva’s purified fleshly eye.

original: sh'a ri'i bus gsol pa /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bus gsol pa /
translated: Śāriputra said,

original: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i lha'i mig yongs su dag pa gang lags /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i lha'i mig yongs su dag pa gang lags /
translated: “Blessed One, what is the bodhisattva-mahāsattva’s purified divine eye?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: sh'a ri'i bu /🔽rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lha rnams kyi lha'i mig gang yin pa de ni byang chub @68b sems dpas rab tu shes so //
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu / rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lha rnams kyi lha'i mig gang yin pa de ni byang chub @68b sems dpas rab tu shes so //
translated: “Śāriputra,🔽the bodhisattva knows the divine eye of the gods of the Catur­mahā­rāja­kāyika realm.

original: sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams dang / 'thab bral dang / dga' ldan dang / 'phrul dga' dang / gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi lha rnams kyi lha'i mig gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpas rab tu shes so //
analyzed: sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams dang / 'thab bral dang / dga' ldan dang / 'phrul dga' dang / gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi lha rnams kyi lha'i mig gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpas rab tu shes so //
translated: The bodhisattva knows the divine eye of the gods of the Trāyastriṃśa, Yāmā, Tuṣita, Nirmāṇa­rata, and Para­nirmita­vaśa­vartin realms.

original: tshangs pa'i mdun na 'don dang / tshangs ris dang / tshangs 'khor dang / 'od chung dang / tshad med 'od dang / 'od gsal dang / dge chung dang / tshad med dge dang / dge rgyas dang / sprin med dang / bsod nams skyes dang /
analyzed: tshangs pa'i mdun na 'don dang / tshangs ris dang / tshangs 'khor dang / 'od chung dang / tshad med 'od dang / 'od gsal dang / dge chung dang / tshad med dge dang / dge rgyas dang / sprin med dang / bsod nams skyes dang /
translated: the Brahmakāyika, Brahmapurohita, Mahābrahma, Parīttābha, Apramāṇābha, Ābhāsvara, Parīttaśubha, Apramāṇaśubha, Śubhakṛtsna, Anabhraka, Puṇyaprasava,

original: 'bras bu che dang / sems can 'du shes med pa dang / gnas gtsang ma dang / mi che ba dang / mi gdung ba dang / gya nom snang dang / shin tu mthong dang / 'og min gyi lha rnams kyi lha'i mig gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpas rab tu shes so //
analyzed: 'bras bu che dang / sems can 'du shes med pa dang / gnas gtsang ma dang / mi che ba dang / mi gdung ba dang / gya nom snang dang / shin tu mthong dang / 'og min gyi lha rnams kyi lha'i mig gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpas rab tu shes so //
translated: Bṛhatphala, Asaṃjñisattva, Śuddhāvāsa, Avṛha, Atapa, Sudarśana, and Akaniṣṭha gods do not know the divine eye of the bodhisattva.

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i lha'i mig gang yin pa de ni rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lha rnams kyis mi shes so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i lha'i mig gang yin pa de ni rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lha rnams kyis mi shes so //
translated: the divine eye of the bodhisattva-mahāsattva is not known to the gods of the Catur­mahā­rāja­kāyika realm.🔽Connect this in the same way with each,

original: gong ma bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: gong ma bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: up to

original: byang chub sems dpa'i lha'i mig gang yin pa de ni 'og min gyi bar gyi lha rnams kyis mi shes so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i lha'i mig gang yin pa de ni 'og min gyi bar gyi lha rnams kyis mi shes so //
translated: The divine eye of the bodhisattva is not known by the gods up to the highest heaven.

original: lha'i mig yongs su dag pa de nyid kyis shar phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag na 'khod pa'i sems can rnams kyi 'chi 'pho dang skye ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //🔽de bzhin du lho dang / nub dang / byang dang / phyogs mtshams dang / 'og dang / steng gi phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams @69a *//
analyzed: lha'i mig yongs su dag pa de nyid kyis shar phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag na 'khod pa'i sems can rnams kyi 'chi 'pho dang skye ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so // de bzhin du lho dang / nub dang / byang dang / phyogs mtshams dang / 'og dang / steng gi phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams @69a *//
translated: With that very pure divine eye, he knows the deaths and rebirths of beings in the eastern direction in worlds as numerous as the sands of the Ganges River, just as they are.

original: gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag na 'khod pa'i sems can rnams kyi 'chi 'pho dang / skye ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes te /
analyzed: gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag na 'khod pa'i sems can rnams kyi 'chi 'pho dang / skye ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes te /
translated: In the same way, he knows the deaths and rebirths of beings in the southern, western, and northern directions, in the intermediate directions, below and above, in worlds as numerous as the sands of the Ganges River, just as they are.

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i lha'i mig yongs su dag pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i lha'i mig yongs su dag pa yin no //
translated: this is the bodhisattva-mahāsattva's pure divine eye.

original: sh'a ri'i bus gsol pa /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bus gsol pa /
translated: Śāriputra said:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i shes rab kyi mig yongs su dag pa gang lags /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i shes rab kyi mig yongs su dag pa gang lags /
translated: what is the pure eye of wisdom of bodhisattva great beings?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: “Śāriputra,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i shes rab kyi mig de dang ldan pa ni 'dus byas sam /🔽'dus ma byas sam; dge ba'am /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i shes rab kyi mig de dang ldan pa ni 'dus byas sam / 'dus ma byas sam; dge ba'am /
translated: bodhisattva great beings who have that eye of wisdom do not know any conditioned or unconditioned phenomena,

original: mi dge ba'am /🔽kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa'am /🔽kha na ma tho ba med pa'am /🔽zag pa dang bcas pa'am /
analyzed: mi dge ba'am / kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa'am / kha na ma tho ba med pa'am / zag pa dang bcas pa'am /
translated: any virtuous or nonvirtuous phenomena,🔽any phenomena that are reprehensible or irreproachable,

original: zag pa med pa'am /🔽nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa'am /
analyzed: zag pa med pa'am / nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa'am /
translated: any phenomena that are with or without outflows,

original: nyon mongs pa med pa'am /🔽'jig rten pa'am /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa med pa'am / 'jig rten pa'am /
translated: any phenomena that are afflicted or unafflicted,

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'am /🔽kun nas nyon mongs pa'am /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'am / kun nas nyon mongs pa'am /
translated: any mundane or supramundane phenomena,

original: rnam par byang ba'i chos gang yang mi shes pa med do //
analyzed: rnam par byang ba'i chos gang yang mi shes pa med do //
translated: or any phenomena that are related to the afflictive or purified aspects.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi mig de dang ldan pa ni chos gang yang ma mthong ba'am /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi mig de dang ldan pa ni chos gang yang ma mthong ba'am /
translated: Bodhisattva great beings who have that eye of wisdom do not see any phenomena,

original: ma thos pa'am /
analyzed: ma thos pa'am /
translated: do not hear any phenomena,

original: mi dran pa'am /
analyzed: mi dran pa'am /
translated: Not remembering,🔽🔽

original: rnam par mi shes par gyur pa ci'ang med de /
analyzed: rnam par mi shes par gyur pa ci'ang med de /
translated: There is nothing at all that he does not remember or know.

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i shes rab kyi mig yongs su dag pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i shes rab kyi mig yongs su dag pa yin no //
translated: this is the purity of the bodhisattva-mahāsattva’s eye of wisdom.

original: sh'a ri'i bus gsol pa /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bus gsol pa /
translated: Śāriputra said,

original: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i @69b chos kyi mig yongs su dag pa gang lags /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i @69b chos kyi mig yongs su dag pa gang lags /
translated: “Blessed One, what is the purity of the bodhisattva-mahāsattva’s eye of Dharma?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: “Śāriputra,

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i chos kyi mig gis gang zag 'di ni dad pas rjes su 'brang ba'o //
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i chos kyi mig gis gang zag 'di ni dad pas rjes su 'brang ba'o //
translated: with the eye of Dharma, the bodhisattva-mahāsattva sees, ‘This person is a follower of faith.

original: 'di ni chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba'o //🔽'di ni stong pa nyid la gnas pa /
analyzed: 'di ni chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba'o // 'di ni stong pa nyid la gnas pa /
translated: This person is a follower of the Dharma.🔽This person abides in emptiness.

original: 'di ni mtshan ma med pa la gnas pa /
analyzed: 'di ni mtshan ma med pa la gnas pa /
translated: This person abides in signlessness.

original: 'di ni smon pa med pa la gnas pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ni smon pa med pa la gnas pa ste /
translated: This person abides in wishlessness.

original: rnam par thar pa'i sgo rnams kyis gang zag de'i dbang po lnga po dag skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa'i sgo rnams kyis gang zag de'i dbang po lnga po dag skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Through the doors of liberation, the five faculties of that person will arise.

original: dbang po lngas bar chad med pa'i ting nge 'dzin la reg par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dbang po lngas bar chad med pa'i ting nge 'dzin la reg par 'gyur ro //
translated: By means of the five faculties, one touches the concentration that is free from obstacles.

original: bar chad med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba bskyed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bar chad med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba bskyed par 'gyur ro //
translated: By means of the concentration that is free from obstacles, one generates the insight of liberation.

original: rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong bas 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / the tshom dang / tshul khrims dang / brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa'i kun tu sbyor ba gsum spong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong bas 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / the tshom dang / tshul khrims dang / brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa'i kun tu sbyor ba gsum spong bar 'gyur te /
translated: By means of the insight of liberation, one abandons the three fetters: the view of the transitory collection, doubt, and holding a discipline and ritual to be paramount.

original: gang zag de ni rgyun du zhugs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang zag de ni rgyun du zhugs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: That person is called a stream-enterer.

original: des sgom pa'i lam thob nas 'dod pa la 'dod chags dang / gnod sems srab mor byed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: des sgom pa'i lam thob nas 'dod pa la 'dod chags dang / gnod sems srab mor byed par 'gyur te /
translated: Having attained the path of cultivation, one weakens attachment to the desire realm and malice.

original: gang zag de ni lan gcig phyir 'ong ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang zag de ni lan gcig phyir 'ong ba zhes bya'o //
translated: That person is called a once-returner.

original: des lam de nyid shas cher bsgoms pas 'dod pa la 'dod chags dang / gnod sems spong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: des lam de nyid shas cher bsgoms pas 'dod pa la 'dod chags dang / gnod sems spong bar 'gyur te /
translated: Having cultivated that path to a high degree, one abandons attachment to the desire realm and malice.

original: gang zag de ni phyir mi 'ong ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang zag de ni phyir mi 'ong ba zhes bya'o //
translated: That person is called a non-returner.

original: des lam de nyid shas cher bsgoms pas gzugs la 'dod chags dang / gzugs med pa la 'dod chags dang / ma rig pa dang / nga rgyal dang / rgod pa spong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: des lam de nyid shas cher bsgoms pas gzugs la 'dod chags dang / gzugs med pa la 'dod chags dang / ma rig pa dang / nga rgyal dang / rgod pa spong bar 'gyur te /
translated: By cultivating that path, he abandons attachment to the form realm, attachment to the formless realm, ignorance, pride, and excitation.

original: gang zag de ni dgra bcom pa @70a *//
analyzed: gang zag de ni dgra bcom pa @70a *//
translated: That person is called an arhat.

original: zhes bya'o // gang zag 'di ni stong pa nyid la gnas pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya'o // gang zag 'di ni stong pa nyid la gnas pa ste /
translated: This person abides in emptiness.

original: rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid kyis dbang po lnga po dag thob par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid kyis dbang po lnga po dag thob par 'gyur zhing /
translated: By means of the emptiness gate of liberation, he attains the five faculties.

original: bar chad med pa'i ting nge 'dzin la reg par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bar chad med pa'i ting nge 'dzin la reg par 'gyur ro //
translated: He touches the uninterrupted samādhi.🔽The uninterrupted samādhi generates the wisdom that sees liberation.

original: bar chad med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba bskyed par 'gyur ro //🔽zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: bar chad med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba bskyed par 'gyur ro // zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Through the uninterrupted samādhi, the wisdom of liberation will be generated.🔽🔽

original: dgra bcom pa nyid thob par 'gyur ro //🔽zhes bya ba'i bar du snga ma bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa nyid thob par 'gyur ro // zhes bya ba'i bar du snga ma bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: He attains arhatship.🔽…

original: gang zag 'di ni mtshan ma med pa la gnas pa ste /
analyzed: gang zag 'di ni mtshan ma med pa la gnas pa ste /
translated: This person abides in signlessness.

original: rnam par thar pa'i sgo mtshan ma med pas dbang po lnga po dag thob par 'gyur /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa'i sgo mtshan ma med pas dbang po lnga po dag thob par 'gyur /
translated: Through the signless gate of liberation, they will attain the five faculties.🔽… they will attain arhatship.

original: zhes bya ba nas; dgra bcom pa nyid thob par 'gyur ro //🔽zhes bya ba'i bar du snga ma bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba nas; dgra bcom pa nyid thob par 'gyur ro // zhes bya ba'i bar du snga ma bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: and so on, up to:🔽they will attain arhatship.🔽🔽

original: gang zag 'di ni smon pa med pa la gnas pa ste /
analyzed: gang zag 'di ni smon pa med pa la gnas pa ste /
translated: “This person is abiding in the wishless,

original: rnam par thar pa'i sgo smon pa med pas dbang po lnga po dag thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa'i sgo smon pa med pas dbang po lnga po dag thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: through the wishless gate of liberation, they will attain the five faculties.

original: de nas bar chad med pa'i ting nge 'dzin la reg par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de nas bar chad med pa'i ting nge 'dzin la reg par 'gyur te /
translated: Then they will reach the uninterrupted samādhi.

original: bar chad med pa'i ting nge 'dzin thob nas /
analyzed: bar chad med pa'i ting nge 'dzin thob nas /
translated: Having attained the uninterrupted samādhi,

original: rnam par grol ba ye shes mthong ba skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba ye shes mthong ba skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: the knowledge-vision of liberation will arise.

original: zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: zhes bya ba nas /
translated: and so on.🔽🔽

original: dgra bcom pa nyid thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa nyid thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: … they will attain arhatship.

original: zhes bya ba'i bar du shes te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i bar du shes te /
translated: This is understood.🔽🔽

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: “Śāriputra,

original: de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i chos kyi mig yongs su dag pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i chos kyi mig yongs su dag pa yin no //
translated: this is the bodhisattva great beings’ pure Dharma eye.

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpas 'di ltar kun 'byung ba'i chos gang ci yod pa de thams cad 'gog pa'i chos yin no zhes bya bar @70b rtogs nas /
analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpas 'di ltar kun 'byung ba'i chos gang ci yod pa de thams cad 'gog pa'i chos yin no zhes bya bar @70b rtogs nas /
translated: Moreover, the bodhisattva realizes that whatever is a phenomenon of origination is also a phenomenon of cessation.

original: dad pa la sogs pa dbang po lnga 'thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: dad pa la sogs pa dbang po lnga 'thob par 'gyur te /
translated: He attains the five faculties of faith and so on.

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: de'ang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i chos kyi mig yongs su dag pa yin no //
analyzed: de'ang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i chos kyi mig yongs su dag pa yin no //
translated: this is the bodhisattva great being’s pure eye of Dharma.

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'di ni sems dang po bskyed pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'di ni sems dang po bskyed pa ste /
translated: further, the bodhisattva great being thinks, ‘This bodhisattva great being has given rise to the first thought of awakening.

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar la spyod cing /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar la spyod cing /
translated: He practices the perfection of generosity, the perfection of ethical discipline, up to the perfection of wisdom.

original: de de nas dad pa'i dbang po dang / brtson 'grus kyi dbang po thob la /
analyzed: de de nas dad pa'i dbang po dang / brtson 'grus kyi dbang po thob la /
translated: He attains the faculty of faith and the faculty of perseverance.

original: de thabs la mkhas pa dang yang ldan /
analyzed: de thabs la mkhas pa dang yang ldan /
translated: He is also skilled in means.

original: dge ba'i rtsa bas kyang brtan pas /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa bas kyang brtan pas /
translated: and because of his firm roots of virtue,

original: bsam bzhin du lus yongs su 'dzin te /
analyzed: bsam bzhin du lus yongs su 'dzin te /
translated: he takes up a body as he wishes.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'di ni rgyal rigs shing s'a la chen po lta bu rnams su skye bar 'gyur /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'di ni rgyal rigs shing s'a la chen po lta bu rnams su skye bar 'gyur /
translated: This bodhisattva mahāsattva will be reborn in the great sāla tree–like royal families.

original: 'di ni bram ze'i rigs shing s'a la chen po lta bu rnams su skye bar 'gyur /
analyzed: 'di ni bram ze'i rigs shing s'a la chen po lta bu rnams su skye bar 'gyur /
translated: He will be reborn in the great sāla tree–like brahmin families.

original: 'di ni khyim bdag gi rigs shing s'a la chen po lta bu rnams su skye bar 'gyur /
analyzed: 'di ni khyim bdag gi rigs shing s'a la chen po lta bu rnams su skye bar 'gyur /
translated: He will be reborn in the great sāla tree–like business families.

original: 'di ni rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lha rnams kyi nang du skye bar 'gyur /
analyzed: 'di ni rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lha rnams kyi nang du skye bar 'gyur /
translated: He will be reborn among the Cāturmahārājika gods.

original: 'di ni sum cu rtsa gsum ba rnams su /
analyzed: 'di ni sum cu rtsa gsum ba rnams su /
translated: He will be reborn among the Trāyastriṃśa gods.

original: 'di ni 'thab bral du /🔽'di ni dga' ldan du /🔽'di ni 'phrul dgar /
analyzed: 'di ni 'thab bral du / 'di ni dga' ldan du / 'di ni 'phrul dgar /
translated: He will be reborn among the Yāma gods.🔽He will be reborn among the Tuṣita gods.🔽He will be reborn among the Nirmāṇarati gods.

original: 'di ni gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi lha rnams su skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ni gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi lha rnams su skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: He will be reborn among the Para­nirmita­vaśa­vartin gods.

original: de der gnas nas sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed par yang 'gyur te /
analyzed: de der gnas nas sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed par yang 'gyur te /
translated: And he will be reborn there and will bring beings to maturity.

original: bde ba'i yo byad thams cad kyis sems can de dag la nye bar gnas par yang 'gyur /
analyzed: bde ba'i yo byad thams cad kyis sems can de dag la nye bar gnas par yang 'gyur /
translated: They will be present for those beings with all the requisites for happiness.

original: @71a *// sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byed par yang 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: @71a *// sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byed par yang 'gyur zhing /
translated: They will purify a buddhafield.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams la mnyes par byed par 'gyur /🔽bsti stang du byed par 'gyur /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams la mnyes par byed par 'gyur / bsti stang du byed par 'gyur /
translated: They will please the tathāgatas, the arhats, the perfectly enlightened buddhas.🔽They will honor them,

original: bla mar byed par 'gyur /🔽ri mor byed par 'gyur /
analyzed: bla mar byed par 'gyur / ri mor byed par 'gyur /
translated: they will respect them,🔽they will revere them,

original: mchod par byed par 'gyur la /🔽nyan thos kyi sa'am /
analyzed: mchod par byed par 'gyur la / nyan thos kyi sa'am /
translated: they will make offerings to them.🔽They will not fall to the śrāvaka level

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi sar ltung bar yang mi 'gyur te /🔽byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'di ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas kyi bar du phyir ldog par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi sar ltung bar yang mi 'gyur te / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'di ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas kyi bar du phyir ldog par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: or to the pratyekabuddha level.

original: zhes bya bar rab tu shes te /
analyzed: zhes bya bar rab tu shes te /
translated: This bodhisattva mahāsattva will not turn back until he has attained the knowledge of an omniscient one.’

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: “Śāriputra,

original: de'ang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i chos kyi mig yongs su dag pa yin no //
analyzed: de'ang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i chos kyi mig yongs su dag pa yin no //
translated: This is the bodhisattva-mahāsattva’s pure Dharma eye.

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra!

original: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'di dag ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'di dag ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung bstan pa'o //
translated: Moreover, Śāriputra, the bodhisattva-mahāsattva should think like this: ‘These bodhisattva-mahāsattvas have received the prophecy;

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'di dag ni lung ma bstan pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'di dag ni lung ma bstan pa'o //
translated: these bodhisattva-mahāsattvas have not received the prophecy.

original: 'di dag ni nges pa'o //
analyzed: 'di dag ni nges pa'o //
translated: These are definite;

original: 'di dag ni ma nges pa'o //
analyzed: 'di dag ni ma nges pa'o //
translated: these are indefinite.

original: 'di dag ni lung bstan par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'di dag ni lung bstan par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: These will receive the prophecy;

original: 'di dag ni lung bstan par mi 'gyur ba'o //🔽'di dag ni phyir mi ldog pa'o //
analyzed: 'di dag ni lung bstan par mi 'gyur ba'o // 'di dag ni phyir mi ldog pa'o //
translated: these will not receive the prophecy.🔽These are irreversible;

original: 'di dag ni phyir mi ldog pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'di dag ni phyir mi ldog pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: these are not irreversible.

original: 'di'i mngon par shes pa rnams ni yongs su rdzogs so //
analyzed: 'di'i mngon par shes pa rnams ni yongs su rdzogs so //
translated: The higher cognitions of this one are complete;

original: 'di'i mngon par shes pa rnams ni yongs su ma rdzogs @71b so; ;byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'di ni mngon par shes pa rnams yongs su rdzogs pas shar phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag tu song zhing /
