analyzed: 'di'i mngon par shes pa rnams ni yongs su ma rdzogs @71b so; ;byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'di ni mngon par shes pa rnams yongs su rdzogs pas shar phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag tu song zhing /
translated: but this bodhisattva has perfected his superknowledges and has gone to the world systems in the east, as numerous as the sands of the River Ganges,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams mnyes par byed /🔽bsnyen bkur byed /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams mnyes par byed / bsnyen bkur byed /
translated: and has pleased the tathāgatas, arhats, perfectly enlightened buddhas,🔽has served them,

original: bsti stang du byed /🔽bla mar byed /🔽ri mor byed /
analyzed: bsti stang du byed / bla mar byed / ri mor byed /
translated: has venerated them,🔽has respected them,

original: mchod pa byed do //
analyzed: mchod pa byed do //
translated: has made offerings to them,🔽and has made offerings to the Dharma.

original: de bzhin du lho dang; nub dang / byang dang / byang shar dang / shar lho dang / lho nub dang / nub byang dang / 'og dang / steng gi phyogs kyi phyogs re rer yang 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag tu song zhing; de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams mnyes par byed /🔽bsnyen bkur byed /
analyzed: de bzhin du lho dang; nub dang / byang dang / byang shar dang / shar lho dang / lho nub dang / nub byang dang / 'og dang / steng gi phyogs kyi phyogs re rer yang 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag tu song zhing; de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams mnyes par byed / bsnyen bkur byed /
translated: southeast,🔽southwest,🔽northwest,🔽nadir, and zenith—🔽and they please the tathāgatas, arhats, perfectly enlightened buddhas there,🔽serve them,🔽honor them,

original: bsti stang du byed /🔽bla mar byed /🔽ri mor byed /
analyzed: bsti stang du byed / bla mar byed / ri mor byed /
translated: revere them,

original: mchod pa byed do;/
analyzed: mchod pa byed do;/
translated: and make offerings to them.

original: 'di ni mngon par shes pa rnams 'thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ni mngon par shes pa rnams 'thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: “They attain the superknowledges.

original: 'di ni mngon par shes pa rnams 'thob par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ni mngon par shes pa rnams 'thob par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: They do not attain the superknowledges.

original: 'di ni bzod pa thob pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni bzod pa thob pa'o //
translated: They attain patience.

original: 'di ni bzod pa ma thob pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni bzod pa ma thob pa'o //
translated: They do not attain patience.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'di'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing ni yongs su dag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'di'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing ni yongs su dag par 'gyur ro //
translated: This bodhisattva mahāsattva will purify a buddhafield.

original: 'di'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing ni yongs su dag par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing ni yongs su dag par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: His buddha-field will not be purified.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'di ni smon lam chen po dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'di ni smon lam chen po dang ldan pa'o //
translated: This bodhisattva-mahāsattva has great aspirations.

original: 'di ni smon lam chen po dang mi ldan pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni smon lam chen po dang mi ldan pa'o //
translated: This one does not have great aspirations.

original: 'di ni sems can yongs su smin par byas so //
analyzed: 'di ni sems can yongs su smin par byas so //
translated: This one has brought beings to maturity.

original: 'dis ni sems can yongs su smin par ma byas @72a *//
analyzed: 'dis ni sems can yongs su smin par ma byas @72a *//
translated: This one has not brought beings to maturity.

original: so; ;byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'di la ni phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag gi sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams bsngags pa brjod pa mdzad do //
analyzed: so; ;byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'di la ni phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag gi sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams bsngags pa brjod pa mdzad do //
translated: The blessed buddhas in the world systems of the ten directions, as numerous as the sands of the Ganges river, praise this bodhisattva-mahāsattva.

original: 'di la ni bsngags pa brjod par mi mdzad do //
analyzed: 'di la ni bsngags pa brjod par mi mdzad do //
translated: They do not praise this one.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'di dag ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang nye bar gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'di dag ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang nye bar gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: These bodhisattva-mahāsattvas will dwell in the presence of the blessed buddhas.

original: 'di dag ni nye bar gnas par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di dag ni nye bar gnas par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: These will not dwell in their presence.

original: byang chub sems dpa' 'di'i tshe ni dpag tu yod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' 'di'i tshe ni dpag tu yod par 'gyur ro //
translated: This bodhisattva’s lifespan will be limited.

original: 'di'i tshe ni dpag tu med par 'gyur ro //🔽'di'i 'od dang / dbyangs dang; dge slong gi dge 'dun ni dpag tu med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di'i tshe ni dpag tu med par 'gyur ro // 'di'i 'od dang / dbyangs dang; dge slong gi dge 'dun ni dpag tu med par 'gyur ro //
translated: This bodhisattva’s lifespan will be unlimited.🔽This bodhisattva’s light, voice, and saṅgha of monks will be unlimited.

original: 'di ni dpag tu yod par 'gyur ro //🔽byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'di ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas byang chub sems dpa'i dge 'dun dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ni dpag tu yod par 'gyur ro // byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'di ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas byang chub sems dpa'i dge 'dun dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: This bodhisattva’s light, voice, and saṅgha of monks will be limited.🔽This bodhisattva, having fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, will have a saṅgha of bodhisattvas.

original: 'di ni ldan par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ni ldan par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: This bodhisattva will not have a saṅgha of bodhisattvas.

original: 'di ni dka' ba spyad pa spyod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ni dka' ba spyad pa spyod par 'gyur ro //
translated: This bodhisattva will practice austerities.

original: 'di ni spyod par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ni spyod par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: This bodhisattva will not practice austerities.

original: 'di ni srid pa tha ma pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni srid pa tha ma pa'o //
translated: This bodhisattva is in his last existence.

original: 'di ni srid pa tha ma pa ma yin no //🔽'di ni byang chub kyi snying po la 'dug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ni srid pa tha ma pa ma yin no // 'di ni byang chub kyi snying po la 'dug par 'gyur ro //
translated: This bodhisattva is not in his last existence.🔽This bodhisattva will sit at the site of awakening.

original: 'di ni 'dug par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ni 'dug par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: This bodhisattva will not sit at the site of awakening.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'di dag la ni bdud 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'di dag la ni bdud 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: “These bodhisattva great beings have māras,

original: 'di dag la ni 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //🔽zhes bya bar rab tu shes te /
analyzed: 'di dag la ni 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro // zhes bya bar rab tu shes te /
translated: and these do not.”

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: de'ang byang chub @72b sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i chos kyi mig yongs su dag pa yin no //
analyzed: de'ang byang chub @72b sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i chos kyi mig yongs su dag pa yin no //
translated: that is the bodhisattva great beings’ pure Dharma eye.

original: sh'a ri'i bus gsol pa /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bus gsol pa /
translated: Śāriputra then asked,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Lord,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sangs rgyas kyi mig yongs su dag pa gang lags /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sangs rgyas kyi mig yongs su dag pa gang lags /
translated: what is the bodhisattva great beings’ pure buddha eye?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: “Śāriputra,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byang chub kyi sems kyi mjug thogs su rdo rje lta bu zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par byed de /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byang chub kyi sems kyi mjug thogs su rdo rje lta bu zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par byed de /
translated: bodhisattva great beings, immediately after the thought of awakening, having entered the diamond-like meditative stabilization, attain the knowledge of path aspects.

original: de ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang ldan pa yin /
analyzed: de ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang ldan pa yin /
translated: They have the ten tathāgata powers,

original: mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi rnam par thar pa sgrib pa med pa dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi rnam par thar pa sgrib pa med pa dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha, great love, great compassion, and the unobstructed liberation of a buddha.

original: de ni de'i mig yin te /
analyzed: de ni de'i mig yin te /
translated: That is his eye.

original: mig de dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ni rnam pa thams cad du ma mthong ba'am /🔽ma thos pa'am /
analyzed: mig de dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ni rnam pa thams cad du ma mthong ba'am / ma thos pa'am /
translated: The bodhisattva mahāsattva who has that eye does not see anything at all that is not seen,

original: mi dran pa'am /
analyzed: mi dran pa'am /
translated: does not hear anything at all that is not heard,🔽does not think of anything at all that is not thought of,

original: rnam par mi shes pa ci'ang med de; sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: rnam par mi shes pa ci'ang med de; sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: and does not cognize anything at all that is not cognized.

original: de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i sangs rgyas kyi mig yongs su dag pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i sangs rgyas kyi mig yongs su dag pa yin no //
translated: Śāriputra, that is the purified buddha eye of the bodhisattva mahāsattva who has fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: de lta bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po mig lnga yongs su sbyong bar 'dod pa dang / thob par 'dod pas pha rol tu phyin pa drug la brtson par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po mig lnga yongs su sbyong bar 'dod pa dang / thob par 'dod pas pha rol tu phyin pa drug la brtson par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, Śāriputra, bodhisattva great beings who want to purify the five eyes and want to attain them should make an effort at the six perfections.

original: @73a *// de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: @73a *// de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: 'di ltar dge ba'i chos thams cad dang / nyan thos kyi chos thams cad dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad dang / byang chub sems dpa'i chos thams cad dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi nang du 'dus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar dge ba'i chos thams cad dang / nyan thos kyi chos thams cad dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad dang / byang chub sems dpa'i chos thams cad dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi nang du 'dus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: it is because all wholesome dharmas, all śrāvaka dharmas, all pratyekabuddha dharmas, all bodhisattva dharmas, and all buddha dharmas are included in the six perfections.

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa der dge ba'i chos thams cad 'dus so //🔽zhes yang dag par smra bas smra na /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa der dge ba'i chos thams cad 'dus so // zhes yang dag par smra bas smra na /
translated: all wholesome dharmas are included in the perfection of wisdom.🔽If someone were to say, ‘The perfection of wisdom does not include all wholesome dharmas,’

original: yang dag par smra bas smra ba yin no //
analyzed: yang dag par smra bas smra ba yin no //
translated: they would not be speaking correctly.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad dang mig lnga po de dag skyed pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad dang mig lnga po de dag skyed pa ste /
translated: Thus, the perfection of wisdom gives rise to all the perfections and those five eyes.

original: mig lnga po de dag la bslabs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mig lnga po de dag la bslabs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the bodhisattva great being who trains in those five eyes will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa de ni mngon par shes pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa 'thob cing; des rdzu 'phrul bya ba rnam pa du ma myong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa de ni mngon par shes pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa 'thob cing; des rdzu 'phrul bya ba rnam pa du ma myong bar 'gyur te /
translated: the bodhisattva great being who practices the perfection of wisdom attains the perfection of the superknowledges, and through that he experiences the performance of many kinds of miracles.

original: de sa'ang g-yo bar byed do //🔽gcig tu gyur nas mang por 'gyur ba dang / mang por gyur nas kyang gcig tu 'gyur ba dang / snang bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: de sa'ang g-yo bar byed do // gcig tu gyur nas mang por 'gyur ba dang / mang por gyur nas kyang gcig tu 'gyur ba dang / snang bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: He shakes the earth.

original: mi snang bar 'gyur ba'ang myong bar byed do //
analyzed: mi snang bar 'gyur ba'ang myong bar byed do //
translated: He becomes one and then many, and having become many he becomes one again. He experiences being visible and invisible.

original: rtsig pa la'ang thad kar 'gro'o //
analyzed: rtsig pa la'ang thad kar 'gro'o //
translated: They can also pass through walls.

original: ra ba la'ang thad kar 'gro'o //
analyzed: ra ba la'ang thad kar 'gro'o //
translated: They can also pass through fences.

original: ri la'ang lus mi thogs par thad kar 'gro ste /
analyzed: ri la'ang lus mi thogs par thad kar 'gro ste /
translated: They can also pass through mountains without their bodies being obstructed,

original: dper na @73b nam mkha' la bya ba bzhin no //🔽nam mkha' la'ang skyil mo krung bcas nas 'gro ste /🔽dper na / 'dab chags bya bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na @73b nam mkha' la bya ba bzhin no // nam mkha' la'ang skyil mo krung bcas nas 'gro ste / dper na / 'dab chags bya bzhin no //
translated: just as if they were passing through space.

original: sa la'ang steng du 'byung ba dang / byi'u zul byed de /
analyzed: sa la'ang steng du 'byung ba dang / byi'u zul byed de /
translated: They can also sit cross-legged in the sky

original: dper na / chu la bya ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na / chu la bya ba bzhin no //
translated: just as if they were walking on the ground.

original: chu la'ang mi nub par 'gro ste /
analyzed: chu la'ang mi nub par 'gro ste /
translated: They can also walk on water without sinking,

original: dper na / sa la bya ba bzhin no //🔽du ba 'thul bar yang byed /
analyzed: dper na / sa la bya ba bzhin no // du ba 'thul bar yang byed /
translated: just as if they were walking on the ground.

original: 'bar ba yang byed de /
analyzed: 'bar ba yang byed de /
translated: They can also emit smoke and flames,

original: dper na / me'i phung po chen po bzhin no //🔽zla ba dang nyi ma 'di ltar rdzu 'phrul che ba /🔽'di ltar mthu che ba /
analyzed: dper na / me'i phung po chen po bzhin no // zla ba dang nyi ma 'di ltar rdzu 'phrul che ba / 'di ltar mthu che ba /
translated: just like a great bonfire.

original: 'di ltar gzi brjid che ba 'di dag la'ang lag pas nom zhing kun tu nyug par byed do //
analyzed: 'di ltar gzi brjid che ba 'di dag la'ang lag pas nom zhing kun tu nyug par byed do //
translated: They can also touch and stroke with their hands the moon and sun, which are so powerful and majestic,🔽and they can even touch and stroke the gods of the assembly of the Four Great Kings.

original: tshangs pa'i 'jig rten gyi bar du'ang lus kyis dbang sgyur ro //
analyzed: tshangs pa'i 'jig rten gyi bar du'ang lus kyis dbang sgyur ro //
translated: and he has power over his body up to the Brahma world.

original: ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa nyid dang / ngo bo nyid kyis dben pa nyid dang / ngo bo nyid kyis skye ba med pa nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa nyid dang / ngo bo nyid kyis dben pa nyid dang / ngo bo nyid kyis skye ba med pa nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Because of the emptiness of essential nature, the isolation of essential nature, and the non-production of essential nature,

original: des gang gis rlom sems su 'gyur ba'i rdzu 'phrul de'ang mi dmigs /
analyzed: des gang gis rlom sems su 'gyur ba'i rdzu 'phrul de'ang mi dmigs /
translated: he does not apprehend that magical power by which he would become proud.🔽He does not apprehend that by which he would become proud,

original: gang rlom sems su byed pa dang / gang gis rlom sems su byed pa de'ang mi dmigs te /🔽de rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yid la byed pa ma gtogs par rdzu 'phrul du sems pa'am /
analyzed: gang rlom sems su byed pa dang / gang gis rlom sems su byed pa de'ang mi dmigs te / de rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yid la byed pa ma gtogs par rdzu 'phrul du sems pa'am /
translated: and he does not apprehend that by which he would become proud.🔽Except for attending to the knowledge of all aspects,

original: rdzu 'phrul mngon par bsgrub pa'i sems pa'ang mi skyed do //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul mngon par bsgrub pa'i sems pa'ang mi skyed do //
translated: he does not even think ‘I will perform a magical transformation’ or ‘I will accomplish a magical transformation.’

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra!

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar spyod pa ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar spyod pa ni /
translated: Bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom like that

original: rdzu 'phrul bya ba mngon sum du bya ba'i mngon par shes pa'i shes pa mngon par sgrub bo //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul bya ba mngon sum du bya ba'i mngon par shes pa'i shes pa mngon par sgrub bo //
translated: accomplish the knowledge of the clairvoyance that is the performance of a magical transformation.

original: des lha'i rna ba rnam par dag pa mi'i las 'das pa /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: des lha'i rna ba rnam par dag pa mi'i las 'das pa / 'di lta ste /
translated: “With that pure divine hearing, which surpasses human hearing,🔽he hears both kinds of sounds,

original: lha dang mi'i sgra rnams thos te /
analyzed: lha dang mi'i sgra rnams thos te /
translated: divine and human, whether near or far.

original: ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa nyid dang / ngo bo @74a *//
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa nyid dang / ngo bo @74a *//
translated: because they are empty of their own inherent nature,

original: nyid kyis dben pa nyid dang / ngo bo nyid kyis skye ba med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //🔽'di ltar des sgra de mi dmigs pas bdag gis sgra thos so //
analyzed: nyid kyis dben pa nyid dang / ngo bo nyid kyis skye ba med pa nyid kyi phyir ro // 'di ltar des sgra de mi dmigs pas bdag gis sgra thos so //
translated: because they are isolated from their own inherent nature, and because they are unborn by their own inherent nature.

original: snyam du lha'i rna ba des rlom sems su mi byed do //
analyzed: snyam du lha'i rna ba des rlom sems su mi byed do //
translated: In that way, he does not apprehend that sound, and so he does not become conceited because of that divine hearing.

original: de rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yid la byed pa ma gtogs par lha'i rna bar sems pa'ang mi skyed cing mi dmigs so //
analyzed: de rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yid la byed pa ma gtogs par lha'i rna bar sems pa'ang mi skyed cing mi dmigs so //
translated: Except for the attention directed toward the knowledge of all modes, he does not even set his mind on divine hearing, let alone on the other sounds.

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: “Śāriputra,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar spyod pa ni lha'i rna ba mngon sum du bya ba'i mngon par shes pa'i shes pa mngon par sgrub bo //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar spyod pa ni lha'i rna ba mngon sum du bya ba'i mngon par shes pa'i shes pa mngon par sgrub bo //
translated: the bodhisattva great being who practices the perfection of wisdom like that accomplishes the knowledge of the superknowledge of the divine ear.

original: des sems can gzhan rnams dang / gang zag gzhan dag gi sems kyang sems kyis yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes te /🔽'dod chags dang bcas pa'i sems la'ang 'dod chags dang bcas pa'i sems su yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //🔽'dod chags dang bral ba'i sems la'ang 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sems su yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: des sems can gzhan rnams dang / gang zag gzhan dag gi sems kyang sems kyis yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes te / 'dod chags dang bcas pa'i sems la'ang 'dod chags dang bcas pa'i sems su yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so // 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sems la'ang 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sems su yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
translated: He knows the minds of other sentient beings and other persons as they are in reality.🔽He knows a mind with passion as a mind with passion.🔽He knows a mind without passion as a mind without passion.

original: de bzhin du zhe sdang dang bcas pa dang / zhe sdang dang bral ba dang / gti mug dang bcas pa dang / gti mug dang bral ba dang / sred pa dang bcas pa dang / sred pa dang bral ba dang / len pa dang bcas pa dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du zhe sdang dang bcas pa dang / zhe sdang dang bral ba dang / gti mug dang bcas pa dang / gti mug dang bral ba dang / sred pa dang bcas pa dang / sred pa dang bral ba dang / len pa dang bcas pa dang /
translated: Similarly, he knows a mind with aversion as a mind with aversion, a mind without aversion as a mind without aversion, a mind with confusion as a mind with confusion, a mind without confusion as a mind without confusion, a mind with attachment as a mind with attachment, a mind without attachment as a mind without attachment, a mind with pride as a mind with pride,

original: len pa med pa dang / bsdus pa dang / rnam par g-yengs pa dang / chung ngu dang / chen por gyur pa dang / mnyam par bzhag pa dang / mnyam par ma bzhag pa dang / rnam par grol ba @74b dang; rnam par ma grol ba dang /🔽zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa dang / nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa dang / nyon mongs pa med pa dang / bla na yod pa'i sems la'ang bla na yod pa'i sems su yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: len pa med pa dang / bsdus pa dang / rnam par g-yengs pa dang / chung ngu dang / chen por gyur pa dang / mnyam par bzhag pa dang / mnyam par ma bzhag pa dang / rnam par grol ba @74b dang; rnam par ma grol ba dang / zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa dang / nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa dang / nyon mongs pa med pa dang / bla na yod pa'i sems la'ang bla na yod pa'i sems su yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
translated: He knows as it truly is a mind that is not appropriated as a mind that is not appropriated.🔽He knows as it truly is a contracted mind as a contracted mind, a distracted mind as a distracted mind, a small mind as a small mind, a large mind as a large mind, a mind at rest as a mind at rest, a mind that is not at rest as a mind that is not at rest, a liberated mind as a liberated mind, and an unliberated mind as an unliberated mind.🔽He knows as it truly is a mind with outflows as a mind with outflows, a mind without outflows as a mind without outflows, a mind with afflictions as a mind with afflictions, a mind without afflictions as a mind without afflictions, and a mind that is superior as a mind that is superior.

original: bla na med pa'i sems la'ang bla na med pa'i sems su yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: bla na med pa'i sems la'ang bla na med pa'i sems su yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
translated: He knows as it truly is a mind that is not superior as a mind that is not superior.

original: 'di ltar sems de'ang sems ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar sems de'ang sems ma yin pa ste /
translated: Because that mind is not a mind.

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i phyir des rlom sems su mi byed do //
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i phyir des rlom sems su mi byed do //
translated: He does not falsely project it because it is inconceivable.

original: des gang gis rlom sems su mi byed pa'i sems de nyid kyang mi dmigs te /
analyzed: des gang gis rlom sems su mi byed pa'i sems de nyid kyang mi dmigs te /
translated: He does not apprehend that very mind by which he does not falsely project.

original: ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa nyid dang / ngo bo nyid kyis dben pa nyid dang / ngo bo nyid kyis skye ba med pa nyid kyi phyir bdag gis shes so //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa nyid dang / ngo bo nyid kyis dben pa nyid dang / ngo bo nyid kyis skye ba med pa nyid kyi phyir bdag gis shes so //
translated: Because of emptiness of essence, because of the lack of essence, and because of the non-arising of essence, I know.

original: snyam du rlom sems su mi byed do //
analyzed: snyam du rlom sems su mi byed do //
translated: because of emptiness of inherent nature, because of separation from inherent nature, and because of nonproduction of inherent nature, he does not think, ‘I know.’

original: de rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yid la byed pa ma gtogs par sems la sems pa'ang mi bskyed do //
analyzed: de rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yid la byed pa ma gtogs par sems la sems pa'ang mi bskyed do //
translated: He does not even arouse the thought, ‘I know,’ except when he is paying attention to the knowledge of all aspects.

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar spyod pa ni sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi spyod pa mngon sum du bya ba'i mngon par shes pa'i shes pa mngon par sgrub bo //🔽de sngon gyi gnas rnam pa du ma rjes su dran pa'i shes pa mngon sum du bya ba'i mngon par shes pa'i shes pa mngon par sgrub ste; des sems gcig gam /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar spyod pa ni sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi spyod pa mngon sum du bya ba'i mngon par shes pa'i shes pa mngon par sgrub bo // de sngon gyi gnas rnam pa du ma rjes su dran pa'i shes pa mngon sum du bya ba'i mngon par shes pa'i shes pa mngon par sgrub ste; des sems gcig gam /
translated: bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom like that accomplish the knowledge of the superknowledge that is the direct knowledge of the mental activity of all beings.

original: sems brgya'i bar du'ang rjes su dran no //
analyzed: sems brgya'i bar du'ang rjes su dran no //
translated: They accomplish the knowledge of the superknowledge that is the direct knowledge of the knowledge of the recollection of many kinds of former existences, and with that they recollect one mind or up to a hundred minds.

original: zhag gcig dang / zhag brgya'i bar dang / zla ba gcig dang / zla ba brgya'i bar dang / lo gcig dang / lo brgya'i @75a *//
analyzed: zhag gcig dang / zhag brgya'i bar dang / zla ba gcig dang / zla ba brgya'i bar dang / lo gcig dang / lo brgya'i @75a *//
translated: one day, up to a hundred days, one month, up to a hundred months, one year, up to a hundred years,

original: bar dang / bskal pa gcig dang / bskal pa brgya'i bar dang / bskal pa brgya phrag du ma'am /
analyzed: bar dang / bskal pa gcig dang / bskal pa brgya'i bar dang / bskal pa brgya phrag du ma'am /
translated: one eon, up to a hundred eons, many hundreds of eons,

original: bskal pa stong phrag du ma'am /🔽bskal pa 'bum phrag du ma'am /
analyzed: bskal pa stong phrag du ma'am / bskal pa 'bum phrag du ma'am /
translated: many thousands of eons,🔽many hundreds of thousands of eons,

original: bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig phrag 'bum phrag du ma'i bar du rjes su dran zhing /
analyzed: bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig phrag 'bum phrag du ma'i bar du rjes su dran zhing /
translated: up to many quintillions of eons.

original: sngon gyi mtha'i mur thug pa'i bar du'ang rjes su dran te /
analyzed: sngon gyi mtha'i mur thug pa'i bar du'ang rjes su dran te /
translated: They recollect up to the end of the past.

original: bdag ni ga ge mo zhig na 'dug 'dug ste /🔽ming ni 'di zhes bya; rus ni 'di zhes bya /
analyzed: bdag ni ga ge mo zhig na 'dug 'dug ste / ming ni 'di zhes bya; rus ni 'di zhes bya /
translated: ‘I was staying in such-and-such a place,🔽my name was such-and-such,

original: rigs ni 'di zhes bya /
analyzed: rigs ni 'di zhes bya /
translated: my family was such-and-such,

original: kha zas ni 'di lta bu zhig za za /
analyzed: kha zas ni 'di lta bu zhig za za /
translated: I ate such-and-such food,

original: 'tsho ba ni 'di 'dra ba zhig /
analyzed: 'tsho ba ni 'di 'dra ba zhig /
translated: my life was such-and-such,

original: yun ni 'di srid cig tu 'dug 'dug /
analyzed: yun ni 'di srid cig tu 'dug 'dug /
translated: I stayed for such-and-such a long time,

original: tshe'i mtha' ni 'di tsam zhig tu gyur; de nas shi 'phos nas ni ga ge mo zhig tu skyes /
analyzed: tshe'i mtha' ni 'di tsam zhig tu gyur; de nas shi 'phos nas ni ga ge mo zhig tu skyes /
translated: my life ended at such-and-such a point, and then I was born in such-and-such a place.

original: de nas shi 'phos nas ni 'dir skyes so //🔽zhes de ltar rnam pa dang bcas /🔽yul phyogs dang bcas /
analyzed: de nas shi 'phos nas ni 'dir skyes so // zhes de ltar rnam pa dang bcas / yul phyogs dang bcas /
translated: and then, after dying, I was born here.🔽In this way, he recollects his own and others’ past existences in their modes,

original: gzhi ci las gyur pa dang / bcas par bdag dang gzhan dag gi sngon gyi gnas rnam pa du ma rjes su dran no //
analyzed: gzhi ci las gyur pa dang / bcas par bdag dang gzhan dag gi sngon gyi gnas rnam pa du ma rjes su dran no //
translated: in their places, and in their bases.

original: 'di ltar shes pa de'ang shes pa ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar shes pa de'ang shes pa ma yin pa ste /
translated: That knowledge is also not knowledge,

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i phyir sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa'i mngon par shes pa'i shes pa des kyang rlom sems su mi byed do //
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i phyir sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa'i mngon par shes pa'i shes pa des kyang rlom sems su mi byed do //
translated: and that knowledge of the supernormal knowledge of recollecting past lives does not even conceive of the inconceivable.

original: des gang gis rlom sems su mi byed pa'i shes pa de nyid kyang mi dmigs te /
analyzed: des gang gis rlom sems su mi byed pa'i shes pa de nyid kyang mi dmigs te /
translated: He does not even apprehend that knowledge by which he does not conceive of anything,

original: ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa nyid dang / ngo bo nyid kyis dben pa nyid dang / ngo bo nyid kyis skye ba med pa nyid kyi phyir /🔽bdag gis shes so //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa nyid dang / ngo bo nyid kyis dben pa nyid dang / ngo bo nyid kyis skye ba med pa nyid kyi phyir / bdag gis shes so //
translated: because of the emptiness of inherent existence, the absence of inherent existence, and the unborn nature of all things.🔽He does not conceive of the thought

original: snyam du rlom sems su mi byed do //
analyzed: snyam du rlom sems su mi byed do //
translated: “I know.”

original: de rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yid la byed @75b ma gtogs par rjes su dran pa'i shes par sems pa'ang mi bskyed do //
analyzed: de rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yid la byed @75b ma gtogs par rjes su dran pa'i shes par sems pa'ang mi bskyed do //
translated: He does not even generate the cognition of recollection, except for keeping in mind the knowledge of all aspects.

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar spyod pa ni sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa mngon sum du bya ba'i mngon par shes pa'i shes pa mngon par sgrub bo //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar spyod pa ni sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa mngon sum du bya ba'i mngon par shes pa'i shes pa mngon par sgrub bo //
translated: the bodhisattva mahāsattva who practices the perfection of wisdom in that way accomplishes the knowledge of the superknowledge that manifests the recollection of past lives.

original: de lha'i mig rnam par dag pa mi'i las 'das pas sems can rnams mthong ste /
analyzed: de lha'i mig rnam par dag pa mi'i las 'das pas sems can rnams mthong ste /
translated: With the divine eye, which is purified and surpasses that of humans, he sees sentient beings,

original: sems can 'chi 'pho ba dang / skye ba dang / kha dog sdug pa dang / kha dog mi sdug pa dang / bzang po dang / ngan pa dang / bde 'gro dang / ngan 'gro dang / las ji lta ba bzhin du 'gro ba dag rab tu shes so //
analyzed: sems can 'chi 'pho ba dang / skye ba dang / kha dog sdug pa dang / kha dog mi sdug pa dang / bzang po dang / ngan pa dang / bde 'gro dang / ngan 'gro dang / las ji lta ba bzhin du 'gro ba dag rab tu shes so //
translated: and he knows sentient beings passing away and being born, beautiful or ugly, of good or bad destiny, going to good or bad rebirths according to their actions.

original: sems can 'di dag ni lus kyi nyes par spyod pa dang ldan pa /
analyzed: sems can 'di dag ni lus kyi nyes par spyod pa dang ldan pa /
translated: He knows, ‘These sentient beings have engaged in bodily misconduct,

original: ngag gi nyes par spyod pa dang / yid kyi nyes par spyod pa dang ldan pa /
analyzed: ngag gi nyes par spyod pa dang / yid kyi nyes par spyod pa dang ldan pa /
translated: They engage in verbal misconduct and mental misconduct.🔽They disparage the noble ones and hold wrong views.

original: 'phags pa la skur pa 'debs pa log par lta ba can yin te; log par lta ba'i las kyi gzhi dang rgyus lus zhig nas shi ba'i 'og tu ngan song ngan 'gro log par ltung ba rnams su skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'phags pa la skur pa 'debs pa log par lta ba can yin te; log par lta ba'i las kyi gzhi dang rgyus lus zhig nas shi ba'i 'og tu ngan song ngan 'gro log par ltung ba rnams su skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Due to the basis and cause of their wrong views, when their bodies collapse and fall apart, they will be born in the lower realms, in the bad places, in the lower realms.”

original: sems can 'di dag ni lus kyi legs par spyod pa dang ldan pa /
analyzed: sems can 'di dag ni lus kyi legs par spyod pa dang ldan pa /
translated: “These sentient beings engage in physical good conduct,

original: ngag gi legs par spyod pa dang / yid kyi legs par spyod pa dang ldan pa /
analyzed: ngag gi legs par spyod pa dang / yid kyi legs par spyod pa dang ldan pa /
translated: verbal good conduct, and mental good conduct.

original: 'phags pa rnams la skur pa mi 'debs pa yang dag pa'i lta ba can te /
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams la skur pa mi 'debs pa yang dag pa'i lta ba can te /
translated: They do not disparage the noble ones and hold right views.

original: de dag lus dang ngag dang yid kyi legs par spyod pa'i gzhi dang rgyus lus zhig nas bde 'gro mtho ris kyi 'jig rten du lha rnams kyi nang du skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag lus dang ngag dang yid kyi legs par spyod pa'i gzhi dang rgyus lus zhig nas bde 'gro mtho ris kyi 'jig rten du lha rnams kyi nang du skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Due to the basis and cause of their physical, verbal, and mental good conduct, when their bodies collapse and fall apart, they will be born in the higher realms, among the gods in the celestial realms.”

original: zhes lha'i mig rnam par dag pa mi'i las 'das pas /
analyzed: zhes lha'i mig rnam par dag pa mi'i las 'das pas /
translated: In this way, with his pure divine eye that surpasses the human,

original: @76a *// phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams kun tu 'jig rten gyi chos kyi dbyings kyis klas pa /
analyzed: @76a *// phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams kun tu 'jig rten gyi chos kyi dbyings kyis klas pa /
translated: In all the world systems in the ten directions, as many as there are in the extent of the Dharma-dhātu,

original: nam mkha'i khams kyi mthas gtugs pa dag na /
analyzed: nam mkha'i khams kyi mthas gtugs pa dag na /
translated: as many as there are in the extent of space,

original: 'gro ba drug gi sems can rnams kyi 'chi 'pho dang / skye ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: 'gro ba drug gi sems can rnams kyi 'chi 'pho dang / skye ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
translated: he knows the deaths and rebirths of beings in the six destinies just as they are.

original: 'di ltar mig de ni mig ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar mig de ni mig ma yin pa ste /
translated: Because that eye is not an eye.

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i phyir des kyang rlom sems su mi byed do //
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i phyir des kyang rlom sems su mi byed do //
translated: Because it is inconceivable, he does not falsely project.

original: des gang gis rlom sems su byed pa'i mig de nyid mi dmigs te /
analyzed: des gang gis rlom sems su byed pa'i mig de nyid mi dmigs te /
translated: He does not apprehend that eye by which he would falsely project.

original: de ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa nyid dang / ngo bo nyid kyis dben pa nyid dang / ngo bo nyid kyis skye ba med pa nyid kyi phyir bdag gis shes so //
analyzed: de ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa nyid dang / ngo bo nyid kyis dben pa nyid dang / ngo bo nyid kyis skye ba med pa nyid kyi phyir bdag gis shes so //
translated: Because it is empty of inherent nature, because it is isolated from inherent nature, because it is unborn from inherent nature, he does not falsely project, thinking, ‘I know.’

original: snyam du rlom sems su mi byed do //
analyzed: snyam du rlom sems su mi byed do //
translated: He does not falsely project.

original: de rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yid la byed pa ma gtogs par mig tu sems pa'ang mi bskyed do //
analyzed: de rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yid la byed pa ma gtogs par mig tu sems pa'ang mi bskyed do //
translated: Except for the attention on the knowledge of all aspects, he does not even arouse the idea that it is an eye.

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar spyod pa ni lha'i mig mngon sum du bya ba'i mngon par shes pa'i shes pa mngon par sgrub bo //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar spyod pa ni lha'i mig mngon sum du bya ba'i mngon par shes pa'i shes pa mngon par sgrub bo //
translated: the bodhisattva mahāsattva who practices the perfection of wisdom in that way accomplishes the knowledge of the supernormal knowledge that actualizes the divine eye.

original: de zag pa zad pa mngon sum du bya ba'i mngon par shes pa'i shes pa'ang mngon par sgrub la /
analyzed: de zag pa zad pa mngon sum du bya ba'i mngon par shes pa'i shes pa'ang mngon par sgrub la /
translated: He also accomplishes the knowledge of the supernormal knowledge that actualizes the exhaustion of defilements.

original: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sar yang mi ltung ste /
analyzed: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sar yang mi ltung ste /
translated: But he does not fall into the levels of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba ma gtogs par chos gzhan gang la'ang smon pa med do //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba ma gtogs par chos gzhan gang la'ang smon pa med do //
translated: Except for fully awakening to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment, he does not aspire to any other phenomenon.

original: de mngon par shes pa des rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin la brten nas bag chags dang / mtshams sbyor ba dang / @76b nyon mongs pa thams cad spong bar byed do //
analyzed: de mngon par shes pa des rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin la brten nas bag chags dang / mtshams sbyor ba dang / @76b nyon mongs pa thams cad spong bar byed do //
translated: By that supernormal knowledge, relying on the vajra-like concentration, he abandons all habitual tendencies, connections, and afflictions.

original: 'di ltar shes pa de ni shes pa ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar shes pa de ni shes pa ma yin pa ste /
translated: Because that knowledge is not knowledge.

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i phyir /
translated: because it is inconceivable.

original: zag pa zad pa mngon sum du bya ba'i mngon par shes pa'i shes pa mngon par bsgrub pa'i dge ba des rlom sems su mi byed do //
analyzed: zag pa zad pa mngon sum du bya ba'i mngon par shes pa'i shes pa mngon par bsgrub pa'i dge ba des rlom sems su mi byed do //
translated: He does not become proud on account of that wholesome root which is the attainment of the knowledge of an Ārya’s higher knowledge of the extinction of the outflows.

original: de shes pa de nyid mi dmigs te /🔽ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa nyid dang / ngo bo nyid kyis dben pa nyid dang / ngo bo nyid kyis skye ba med pa nyid kyi phyir bdag gis shes so //
analyzed: de shes pa de nyid mi dmigs te / ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa nyid dang / ngo bo nyid kyis dben pa nyid dang / ngo bo nyid kyis skye ba med pa nyid kyi phyir bdag gis shes so //
translated: He does not apprehend that knowledge.

original: snyam du rlom sems su mi byed do //
analyzed: snyam du rlom sems su mi byed do //
translated: Because it is empty of inherent nature, isolated from inherent nature, and does not arise by inherent nature, he does not become proud, thinking, ‘I know.’

original: de rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yid la byed pa ma gtogs par shes pa de la sems pa'ang mi bskyed do //
analyzed: de rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yid la byed pa ma gtogs par shes pa de la sems pa'ang mi bskyed do //
translated: Except for keeping in mind the knowledge of all aspects, he does not even think about that knowledge.

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar spyod pa ni zag pa zad pa mngon sum du bya ba'i mngon par shes pa'i shes pa mngon par sgrub bo //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar spyod pa ni zag pa zad pa mngon sum du bya ba'i mngon par shes pa'i shes pa mngon par sgrub bo //
translated: bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom like that accomplish the knowledge of an Ārya’s higher knowledge of the extinction of the outflows.

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar spyod pa ni mngon par shes pa drug yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur /
analyzed: yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar spyod pa ni mngon par shes pa drug yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur /
translated: “Moreover, Śāriputra, bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom like that will complete the six clairvoyances.

original: yongs su dag par 'gyur te /
analyzed: yongs su dag par 'gyur te /
translated: They will purify them.

original: mngon par shes pa rnams yongs su dag pas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par byed do //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa rnams yongs su dag pas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par byed do //
translated: Through purifying the clairvoyances they will attain the knowledge of all aspects.

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa gang dag mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid kyis yongs su 'dzin pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa gang dag mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid kyis yongs su 'dzin pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: there are bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom who, because of the emptiness of the unlimited,

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas te /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas te /
translated: stand in the perfection of giving

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi lam sbyong ba dag kyang yod do //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi lam sbyong ba dag kyang yod do //
translated: and train in the path to the knowledge of all aspects.

original: @77a *// sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: @77a *// sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /
translated: bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom

original: mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid kyis ltung ba mi 'byung ba dang / lhag par ltung ba mi 'byung ba'i phyir tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas te /
analyzed: mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid kyis ltung ba mi 'byung ba dang / lhag par ltung ba mi 'byung ba'i phyir tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas te /
translated: And because they do not fall into the extreme of nihilism, they abide in the transcendent perfection of discipline.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi lam sbyong ba dag kyang yod do //🔽sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi lam sbyong ba dag kyang yod do // sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: They are the ones who, by means of emptiness of the unlimited, abide in the perfection of morality, and who, while training in the path to the knowledge of all aspects, do not commit any offense and do not commit any offense that is a downfall.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /🔽mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid kyis 'khrug pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa / mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid kyis 'khrug pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: “There are some bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom who, by means of emptiness of the unlimited, abide in the perfection of patience, and who, while training in the path to the knowledge of all aspects, do not get angry and do not get irritated.🔽“There are some bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom who, by means of emptiness of the unlimited, abide in the perfection of perseverance, and who, while training in the path to the knowledge of all aspects, do not give up physical and mental perseverance.

original: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas te /
analyzed: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas te /
translated: “There are some bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom who, by means of emptiness of the unlimited, abide in the perfection of concentration, and who, while training in the path to the knowledge of all aspects, do not give up mental stability.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi lam sbyong ba dag kyang yod do //🔽sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi lam sbyong ba dag kyang yod do // sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: “There are some bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom who, by means of emptiness of the unlimited, abide in the perfection of wisdom, and who, while training in the path to the knowledge of all aspects, do not give up wisdom.🔽“There are some bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom who, by means of emptiness of the unlimited, abide in the perfection of skill in means, and who, while training in the path to the knowledge of all aspects, do not give up skill in means.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid kyis lus dang sems kyi brtson 'grus ma btang ba'i phyir /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid kyis lus dang sems kyi brtson 'grus ma btang ba'i phyir /
translated: “There are some bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom who, by means of emptiness of the unlimited, abide in the perfection of aspiration, and who, while training in the path to the knowledge of all aspects, do not give up the aspiration for awakening.🔽“There are some bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom who, by means of emptiness of the unlimited, abide in the perfection of power, and who, while training in the path to the knowledge of all aspects, do not give up the power of wholesome roots.🔽“There are some bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom who, by means of emptiness of the unlimited, abide in the perfection of knowledge, and who, while training in the path to the knowledge of all aspects, do not give up the knowledge of the path.

original: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas te /🔽rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi lam sbyong ba dag kyang yod do; ;sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas te / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi lam sbyong ba dag kyang yod do; ;sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: They are the ones who, standing in the perfection of perseverance,🔽are training in the path to the knowledge of all aspects.”🔽

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid kyi rnam par g-yeng ba med pa'i phyir bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid kyi rnam par g-yeng ba med pa'i phyir bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas te /
translated: “Śāriputra, there are bodhisattva great beings who, standing in the perfection of perseverance,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi lam sbyong ba dag kyang yod do //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi lam sbyong ba dag kyang yod do //
translated: are training in the path to the knowledge of all aspects.

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: “Śāriputra, there are bodhisattva great beings who, standing in the perfection of concentration,🔽are training in the path to the knowledge of all aspects because of not being distracted by the emptiness that transcends limits.🔽“Śāriputra, there are bodhisattva great beings who, standing in the perfection of wisdom,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po @77b shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid kyis shes rab 'chal pa'i sems mi dmigs pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po @77b shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid kyis shes rab 'chal pa'i sems mi dmigs pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas te /
translated: are training in the path to the knowledge of all aspects because of not apprehending a thought of bad wisdom due to the emptiness that transcends limits.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi lam sbyong ba dag kyang yod do //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi lam sbyong ba dag kyang yod do //
translated: There are those who train in the path to the knowledge of all aspects.

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar spyod pa ni mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid kyis 'gro ba dang / 'ong ba med pa dang / 'dzin pa med pa'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa drug po dag la gnas te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar spyod pa ni mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid kyis 'gro ba dang / 'ong ba med pa dang / 'dzin pa med pa'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa drug po dag la gnas te /
translated: bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom like that stand in the six perfections, because of the emptiness of the unlimited, because of not coming, because of not going, and because of not grasping, and

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi lam sbyong bar byed do //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi lam sbyong bar byed do //
translated: train in the path to the knowledge of all aspects.

original: sbyin pa ni yongs su 'dzin pa yod pa'i phyir gdags so //
analyzed: sbyin pa ni yongs su 'dzin pa yod pa'i phyir gdags so //
translated: Giving is imputed because of the existence of grasping.

original: tshul khrims ni 'chal pa'i tshul khrims yod pa'i phyir gdags so //
analyzed: tshul khrims ni 'chal pa'i tshul khrims yod pa'i phyir gdags so //
translated: Morality is imputed because of the existence of immorality.

original: bzod pa ni 'khrug pa yod pa'i phyir gdags so //
analyzed: bzod pa ni 'khrug pa yod pa'i phyir gdags so //
translated: Patience is imputed because of the existence of anger.

original: brtson 'grus ni le lo yod pa'i phyir gdags so //
analyzed: brtson 'grus ni le lo yod pa'i phyir gdags so //
translated: Effort is imputed because of the existence of laziness.

original: ting nge 'dzin ni mnyam par ma bzhag pa yod pa'i phyir gdags so //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin ni mnyam par ma bzhag pa yod pa'i phyir gdags so //
translated: Concentration is imputed because of the existence of distraction.

original: shes rab ni 'chal pa'i shes rab yod pa'i phyir gdags te /
analyzed: shes rab ni 'chal pa'i shes rab yod pa'i phyir gdags te /
translated: Wisdom is designated because there is faulty wisdom.

original: de ni rgal to zhes bya bar rlom sems med do; ;ma rgal to zhes bya bar rlom sems med do //
analyzed: de ni rgal to zhes bya bar rlom sems med do; ;ma rgal to zhes bya bar rlom sems med do //
translated: He does not think, “I have crossed over,” nor does he think, “I have not crossed over.”

original: sbyin pa dang ser sna zhes bya bar rlom sems med do //
analyzed: sbyin pa dang ser sna zhes bya bar rlom sems med do //
translated: He does not think, “There is generosity and there is stinginess.”

original: tshul khrims dang tshul khrims ma yin pa zhes bya bar rlom sems med do //🔽bzod pa dang 'khrug pa zhes bya bar rlom sems med do //
analyzed: tshul khrims dang tshul khrims ma yin pa zhes bya bar rlom sems med do // bzod pa dang 'khrug pa zhes bya bar rlom sems med do //
translated: He does not think, “There is morality and there is immorality.”🔽He does not think, “There is patience and there is anger.”

original: brtson 'grus dang le lo zhes bya bar rlom sems med do //
analyzed: brtson 'grus dang le lo zhes bya bar rlom sems med do //
translated: He does not think, “There is diligence and there is laziness.”

original: mnyam par bzhag pa dang mnyam par ma bzhag pa zhes bya bar rlom sems @78a *//
analyzed: mnyam par bzhag pa dang mnyam par ma bzhag pa zhes bya bar rlom sems @78a *//
translated: He does not think, “There is concentration and there is distraction.”

original: med do; ;shes rab dang shes rab 'chal pa zhes bya bar rlom sems med do //🔽bdag la spyos so zhes bya bar rlom sems med do //🔽bdag la phyag byas so zhes bya bar rlom sems med do //
analyzed: med do; ;shes rab dang shes rab 'chal pa zhes bya bar rlom sems med do // bdag la spyos so zhes bya bar rlom sems med do // bdag la phyag byas so zhes bya bar rlom sems med do //
translated: He does not think, “There is wisdom and there is ignorance.”🔽He does not think, “I have been reviled.”🔽He does not think, “I have been honored.”

original: bdag la bsti stang byas so zhes bya bar rlom sems med do //
analyzed: bdag la bsti stang byas so zhes bya bar rlom sems med do //
translated: He does not think, “I have been respected.”

original: bdag la bsti stang ma byas so zhes bya bar rlom sems med do //
analyzed: bdag la bsti stang ma byas so zhes bya bar rlom sems med do //
translated: and “they did not honor me.”

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: sh'a ri'i bu; 'di ltar skye ba med pa ni bdag la spyos so zhes bya bar rlom sems su mi byed /🔽phyag byas so zhes rlom sems su mi byed /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu; 'di ltar skye ba med pa ni bdag la spyos so zhes bya bar rlom sems su mi byed / phyag byas so zhes rlom sems su mi byed /
translated: Because, Śāriputra, nonproduction does not think, ‘They reviled me’;🔽it does not think, ‘They bowed to me’;

original: bdag la bsti stang byas so zhes rlom sems su mi byed /
analyzed: bdag la bsti stang byas so zhes rlom sems su mi byed /
translated: it does not think, ‘They honored me’;

original: bdag la bsti stang ma byas so zhes rlom sems su mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag la bsti stang ma byas so zhes rlom sems su mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and it does not think, ‘They did not honor me.’

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni rlom sems thams cad gcod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni rlom sems thams cad gcod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the perfection of wisdom cuts off all thought.

original: sh'a ri'i bu; 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i yon tan gang yin pa de dag ni nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad la med de; de ni yon tan de dag yongs su rdzogs par byed cing /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu; 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i yon tan gang yin pa de dag ni nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad la med de; de ni yon tan de dag yongs su rdzogs par byed cing /
translated: “Śāriputra, the qualities of a bodhisattva great being practicing the perfection of wisdom are not possessed by any śrāvakas or pratyekabuddhas, and so he perfects those qualities

original: sems can rnams kyang yongs su smin par byed /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyang yongs su smin par byed /
translated: they bring beings to maturity,

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yang yongs su dag par byed de /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yang yongs su dag par byed de /
translated: they purify a buddhafield,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyang thob par byed do //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyang thob par byed do //
translated: and they attain the knowledge of all aspects.

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: “Moreover, Śāriputra,

original: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni sems can thams @78b cad la mnyam pa nyid kyi sems skyed par byed de /
analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni sems can thams @78b cad la mnyam pa nyid kyi sems skyed par byed de /
translated: bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom generate the thought of sameness toward all beings.

original: des sems can thams cad la mnyam pa nyid kyi sems bskyed pas chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des sems can thams cad la mnyam pa nyid kyi sems bskyed pas chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: By generating the thought of sameness toward all beings, they attain the sameness of all dharmas.

original: des chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid thob pas sems can thams cad chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid la 'god par byed do //
analyzed: des chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid thob pas sems can thams cad chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid la 'god par byed do //
translated: By attaining the sameness of all dharmas, they establish all beings in the sameness of all dharmas.

original: de tshe 'di nyid la'ang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la sdug cing thugs su byon par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de tshe 'di nyid la'ang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la sdug cing thugs su byon par 'gyur ro //
translated: In this very life they are dear to and beloved of the lord buddhas.

original: byang chub sems dpa' thams cad dang / nyan thos thams cad dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad la'ang sdug cing yid du 'ong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' thams cad dang / nyan thos thams cad dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad la'ang sdug cing yid du 'ong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: He will be loved and pleasing to all bodhisattvas, to all śrāvakas, and to all pratyekabuddhas.

original: de gang dang gang du skyes pa de dang der; nam yang mig gis gzugs yid du mi 'ong ba rnams mthong bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de gang dang gang du skyes pa de dang der; nam yang mig gis gzugs yid du mi 'ong ba rnams mthong bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Wherever he is born, he will never see unpleasant forms with his eyes.

original: rna bas sgra yid du mi 'ong ba rnams thos par mi 'gyur ro //🔽snas dri yid du mi 'ong ba rnams tshor bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rna bas sgra yid du mi 'ong ba rnams thos par mi 'gyur ro // snas dri yid du mi 'ong ba rnams tshor bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: He will never hear unpleasant sounds with his ears.🔽He will never smell unpleasant smells with his nose.

original: lces ro yid du mi 'ong ba rnams myong bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lces ro yid du mi 'ong ba rnams myong bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: He will never taste unpleasant tastes with his tongue.

original: lus kyis reg bya yid du mi 'ong ba rnams reg par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lus kyis reg bya yid du mi 'ong ba rnams reg par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: He will never touch unpleasant tactile objects with his body.

original: yid kyis chos yid du mi 'ong ba rnams shes par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yid kyis chos yid du mi 'ong ba rnams shes par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: He will never cognize unpleasant mental objects with his mind.

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar spyod pa ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar spyod pa ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The bodhisattva mahāsattva who practices the perfection of wisdom in this way will not regress from unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa 'di bshad pa na /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa 'di bshad pa na /
translated: When this teaching of the perfection of wisdom was being taught,

original: dge slong sum brgyas gos ci gyon pa rnams bcom ldan 'das kyi sku la gsol te /🔽bla na med pa @79a *//
analyzed: dge slong sum brgyas gos ci gyon pa rnams bcom ldan 'das kyi sku la gsol te / bla na med pa @79a *//
translated: three hundred monks, wearing whatever robes they were wearing, offered them to the body of the Blessed One,🔽and they also gave rise to the mind of unsurpassed

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems kyang bskyed do //
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems kyang bskyed do //
translated: perfect complete awakening.

original: de nas de'i tshe /
analyzed: de nas de'i tshe /
translated: Then at that time,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'dzum pa mdzad do //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'dzum pa mdzad do //
translated: the Blessed One smiled.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo stan las langs te /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo stan las langs te /
translated: Then the venerable Ānanda rose from his seat,

original: bla gos phrag pa gcig tu gzar nas pus mo g-yas pa'i lha nga sa la btsugs te /
analyzed: bla gos phrag pa gcig tu gzar nas pus mo g-yas pa'i lha nga sa la btsugs te /
translated: put his upper robe over one shoulder, placed his right knee on the ground,

original: bcom ldan 'das ga la bde logs su thal mo sbyar ba btung nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ga la bde logs su thal mo sbyar ba btung nas /
translated: bowed to the Blessed One with palms joined,

original: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: and said to the Blessed One,🔽“Blessed One, what is the cause, what is the reason for smiling?

original: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams ni rgyu ma mchis /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams ni rgyu ma mchis /
translated: Blessed One, the thus-gone, worthy, perfect buddhas do not smile without a cause

original: rkyen ma mchis par 'dzum pa mi mdzad na /
analyzed: rkyen ma mchis par 'dzum pa mi mdzad na /
translated: or a condition.

original: 'dzum pa mdzad pa'i rgyu gang lags /
analyzed: 'dzum pa mdzad pa'i rgyu gang lags /
translated: What is the cause of your smile?

original: rkyen gang lags /🔽de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: rkyen gang lags / de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: What is the condition?”

original: kun dga' bo /
analyzed: kun dga' bo /
translated: The Blessed One replied to the venerable Ānanda, “Ānanda,

original: dge slong sum brgya po 'di dag ni 'di nas shi 'phos nas de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas mi 'khrugs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing du skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: dge slong sum brgya po 'di dag ni 'di nas shi 'phos nas de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas mi 'khrugs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing du skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: these three hundred monks will pass away from here and be reborn in the buddhafield of the thus-gone, worthy, perfect buddha Akṣobhya.

original: de dag bskal pa drug cu rtsa gcig na bskal pa skar ma lta bu la de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas me tog chen po zhes bya ba dag tu 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag bskal pa drug cu rtsa gcig na bskal pa skar ma lta bu la de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas me tog chen po zhes bya ba dag tu 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: They will appear in the world as the Tathāgatas, the Arhats, the Perfectly Awakened Ones named Mahāpuṣpa in the Star-like Eon.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lha'i bu drug khris kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed do //
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lha'i bu drug khris kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed do //
translated: Sixty thousand sons of gods in the desire realm also generated the mind directed toward unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: de dag ni de bzhin @79b gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas byams pa'ang mnyes par byed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de dag ni de bzhin @79b gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas byams pa'ang mnyes par byed par 'gyur te /
translated: They will please the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One Maitreya.

original: de nyid du rab tu byung nas /
analyzed: de nyid du rab tu byung nas /
translated: They will go forth right then and there.

original: tshangs par spyad pa spyod par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: tshangs par spyad pa spyod par 'gyur zhing /
translated: They will practice pure conduct.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa byams pa des kyang de dag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa byams pa des kyang de dag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: The Tathāgata Maitreya will prophesy their unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: de nas de'i tshe sangs rgyas kyi mthus 'khor bzhi po dag gis 'di nas shar phyogs na sangs rgyas khri bzhugs pa nyid du mthong ngo //
analyzed: de nas de'i tshe sangs rgyas kyi mthus 'khor bzhi po dag gis 'di nas shar phyogs na sangs rgyas khri bzhugs pa nyid du mthong ngo //
translated: Then, at that time, by the power of the Buddha, the fourfold assembly saw ten thousand buddhas seated in the east.

original: phyogs bcu khor yug gi bar du'ang sangs rgyas khri khri mthong ngo //
analyzed: phyogs bcu khor yug gi bar du'ang sangs rgyas khri khri mthong ngo //
translated: And they saw ten thousand buddhas in each of the ten directions, as far as the surrounding rim of the universe.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gi 'jig rten gyi khams de dag na sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi yon tan bkod pa gang dag snang ba'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi yon tan bkod pa de dag ni 'jig rten gyi khams mi mjed 'di na mi snang ngo
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gi 'jig rten gyi khams de dag na sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi yon tan bkod pa gang dag snang ba'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi yon tan bkod pa de dag ni 'jig rten gyi khams mi mjed 'di na mi snang ngo
translated: The arrays of the qualities of the buddha-fields that appeared in those world systems of those blessed buddhas were not seen in this Sahā world system.🔽Then ten thousand beings in the assembly made this vow:

original: // de nas 'khor de las srog chags khris bdag cag kyang las 'di lta bu byas te /
analyzed: // de nas 'khor de las srog chags khris bdag cag kyang las 'di lta bu byas te /
translated: “We too will perform such actions

original: las de byas pas /
analyzed: las de byas pas /
translated: and, by having performed such actions,

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing de dag tu skye bar gyur cig /🔽ces smon lam btab bo //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing de dag tu skye bar gyur cig / ces smon lam btab bo //
translated: may we be reborn in those buddha-fields!”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis rigs kyi bu de dag gi bsam pa thugs su chud nas 'dzum pa mdzad do //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis rigs kyi bu de dag gi bsam pa thugs su chud nas 'dzum pa mdzad do //
translated: Then the Blessed One, knowing the thoughts of those sons of noble family, smiled.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bos 'di skad ces gsol to //🔽bcom ldan 'das; sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni rgyu ma mchis /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bos 'di skad ces gsol to // bcom ldan 'das; sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni rgyu ma mchis /
translated: Then the venerable Ānanda said this to the Blessed One:🔽“Blessed One, the blessed buddhas do not smile without a cause,

original: rkyen ma mchis par 'dzum pa mi mdzad na /
analyzed: rkyen ma mchis par 'dzum pa mi mdzad na /
translated: without a condition.

original: 'dzum pa mdzad pa'i rgyu gang lags /
analyzed: 'dzum pa mdzad pa'i rgyu gang lags /
translated: What is the cause of your smile?

original: rkyen gang lags /
analyzed: rkyen gang lags /
translated: What is the condition?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis @80a *//🔽bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis @80a *// bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: kun dga' bo /
analyzed: kun dga' bo /
translated: “Ānanda,

original: srog chags khri po 'di dag khyod kyis mthong ngam /
analyzed: srog chags khri po 'di dag khyod kyis mthong ngam /
translated: do you see these ten thousand beings?”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das mthong lags so //
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das mthong lags so //
translated: He replied, “Blessed One, I see them.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: kun dga' bo /
analyzed: kun dga' bo /
translated: “Ānanda,

original: srog chags khri po 'di dag ni 'di nas shi 'phos nas /
analyzed: srog chags khri po 'di dag ni 'di nas shi 'phos nas /
translated: after these ten thousand beings die,

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing de dag tu skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing de dag tu skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: they will be reborn in those buddha realms.

original: nam yang de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams dang 'bral bar mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: nam yang de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams dang 'bral bar mi 'gyur la /
translated: They will never be separated from the thus-gone, worthy, perfect buddhas.

original: phyis de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas bkod pa'i rgyal po zhes bya bar 'gyur ro; ;shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khri brgyad stong pa las /
analyzed: phyis de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas bkod pa'i rgyal po zhes bya bar 'gyur ro; ;shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khri brgyad stong pa las /
translated: In the future, he will become the Tathagata, the Arhat, the Fully Enlightened One, the One of Perfect Knowledge and Conduct, the Well-Gone One, the Knower of the World, the Leader of Men to be Tamed, the Supreme Trainer, the Teacher of Gods and Men, the Buddha, the Blessed Lord, called Array of Light.

original: nye bar brtag pa'i le'u ste gsum pa'o ////
analyzed: nye bar brtag pa'i le'u ste gsum pa'o ////
translated: This was the third chapter, “The Examination,” from “The Perfection of Wisdom in Eighteen Thousand Lines.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu dang / tshe dang ldan pa mo'u 'gal gyi bu chen po dang / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor dang / tshe dang ldan pa byams ma'i bu gang po dang / tshe dang ldan pa 'od srung chen po dang /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu dang / tshe dang ldan pa mo'u 'gal gyi bu chen po dang / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor dang / tshe dang ldan pa byams ma'i bu gang po dang / tshe dang ldan pa 'od srung chen po dang /
translated: Then the Venerable Śāriputra, the Venerable Mahā­maudgalyāyana, the Venerable Subhūti, the Venerable Pūrṇa Maitrāyaniputra, the Venerable Mahākāśyapa,

original: de dag dang gzhan yang dge slong dang / dge slong ma dang / dge bsnyen dang / dge bsnyen ma mngon par shes pa mngon par shes pa dag dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rab tu mang po dag gis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de dag dang gzhan yang dge slong dang / dge slong ma dang / dge bsnyen dang / dge bsnyen ma mngon par shes pa mngon par shes pa dag dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rab tu mang po dag gis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: and many other monks and nuns, male and female lay followers with supernormal knowledge, and many bodhisattva great beings said this to the Blessed One:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi pha rol tu phyin pa chen po @80b lags so //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi pha rol tu phyin pa chen po @80b lags so //
translated: This perfection of wisdom is the great perfection of the bodhisattva great beings.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yangs pa lags so //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yangs pa lags so //
translated: this perfection of wisdom is the vast perfection of the bodhisattva great beings.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mchog lags so //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mchog lags so //
translated: this perfection of wisdom is the supreme perfection of the bodhisattva great beings.

original: 'di ni pha rol tu phyin pa khyad par du 'phags pa lags so //
analyzed: 'di ni pha rol tu phyin pa khyad par du 'phags pa lags so //
translated: It is the exalted perfection.

original: 'di ni pha rol tu phyin pa rab dang / rab mchog dang / gya nom pa lags so //
analyzed: 'di ni pha rol tu phyin pa rab dang / rab mchog dang / gya nom pa lags so //
translated: It is the best, the most excellent, the most sublime perfection.

original: 'di ni pha rol tu phyin pa bla na ma mchis pa lags so //🔽'di ni pha rol tu phyin pa gong na ma mchis pa lags so //
analyzed: 'di ni pha rol tu phyin pa bla na ma mchis pa lags so //🔽'di ni pha rol tu phyin pa gong na ma mchis pa lags so //
