translated: It is the unsurpassed perfection.🔽It is the unequaled perfection.

original: 'di ni pha rol tu phyin pa mnyam pa ma mchis pa lags so //
analyzed: 'di ni pha rol tu phyin pa mnyam pa ma mchis pa lags so //
translated: This is the perfection that is unequaled.

original: 'di ni pha rol tu phyin pa mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa lags so //
analyzed: 'di ni pha rol tu phyin pa mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa lags so //
translated: This is the perfection that is equal to the unequaled.

original: 'di ni pha rol tu phyin pa zhi ba dang dul ba lags so //
analyzed: 'di ni pha rol tu phyin pa zhi ba dang dul ba lags so //

original: 'di ni pha rol tu phyin pa mtshungs pa ma mchis pa lags so //
analyzed: 'di ni pha rol tu phyin pa mtshungs pa ma mchis pa lags so //
translated: This is the perfection that is without compare.

original: 'di ni pha rol tu phyin pa dpe ma mchis pa lags so //
analyzed: 'di ni pha rol tu phyin pa dpe ma mchis pa lags so //
translated: This is the perfection that is without example.

original: 'di ni pha rol tu phyin pa nam mkha' lta bu lags so //
analyzed: 'di ni pha rol tu phyin pa nam mkha' lta bu lags so //
translated: This is the perfection that is like space.

original: 'di ni rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid kyi pha rol tu phyin pa lags so //
analyzed: 'di ni rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid kyi pha rol tu phyin pa lags so //
translated: This is the perfection of the emptiness of intrinsic defining characteristics.

analyzed: 'di ni yon tan thams cad dang ldan pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa lags so //
translated: This is the perfection that is endowed with all good qualities.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: it is as follows:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

analyzed: de dag gis ni mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i lus thob lags so //
translated: They have obtained a body equal to the unequaled.

original: de dag gis ni /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: de dag gis ni /🔽'di lta ste /
translated: They have obtained a body

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi chos mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa thob par 'gyur lags so //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi chos mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa thob par 'gyur lags so //
translated: They will attain the Dharma of unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening that is equal to the unequaled.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid la spyad pas mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i gzugs brnyes par gyur lags so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid la spyad pas mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i gzugs brnyes par gyur lags so //
translated: The Lord also, practicing this very perfection of wisdom, attained form that is equal to the unequaled.

original: mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i rnam par shes pa brnyes par gyur lags so //
analyzed: mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i rnam par shes pa brnyes par gyur lags so //
translated: He attained feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness that are equal to the unequaled.

original: mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas lags so //
analyzed: mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas lags so //
translated: He fully awakened to awakening that is equal to the unequaled.

original: mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i chos kyi 'khor lo bskor lags so //
analyzed: mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i chos kyi 'khor lo bskor lags so //
translated: He turned the wheel of the Dharma that is equal to the unequaled.

original: de @81b bzhin du 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid la spyad pas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas par gyur lags so //
analyzed: de @81b bzhin du 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid la spyad pas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas par gyur lags so //
translated: In the same way, the Blessed Buddhas of the past, future, and present have practiced this perfection of wisdom and have fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.🔽

original: mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas lags so //
analyzed: mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas lags so //
translated: In the same way, the past, future, and present Bhagavān Buddhas have practiced this perfection of wisdom and have fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.🔽have fully awakened,

original: mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur lags so //
analyzed: mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur lags so //
translated: will fully awaken.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Bhagavān,

original: de lta lags pas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos thams cad kyi pha rol tu phyin par 'tshal ba rnams kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brtson par bgyi'o //
analyzed: de lta lags pas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos thams cad kyi pha rol tu phyin par 'tshal ba rnams kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brtson par bgyi'o //
translated: therefore, bodhisattva mahāsattvas who wish to reach the perfection of all dharmas should make an effort in the perfection of wisdom.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Bhagavān,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la spyod pa gang lags pa de dag ni lha dang mi dang lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyis phyag bgyi ba'i gnas lags so //🔽de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis nyan thos chen po de dag dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rab tu mang po de dag la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la spyod pa gang lags pa de dag ni lha dang mi dang lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyis phyag bgyi ba'i gnas lags so // de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis nyan thos chen po de dag dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rab tu mang po de dag la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: Those bodhisattva great beings who practice this perfection of wisdom are worthy of homage from the world with its gods, humans, and asuras.”

original: rigs kyi bu dag de de bzhin te /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu dag de de bzhin te /
translated: When this had been said, the Blessed One said to those great hearers and to those many bodhisattva great beings, “Noble sons, it is so, it is so.

original: de de bzhin no //
analyzed: de de bzhin no //
translated: It is just as it is.

original: rigs kyi bu dag khyed ji skad zer ba bzhin te /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu dag khyed ji skad zer ba bzhin te /
translated: Noble sons, it is just as you have said.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa gang yin pa de dag ni lha dang mi dang lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyis phyag bya ba'i gnas yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa gang yin pa de dag ni lha dang mi dang lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyis phyag bya ba'i gnas yin no //
translated: Those bodhisattva great beings who practice the perfection of wisdom are worthy of homage from the world with its gods, humans, and asuras.”

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: @82a *// byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po la brten nas /
analyzed: @82a *// byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po la brten nas /
translated: “Relying on the bodhisattva mahāsattvas,

original: 'jig rten du mi'i 'jig rten 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'jig rten du mi'i 'jig rten 'byung ngo //
translated: the human world appears in the world.

original: 'jig rten du lha'i 'jig rten 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'jig rten du lha'i 'jig rten 'byung ngo //
translated: The divine world appears in the world.

original: de bzhin du rgyal rigs shing s'a la chen po lta bu dag dang / bram ze'i rigs shing s'a la chen po lta bu dag dang / khyim bdag gi rigs shing s'a la chen po lta bu dag dang / 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po dag dang; rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lha rnams dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du rgyal rigs shing s'a la chen po lta bu dag dang / bram ze'i rigs shing s'a la chen po lta bu dag dang / khyim bdag gi rigs shing s'a la chen po lta bu dag dang / 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po dag dang; rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lha rnams dang /
translated: In the same way, the great sāla tree-like royal families, the great sāla tree-like brahmin families, the great sāla tree-like business families, the wheel-turning emperors, the Cāturmahā­rājika gods,

original: sum cu rtsa gsum pa dang / 'thab bral dang / dga' ldan dang / 'phrul dga' dang / gzhan 'phrul dbang byed dang / tshangs pa'i mdun na 'don dang / tshangs ris dang / tshangs 'khor dang / 'od chung dang / tshad med 'od dang /
analyzed: sum cu rtsa gsum pa dang / 'thab bral dang / dga' ldan dang / 'phrul dga' dang / gzhan 'phrul dbang byed dang / tshangs pa'i mdun na 'don dang / tshangs ris dang / tshangs 'khor dang / 'od chung dang / tshad med 'od dang /
translated: the Trāyastriṃśa, Yāma, Tuṣita, Nirmāṇarati, Para­nirmita­vaśa­vartin, Brahmakāyika, Brahmapurohita, Brahmapārṣadya, Parīttābha, Apramāṇābha,

original: 'od gsal dang / dge chung dang / tshad med dge dang / dge rgyas dang / 'bras bu che dang / sems can 'du shes med pa dang / gnas gtsang ma mi che ba dang / shin tu mthong dang / gya nom snang dang / mi gdung dang /🔽'og min dang / nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched du nye bar 'gro ba dang / rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched du nye bar 'gro ba dang / ci'ang med pa'i skye mched du nye bar 'gro ba dang / 'du shes med /
analyzed: 'od gsal dang / dge chung dang / tshad med dge dang / dge rgyas dang / 'bras bu che dang / sems can 'du shes med pa dang / gnas gtsang ma mi che ba dang / shin tu mthong dang / gya nom snang dang / mi gdung dang / 'og min dang / nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched du nye bar 'gro ba dang / rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched du nye bar 'gro ba dang / ci'ang med pa'i skye mched du nye bar 'gro ba dang / 'du shes med /
translated: the gods of the realm of the first concentration, the gods of the realm of the second concentration, the gods of the realm of the third concentration, the gods of the realm of the fourth concentration, the gods of the realm of Infinite Space, the gods of the realm of Infinite Consciousness, the gods of the realm of Nothingness, the gods of the realm of Neither Perception nor Non-perception, the gods of the realm of the Peak of Existence, the gods of the realm of the Cloudless, the gods of the realm of Merit-Born, the gods of the realm of Great Reward, the gods of the realm of No-thought, the gods of the realm of the Pure Abodes, the gods of the realm of the Not-Great, the gods of the realm of the Very Visible, the gods of the realm of the Beautiful Appearance, the gods of the realm of the Non-afflicted,🔽the gods of the realm of the Highest, the gods of the realm of the Sphere of Infinite Space, the gods of the realm of the Sphere of Infinite Consciousness, the gods of the realm of the Sphere of Nothingness, the gods of the realm of the Sphere of Neither Perception nor Non-Perception,

original: 'du shes med min skye mched du nye bar 'gro ba'i lha rnams 'jig rten du 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'du shes med min skye mched du nye bar 'gro ba'i lha rnams 'jig rten du 'byung ngo //
translated: the gods of the realm of the Sphere of Neither Perception nor Non-Perception appear in the world.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa rnams dang / lan gcig phyir 'ong ba rnams dang / phyir mi 'ong ba rnams dang / dgra bcom pa rnams dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams dang / byang chub @82b sems dpa' rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams 'jig rten du 'byung ngo //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa rnams dang / lan gcig phyir 'ong ba rnams dang / phyir mi 'ong ba rnams dang / dgra bcom pa rnams dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams dang / byang chub @82b sems dpa' rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams 'jig rten du 'byung ngo //
translated: the stream-enterers, the once-returners, the non-returners, the arhats, the pratyekabuddhas, the bodhisattvas, and the tathāgatas, arhats, genuinely perfect buddhas appear in the world.

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: byang chub sems dpa' la brten nas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' la brten nas /
translated: it is on account of the bodhisattvas

original: dkon mchog gsum 'jig rten du 'byung ngo //
analyzed: dkon mchog gsum 'jig rten du 'byung ngo //
translated: that the Three Jewels appear in the world.

original: 'jig rten pa'i 'tsho ba'i yo byad zas dang / skom dang / mal cha dang / stan dang / na ba'i gsos sman dang / 'tshog chas dang / nor bu dang / mu tig dang / bee d'urya dang / dung dang / man shel dang /

translated: The necessities of life for the world, namely, food and drink, beds and seats, remedies for sickness, and clothing, as well as jewels, pearls, beryl, conch shells, crystals,

analyzed: byu ru dang / dngul dang / gser 'jig rten du 'byung ngo //
translated: coral, silver, and gold appear in the world.

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: lha rnams dang / mi rnams kyi bde ba'i yo byad ji snyed pa rnams dang; srid pa'i bde ba rnams dang / mya ngan las 'das pa'i bde ba de dag thams cad kyang /🔽sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: lha rnams dang / mi rnams kyi bde ba'i yo byad ji snyed pa rnams dang; srid pa'i bde ba rnams dang / mya ngan las 'das pa'i bde ba de dag thams cad kyang / sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: all the happiness of cyclic existence and the happiness of nirvana

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po la brten te 'jig rten du 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po la brten te 'jig rten du 'byung ba yin no //
translated: are based on the bodhisattva great beings.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /

translated: while practicing bodhisattva conduct, abiding in the six perfections,

original: bdag nyid kyang sbyin pa sbyin par byed la; gzhan dag kyang sbyin pa la sbyor bar byed /🔽bdag nyid kyang tshul khrims bsrung la /

original: bdag nyid kyang brtson 'grus rtsom la /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyang brtson 'grus rtsom la /
translated: He himself makes an effort at perseverance and also connects others to perseverance.

original: gzhan dag kyang brtson 'grus la sbyor bar byed /
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang brtson 'grus la sbyor bar byed /
translated: They also cause others to practice diligence.

analyzed: bdag nyid kyang bsam gtan rnams bskyed la / gzhan dag @83a *//
translated: They themselves generate the meditative stabilities and

original: kyang bsam gtan rnams la sbyor bar byed /
analyzed: kyang bsam gtan rnams la sbyor bar byed /
translated: also cause others to practice the meditative stabilities.

original: bdag nyid kyang shes rab bsgom la /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyang shes rab bsgom la /
translated: They themselves cultivate wisdom and

analyzed: gzhan dag kyang shes rab sgom pa la sbyor bar byed pa'i phyir ro //

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: de bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni sems can thams cad la phan pa dang bde ba bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa yin no //🔽shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khri brgyad stong pa las /
analyzed: de bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni sems can thams cad la phan pa dang bde ba bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa yin no // shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khri brgyad stong pa las /
translated: therefore, bodhisattva great beings have set out to bring benefit and happiness to all sentient beings.

original: mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i le'u zhes bya ste bzhi pa'o ////
analyzed: mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i le'u zhes bya ste bzhi pa'o ////
translated: This was the fourth chapter, “Equal to the Unequalled,” of “The Perfection of Wisdom in Eighteen Thousand Lines.”

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khri brgyad stong pa /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khri brgyad stong pa /
translated: The Perfection of Wisdom in Eighteen Thousand Lines

original: bam po lnga pa /
analyzed: bam po lnga pa /
translated: Fascicle Five

original: de nas de'i tshe /
analyzed: de nas de'i tshe /
translated: Then, at that time,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi zhal gyi sgo nas ljags kyi dbang po phyung nas stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di khyab par mdzad do //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi zhal gyi sgo nas ljags kyi dbang po phyung nas stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di khyab par mdzad do //

original: de nas ljags kyi dbang po de las 'od 'phro ba kha dog du ma /
analyzed: de nas ljags kyi dbang po de las 'od 'phro ba kha dog du ma /
translated: Then from his tongue there came forth light of many colors,

original: kha dog sna tshogs byung ngo //🔽de byung nas shar phyogs su 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag snang ba chen pos khyab par gyur to //
analyzed: kha dog sna tshogs byung ngo // de byung nas shar phyogs su 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag snang ba chen pos khyab par gyur to //
translated: of various colors.🔽Having come forth, it illuminated the world systems in the eastern direction, as many as the sands of the Ganges river.

original: de bzhin du lho dang / nub dang / byang dang / byang shar dang / shar lho dang / lho nub dang / nub byang dang / 'og dang / steng gi phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag snang ba chen pos khyab par gyur to //
analyzed: de bzhin du lho dang / nub dang / byang dang / byang shar dang / shar lho dang / lho nub dang / nub byang dang / 'og dang / steng gi phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag snang ba chen pos khyab par gyur to //
translated: In the same way, it illuminated the world systems in the southern, western, northern, northeastern, southeastern, southwestern, and northwestern directions, below and above, as many as the sands of the Ganges river.

original: de nas shar phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed po de dag gi byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dpag tu med /
analyzed: de nas shar phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed po de dag gi byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dpag tu med /
translated: Then, the bodhisattva mahāsattvas in the eastern direction, in as many world systems as there are sand particles in the Gaṅgā River, were countless.

original: grangs med pa dag gis 'od kyi bkod pa de mthong nas rang rang gi @83b sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la zhus pa /
analyzed: grangs med pa dag gis 'od kyi bkod pa de mthong nas rang rang gi @83b sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la zhus pa /
translated: Then the bodhisattva mahāsattvas in the eastern direction, in as many world systems as there are sand particles in the Gaṅgā River, saw that array of light and asked their respective buddha bhagavāns:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Bhagavān,

original: 'di ltar 'jig rten gyi khams 'di dag snang ba chen pos khyab par gda' ba 'di su'i mthu lags /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'jig rten gyi khams 'di dag snang ba chen pos khyab par gda' ba 'di su'i mthu lags /
translated: whose power is it that these world systems are pervaded by this great light?”

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag la bka' stsal pa /
translated: Those buddha bhagavāns said to those bodhisattva mahāsattvas:

original: rigs kyi bu dag /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu dag /
translated: “Noble sons,

original: 'di ni nub phyogs logs na /
analyzed: 'di ni nub phyogs logs na /
translated: in the western direction

original: 'jig rten gyi khams mi mjed ces bya ba zhig yod de /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams mi mjed ces bya ba zhig yod de /

original: de na de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas sh'akya thub pa zhes bya ba bzhugs te /
analyzed: de na de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas sh'akya thub pa zhes bya ba bzhugs te /
translated: In it dwells the tathāgata, the arhat, the perfectly enlightened buddha Śākyamuni.

original: des 'di lta ste /
analyzed: des 'di lta ste /
translated: He did so in order to🔽teach the perfection of wisdom to the Bodhisattva-Mahasattvas.🔽He extended his tongue,🔽and with it he covered the whole of the great trichiliocosm.🔽And he emitted a ray of light from between his eyebrows, and this ray of light

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: illuminated all the Buddha-fields in the ten directions, as many as the sands of the Ganges,🔽and then it returned and circled around the Lord three times, and finally

original: ljags kyi dbang po phyung ste /
analyzed: ljags kyi dbang po phyung ste /
translated: disappeared into the crown of his head.🔽And all the Buddha-fields in the great trichiliocosm became one shining radiance.🔽And the Bodhisattva-Mahasattvas in all the Buddha-fields in the great trichiliocosm saw the Lord sitting on the Diamond Throne, and they saw the Lord's tongue🔽extended and the whole great trichiliocosm flooded with a great light.

original: phyogs bcu dag tu phyogs re rer yang 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed po 'di dag snang ba chen pos khyab par mdzad do //
analyzed: phyogs bcu dag tu phyogs re rer yang 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed po 'di dag snang ba chen pos khyab par mdzad do //
translated: And the Bodhisattva-Mahasattvas in all the Buddha-fields in the great trichiliocosm🔽saw the Lord sitting on the Diamond Throne, and they saw the Lord's tongue🔽extended and the whole great trichiliocosm flooded with a great light.🔽And the Bodhisattva-Mahasattvas in all the Buddha-fields in the great trichiliocosm🔽saw the Lord sitting on the Diamond Throne, and they saw the Lord's tongue🔽extended and the whole great trichiliocosm flooded with a great light.🔽And the Bodhisattva-Mahasattvas in all the Buddha-fields in the great trichiliocosm🔽saw the Lord sitting on the Diamond Throne, and they saw the Lord's tongue🔽extended and the whole great trichiliocosm flooded with a great light.

original: de bzhin du lho dang / nub dang / byang dang / 'og dang / steng dang / phyogs bcu kun gyi bar gyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag tu'ang de bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du lho dang / nub dang / byang dang / 'og dang / steng dang / phyogs bcu kun gyi bar gyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag tu'ang de bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: And the Bodhisattva-Mahasattvas in all the Buddha-fields in the great trichiliocosm🔽saw the Lord sitting on the Diamond Throne, and they saw the Lord's tongue🔽extended and the whole great trichiliocosm flooded with a great light.🔽And the Bodhisattva-Mahasattvas in all the Buddha-fields in the great trichiliocosm🔽saw the Lord sitting on the Diamond Throne, and they saw the Lord's tongue🔽extended and the whole great trichiliocosm flooded with a great light.

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag gis sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag gis sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag la 'di skad ces gsol to //

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das bdag cag kyang /

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas sh'akya thub pa de la blta ba dang / phyag bgyi ba dang / bsnyen bkur bgyi ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen @84a *//
translated: to see the Blessed One, the thus-gone, the worthy, the perfect Buddha Śākyamuni,

analyzed: po phyogs bcu nas 'dus pa de dag kyang blta ba dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de'ang mnyan pa'i slad du 'jig rten gyi khams mi mjed der mchi bar 'tshal lo //

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gis bka' stsal pa /
translated: Those blessed buddhas said,

original: rigs kyi bu dag /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu dag /
translated: “Noble sons,

analyzed: de'i dus la dbab par shes na deng zhig /

original: lan bdun bskor ba byas te /
analyzed: lan bdun bskor ba byas te /

translated: They brought parasols, victory banners, flags, flowers, flower garlands, incense, ointments, powders, robes, golden flowers, and silver flowers from the ten directions.

analyzed: sil snyan dang / pheg rdob pa dang / rol mo'i sgra dang bcas te /

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas sh'akya thub pa ga la ba der dong ngo //

translated: Then the gods of the Heaven of the Four Great Kings up to the gods of the Highest Heaven brought divine flowers, flower garlands, incense, ointments, powders, divine blue lotuses, lotuses,

analyzed: ku mu da dang / padma dkar po dang / mand'a ra ba dang / mand'a ra ba chen po dang / klu shing gi me tog dang / ta ma la'i lo ma rnams khyer te /
translated: and with flowers of the blue lotus, the red lotus, the white lotus, the jasmine, the champak, the coral tree, the great coral tree, the dragon flower, and the tamala leaf,

original: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa @84b dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas sh'akya thub pa ga la ba der dong ngo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa @84b dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas sh'akya thub pa ga la ba der dong ngo //
translated: they went to the place where the Blessed One, the thus-gone, worthy, perfect Buddha Śākyamuni was staying.🔽Then, with those flowers, flower garlands, incense, ointments, powders, clothes, parasols, victory banners,🔽and flags,

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag dang / lha de dag gis me tog dang / me tog phreng dang / spos dang / byug pa dang / phye ma dang / na bza' dang / gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang /🔽ba dan de dag gis /
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag dang / lha de dag gis me tog dang / me tog phreng dang / spos dang / byug pa dang / phye ma dang / na bza' dang / gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan de dag gis /
translated: those bodhisattva great beings and gods

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas sh'akya thub pa la gtor / mngon par gtor /
translated: scattered them over the Blessed One, the thus-gone, worthy, perfect Buddha Śākyamuni,🔽sprinkled them over him,

original: mngon par rab tu gtor ro //
analyzed: mngon par rab tu gtor ro //
translated: and scattered them over him again and again.

original: de nas me tog la sogs pa de dag ni steng gi nam mkha' la mngon par 'phags nas stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'dir me tog gi khang pa brtsegs pa /🔽gru bzhi lham pa /🔽ka ba bzhi zug pa /
analyzed: de nas me tog la sogs pa de dag ni steng gi nam mkha' la mngon par 'phags nas stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'dir me tog gi khang pa brtsegs pa / gru bzhi lham pa / ka ba bzhi zug pa /
translated: Then those flowers and so forth rose up into the sky above and in this great trichiliocosm they became a flower mansion🔽with four sides,🔽four corners,

original: cha mnyam pa /
analyzed: cha mnyam pa /
translated: four pillars,

original: shin tu rnam par phye ba /
analyzed: shin tu rnam par phye ba /
translated: very spacious,

original: nyams dga' ba yid du 'ong ba zhig tu red de 'dug par gyur to //
analyzed: nyams dga' ba yid du 'ong ba zhig tu red de 'dug par gyur to //
translated: beautiful, and delightful.

original: de nas 'khor de las srog chags bye ba khrag khrig phrag 'bum stan las langs te /
analyzed: de nas 'khor de las srog chags bye ba khrag khrig phrag 'bum stan las langs te /
translated: Then from that assembly hundreds of thousands of niyutas of koṭis of living beings rose from their seats

original: bcom ldan 'das ga la ba de logs su thal mo sbyar ba btud nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ga la ba de logs su thal mo sbyar ba btud nas /
translated: and bowed to the Blessed One with palms joined.

original: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: They said this to the Blessed One:

original: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis chos ci lta bu dag brnyes pa'i chos de lta bu dag bdag cag gis kyang ma 'ongs pa'i dus na thob par gyur cig /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis chos ci lta bu dag brnyes pa'i chos de lta bu dag bdag cag gis kyang ma 'ongs pa'i dus na thob par gyur cig /
translated: “Blessed One, may we in the future obtain the Dharma that the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One has obtained.”

original: da ltar de bzhin gshegs pa ji ltar chos ston pa de bzhin du nyan thos kyi dge 'dun la lung 'bog cing /🔽'khor 'di lta bu dag la @85a *//
analyzed: da ltar de bzhin gshegs pa ji ltar chos ston pa de bzhin du nyan thos kyi dge 'dun la lung 'bog cing / 'khor 'di lta bu dag la @85a *//
translated: Just as the Tathāgata now teaches the Dharma, may I also teach the Dharma to the saṅgha of śrāvakas.

original: chos ston par yang gyur cig /
analyzed: chos ston par yang gyur cig /
translated: May I also teach the Dharma to such a retinue.🔽”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis rigs kyi bu de dag gi bsam pa thugs su chud de /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis rigs kyi bu de dag gi bsam pa thugs su chud de /
translated: Then the Bhagavān, knowing the thoughts that were in the minds of those sons of a good family,

original: chos thams cad skye ba med pa dang / mngon par 'du byed pa med pa dang / chos thams cad 'byung ba med par bzod par gyur par mkhyen nas 'dzum pa mdzad do //
analyzed: chos thams cad skye ba med pa dang / mngon par 'du byed pa med pa dang / chos thams cad 'byung ba med par bzod par gyur par mkhyen nas 'dzum pa mdzad do //
translated: knew that they had attained the forbearance of the birthlessness of all things, and he smiled.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bos 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bos 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the venerable Ānanda said to the Bhagavān:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Bhagavān,

original: 'dzum pa mdzad pa'i rgyu gang lags /
analyzed: 'dzum pa mdzad pa'i rgyu gang lags /
translated: what is the cause of your smiling?

original: rkyen gang lags /
analyzed: rkyen gang lags /
translated: What is the reason?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Bhagavān said,

original: kun dga' bo /
analyzed: kun dga' bo /
translated: “Ānanda,

original: 'khor 'di las srog chags bye ba khrag khrig phrag 'bum gyis mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob ste /
analyzed: 'khor 'di las srog chags bye ba khrag khrig phrag 'bum gyis mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob ste /
translated: within this retinue, 100,000 quintillion beings have attained the forbearance of the birthlessness of all things.

original: 'di dag ni ma 'ongs pa'i dus na bskal pa bye ba phrag drug cu rtsa bzhi na /
analyzed: 'di dag ni ma 'ongs pa'i dus na bskal pa bye ba phrag drug cu rtsa bzhi na /
translated: These, Subhūti, will in the future, after sixty-four eons,

original: bskal pa me tog 'byung gnas zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bskal pa me tog 'byung gnas zhes bya ba la /
translated: in the Flower Origin eon,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas byang chub kyi yan lag gi me tog ces bya ba dag 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas byang chub kyi yan lag gi me tog ces bya ba dag 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: become thus-gone, worthy, perfect buddhas called Bodhyaṅgakeśarin.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khri brgyad stong pa las /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khri brgyad stong pa las /
translated: In the Perfection of Wisdom in Eighteen Thousand Lines

original: ljags kyi dbang po'i le'u zhes bya ba ste lnga pa'o ////
analyzed: ljags kyi dbang po'i le'u zhes bya ba ste lnga pa'o ////
translated: the chapter called “The Tongue Faculty” is the fifth.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la bka' stsal pa /
translated: Then the Blessed One said to the venerable Subhūti:

original: rab 'byor / ci nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la nges par 'byung bar 'gyur bar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las brtsams @85b te; byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams la chos kyi gtam🔽bya bar khyod spobs par gyis shig /
analyzed: rab 'byor / ci nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la nges par 'byung bar 'gyur bar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las brtsams @85b te; byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams la chos kyi gtam bya bar khyod spobs par gyis shig /
translated: Subhūti, you should be confident to give a Dharma discourse to the bodhisattva great beings, beginning with the perfection of wisdom, so that the bodhisattva great beings will be delivered through the perfection of wisdom.”

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag dang / nyan thos chen po de dag dang / lha'i bu de dag 'di snyam du sems te /🔽ci tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor 'di rang gi shes rab dang / spobs pa'i stobs bskyed pa'i go chas /
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag dang / nyan thos chen po de dag dang / lha'i bu de dag 'di snyam du sems te / ci tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor 'di rang gi shes rab dang / spobs pa'i stobs bskyed pa'i go chas /
translated: Then those bodhisattva great beings, those great hearers, and those sons of gods thought this:

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ston par byed dam /🔽'on te sangs rgyas kyi mthus ston par byed /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ston par byed dam / 'on te sangs rgyas kyi mthus ston par byed /
translated: “Is the venerable Subhūti teaching the perfection of wisdom to the bodhisattva great beings with the armor of the power of his own wisdom and eloquence,🔽or is he teaching it through the power of the Buddha?”

original: snyam mo // de nas sangs rgyas kyi mthus /
analyzed: snyam mo // de nas sangs rgyas kyi mthus /
translated: Then, through the power of the Buddha,

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis /
translated: The venerable Subhūti,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag dang / nyan thos chen po de dag dang / lha'i bu de dag gi sems kyi yongs su rtog pa sems kyis shes nas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag dang / nyan thos chen po de dag dang / lha'i bu de dag gi sems kyi yongs su rtog pa sems kyis shes nas /
translated: knowing in his own mind the thoughts that had occurred to those bodhisattva great beings, those great hearers, and those sons of gods,

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu la smras pa /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu la smras pa /
translated: said to the venerable Śāriputra,

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: “Venerable Śāriputra,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi nyan thos rnams smra ba dang / ston pa dang / brjod pa gang ci'ang rung ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi nyan thos rnams smra ba dang / ston pa dang / brjod pa gang ci'ang rung ste /
translated: whatever the Blessed One’s hearers may say, teach, explain, and express,

original: de dag thams cad ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i mthu yin no //
analyzed: de dag thams cad ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i mthu yin no //
translated: all of that is the Tathāgata’s power.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas chos bstan pa gang yin pa de dag thams cad ni chos nyid dang mi 'gal lo //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas chos bstan pa gang yin pa de dag thams cad ni chos nyid dang mi 'gal lo //
translated: Whatever Dharma the Tathāgata teaches, all of that is not in conflict with reality.

original: rigs kyi bu de dag chos bstan pa de la slob na'ang chos nyid de mngon sum du byed do //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu de dag chos bstan pa de la slob na'ang chos nyid de mngon sum du byed do //
translated: If those sons of family train in that Dharma teaching, they will actualize that reality.

original: sh'a ri'i bu; de bzhin gshegs pa 'di nyid thabs la mkhas pa'i tshul gyis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ston gyi /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu; de bzhin gshegs pa 'di nyid thabs la mkhas pa'i tshul gyis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ston gyi /
translated: Shariputra, the Tathagata, by the method of skillful means, teaches the perfection of wisdom to the bodhisattva-mahasattva.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i @86a *//
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i @86a *//
translated: Venerable Shariputra,

original: bu; 'di la nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po thams cad ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ston par mi nus te /
analyzed: bu; 'di la nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po thams cad ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ston par mi nus te /
translated: herein, the sravakas, pratyekabuddhas, and all bodhisattva-mahasattvas are unable to teach the perfection of wisdom.

original: yul ma yin no //
analyzed: yul ma yin no //
translated: It is not their domain.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //🔽bcom ldan 'das 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to // bcom ldan 'das 'di lta ste /
translated: Then the Venerable Subhuti said to the Lord:🔽Lord, it is said, 'bodhisattva, bodhisattva.'

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zhes bgyi na; byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zhes bgyi ba de chos gang gi tshig bla dvags lags /🔽bcom ldan 'das bdag gis ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zhes bgyi na; byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zhes bgyi ba de chos gang gi tshig bla dvags lags / bcom ldan 'das bdag gis ni /
translated: What dharma does the term 'bodhisattva' designate?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: Lord, I do not see here any bodhisattva who could be taught the perfection of wisdom.🔽Lord, I do not find any dharma which could be called 'bodhisattva.'

original: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bgyi ba'i ming gi chos de yang dag par rjes su ma mthong ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bgyi ba'i ming gi chos de yang dag par rjes su ma mthong ste /
translated: I do not see that dharma called ‘bodhisattva’ either.

original: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de dang / byang chub sems dpa'i ming de'ang bdag gis yang dag par rjes su ma mthong lags na /🔽byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang zhig shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang la gdams par bgyi /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de dang / byang chub sems dpa'i ming de'ang bdag gis yang dag par rjes su ma mthong lags na / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang zhig shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang la gdams par bgyi /
translated: Blessed One, if I do not see those bodhisattva great beings, that perfection of wisdom, and that name ‘bodhisattva’ either,

original: rjes su ston par bgyi /🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: rjes su ston par bgyi / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: then with regard to which bodhisattva great being and with regard to which perfection of wisdom should I instruct and teach?🔽Blessed One, I do not see any bodhisattva great being at all.”

original: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /
translated: The Blessed One said, “Subhūti, it is like this:

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / byang chub sems dpa'i ming de ni ming tsam du zad de /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / byang chub sems dpa'i ming de ni ming tsam du zad de /
translated: that perfection of wisdom, that bodhisattva, and that name ‘bodhisattva’ are just names.

original: ming de'ang nang na'ang med /
analyzed: ming de'ang nang na'ang med /
translated: That name does not exist internally,

original: phyi rol na'ang med /
analyzed: phyi rol na'ang med /
translated: it does not exist externally,

original: gnyi ga med par yang mi dmigs so //
analyzed: gnyi ga med par yang mi dmigs so //
translated: and it is not apprehended as either of those two.

original: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /
translated: Subhūti, it is like this:

original: dper na / sems @86b can sems can zhes bya bar ming du brjod kyang /
analyzed: dper na / sems @86b can sems can zhes bya bar ming du brjod kyang /
translated: For example, although sentient beings are referred to by the name “sentient beings,”

original: sems can gang yang mi dmigs te /
analyzed: sems can gang yang mi dmigs te /
translated: no sentient being can be apprehended.

original: de ni ming du btags pa tsam du zad la /🔽btags pa'i chos gang yin pa de la ni ming gi brda tsam gyis tha snyad gdags pa ma gtogs par skye ba med /
analyzed: de ni ming du btags pa tsam du zad la / btags pa'i chos gang yin pa de la ni ming gi brda tsam gyis tha snyad gdags pa ma gtogs par skye ba med /
translated: That is merely a designation.

original: 'gag pa med do //
analyzed: 'gag pa med do //
translated: As for a phenomenon that is a designation, apart from being a conventional term that is merely a nominal convention, it is not produced and does not cease.

original: de bzhin du bdag dang / srog dang / skye ba po dang / gso ba dang / skyes bu dang / gang zag dang / shed las skyes pa dang / shed bu dang / byed pa po dang / byed du 'jug pa po dang / slong ba po dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du bdag dang / srog dang / skye ba po dang / gso ba dang / skyes bu dang / gang zag dang / shed las skyes pa dang / shed bu dang / byed pa po dang / byed du 'jug pa po dang / slong ba po dang /
translated: Similarly, a self, a life-force, a being, a creature, a human, an individual, one born of Manu, a child of Manu, a doer, an instigator, one who feels,

original: kun nas slong ba po dang / tshor ba po dang / tshor bar byed du 'jug pa po dang / shes pa po dang / mthong ba po de dag thams cad kyang btags pa'i chos yin la /🔽btags pa'i chos gang yin pa de la ni skye ba med /
analyzed: kun nas slong ba po dang / tshor ba po dang / tshor bar byed du 'jug pa po dang / shes pa po dang / mthong ba po de dag thams cad kyang btags pa'i chos yin la / btags pa'i chos gang yin pa de la ni skye ba med /
translated: one who causes to feel, one who knows, and one who sees—all of these are phenomena that are designations.

original: 'gag pa med de /
analyzed: 'gag pa med de /
translated: As for a phenomenon that is a designation, it is not produced and does not cease.

original: 'di ltar ming gi brda tsam gyis tha snyad du gdags par zad do //
analyzed: 'di ltar ming gi brda tsam gyis tha snyad du gdags par zad do //
translated: It is just a designation by way of a mere name.

original: ming de'ang nang na'ang med /
analyzed: ming de'ang nang na'ang med /
translated: That name does not exist internally,

original: phyi rol na'ang med; gnyi ga med par yang mi dmigs so //
analyzed: phyi rol na'ang med; gnyi ga med par yang mi dmigs so //
translated: does not exist externally, and is not apprehended to exist between the two.

original: rab 'byor / de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang yin pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' gang yin pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i ming gang yin pa de dag thams cad ni btags pa'i chos yin la /🔽btags pa'i chos de la ni ming gi brdas tha snyad du gdags pa ma gtogs par skye ba med /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang yin pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' gang yin pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i ming gang yin pa de dag thams cad ni btags pa'i chos yin la / btags pa'i chos de la ni ming gi brdas tha snyad du gdags pa ma gtogs par skye ba med /
translated: “Subhūti, in the same way, all these—the perfection of wisdom, the bodhisattva, and the name of a bodhisattva—are imputed phenomena.

original: 'gag pa med de /
analyzed: 'gag pa med de /
translated: That imputed phenomenon has no arising and no ceasing, except for the designation by way of a name.

original: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /
translated: “Subhūti, it is like this:

original: dper na / nang gi lus gang yin pa de la gzugs zhes bya ba 'di ni chos su btags pa tsam du zad la /🔽chos su btags pa de la ni ming gi brda tsam gyis tha snyad du gdags pa ma gtogs par @87a *//
analyzed: dper na / nang gi lus gang yin pa de la gzugs zhes bya ba 'di ni chos su btags pa tsam du zad la / chos su btags pa de la ni ming gi brda tsam gyis tha snyad du gdags pa ma gtogs par @87a *//
translated: For example, that which is the inner body is just a mere imputation of a phenomenon called ‘form.’

original: skye ba med /
analyzed: skye ba med /
translated: That imputed phenomenon has no arising and no ceasing, except for the designation by way of a mere name.🔽“Subhūti, in the same way, all these—the perfection of wisdom, the bodhisattva, and the name of a bodhisattva—are imputed phenomena.

original: 'gag pa med de /
analyzed: 'gag pa med de /
translated: That imputed phenomenon has no arising and no ceasing, except for the designation by way of a mere name.

original: ming de'ang nang na'ang med; phyi rol na'ang med /
analyzed: ming de'ang nang na'ang med; phyi rol na'ang med /
translated: This name does not exist internally, nor does it exist externally, and nor does it abide somewhere in between.🔽

original: gnyi ga med par yang mi dmigs so //
analyzed: gnyi ga med par yang mi dmigs so //
translated: That name also does not exist internally, does not exist externally, and is not to be apprehended anywhere other than there.

original: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba 'di ni chos su btags pa tsam du zad la /
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba 'di ni chos su btags pa tsam du zad la /
translated: Similarly, the designation of a dharma as ‘feeling,’ ‘perception,’ ‘volitional factors,’ or ‘consciousness’ is a mere designation.

original: chos su btags pa de la ni ming gi brda tsam gyis tha snyad du gdags pa ma gtogs par skye ba med /🔽'gag pa med de /🔽ming de'ang nang na'ang med /🔽phyi rol na'ang med /
analyzed: chos su btags pa de la ni ming gi brda tsam gyis tha snyad du gdags pa ma gtogs par skye ba med / 'gag pa med de / ming de'ang nang na'ang med / phyi rol na'ang med /
translated: That designation of a dharma is not produced and does not stop, except for the designation by means of a mere name.

original: gnyi ga med par yang mi dmigs so //
analyzed: gnyi ga med par yang mi dmigs so //
translated: That name also does not exist internally, does not exist externally, and is not to be apprehended anywhere other than there.

original: rab 'byor / de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / byang chub sems dpa'i ming zhes bya ba gang yin pa de dag thams cad ni btags pa'i chos yin la /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / byang chub sems dpa'i ming zhes bya ba gang yin pa de dag thams cad ni btags pa'i chos yin la /
translated: Subhūti, similarly, all those—the perfection of wisdom, the bodhisattva, and the name ‘bodhisattva’—are dharmas that are designations.

original: btags pa'i chos gang yin pa de la ni ming gi brda tsam gyis tha snyad du gdags pa ma gtogs par skye ba med /
analyzed: btags pa'i chos gang yin pa de la ni ming gi brda tsam gyis tha snyad du gdags pa ma gtogs par skye ba med /
translated: As for the phenomena that are imputed, apart from being designated by names and symbols, they are not produced.

original: 'gag pa med do //
analyzed: 'gag pa med do //
translated: In the case of any imputed phenomenon, there is no arising and no ceasing, except for the nominal designation by way of mere nominal expressions.

original: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /
translated: Subhūti, it is like this:

original: mig ces bya ba de ni chos su btags pa tsam du zad la /🔽chos su btags pa de la ni ming gi brda tsam gyis tha snyad du gdags pa ma gtogs par skye ba med /
analyzed: mig ces bya ba de ni chos su btags pa tsam du zad la / chos su btags pa de la ni ming gi brda tsam gyis tha snyad du gdags pa ma gtogs par skye ba med /
translated: “Eye” is just a nominal designation of a phenomenon.

original: 'gag pa med do //
analyzed: 'gag pa med do //
translated: In the case of that nominal designation of a phenomenon, there is no arising and no ceasing, except for the nominal designation by way of mere nominal expressions.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: mig ces bya ba'i ming de'ang nang na'ang med /
analyzed: mig ces bya ba'i ming de'ang nang na'ang med /
translated: That name “eye” does not exist internally,

original: phyi rol na'ang med /
analyzed: phyi rol na'ang med /
translated: does not exist externally,

original: gnyi ga med par yang mi dmigs so //🔽rab 'byor / de bzhin du rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid ces bya ba de ni /
analyzed: gnyi ga med par yang mi dmigs so // rab 'byor / de bzhin du rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid ces bya ba de ni /
translated: and is not apprehended as either of those two.🔽Subhūti, it is like this:

original: 'di lta ste /🔽chos su btags pa tsam du zad la /🔽chos su btags pa de la ni @87b ming gi brda tsam gyis tha snyad du gdags pa ma gtogs par skye ba med /
analyzed: 'di lta ste / chos su btags pa tsam du zad la / chos su btags pa de la ni @87b ming gi brda tsam gyis tha snyad du gdags pa ma gtogs par skye ba med /
translated: “Ear,” “nose,” “tongue,” “body,” and “mind” are just nominal designations of phenomena.

original: 'gag pa med do //
analyzed: 'gag pa med do //
translated: In the case of that nominal designation of a phenomenon, there is no arising and no ceasing, except for the nominal designation by way of mere nominal expressions.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: yid ces bya ba'i ming de'ang nang na'ang med /
analyzed: yid ces bya ba'i ming de'ang nang na'ang med /
translated: That which is called “mind” is not found internally,

original: phyi rol na'ang med /
analyzed: phyi rol na'ang med /
translated: nor is it found externally,

original: gnyi ga med par yang mi dmigs so //
analyzed: gnyi ga med par yang mi dmigs so //
translated: nor is it found between the two, nor is it not found.

original: rab 'byor / gzugs zhes bya ba de ni chos su btags pa tsam du zad la /🔽chos su btags pa de la ni ming gi brda tsam gyis tha snyad du gdags pa ma gtogs par skye ba med /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzugs zhes bya ba de ni chos su btags pa tsam du zad la / chos su btags pa de la ni ming gi brda tsam gyis tha snyad du gdags pa ma gtogs par skye ba med /
translated: “Subhūti, that which is called ‘form’ is just a designation of a phenomenon.

original: 'gag pa med de /
analyzed: 'gag pa med de /
translated: That designation of a phenomenon is not produced and does not cease, except for the conventional expression by the mere designation of a name.

original: ming de'ang nang na'ang med /
analyzed: ming de'ang nang na'ang med /
translated: That name is not found internally,

original: phyi rol na'ang med /
analyzed: phyi rol na'ang med /
translated: nor is it found externally,

original: gnyi ga med par yang mi dmigs so //
analyzed: gnyi ga med par yang mi dmigs so //
translated: nor is it found between the two.

original: rab 'byor / de bzhin du sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya dang / chos zhes bya ba de ni chos su btags pa tsam du zad la /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin du sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya dang / chos zhes bya ba de ni chos su btags pa tsam du zad la /
translated: “Subhūti, that which is called ‘sound,’ ‘smell,’ ‘taste,’ ‘texture,’ and ‘mental phenomena’ are just designations of phenomena.

original: chos su btags pa de la ni ming gi brda tsam gyis tha snyad du gdags pa ma gtogs par skye ba med /🔽'gag pa med de /
analyzed: chos su btags pa de la ni ming gi brda tsam gyis tha snyad du gdags pa ma gtogs par skye ba med / 'gag pa med de /
translated: Those designations of phenomena are not produced and do not cease, except for the conventional expression by the mere designation of a name.

original: chos zhes bya ba'i ming de'ang nang na'ang med /
analyzed: chos zhes bya ba'i ming de'ang nang na'ang med /
translated: That which is called ‘mental phenomena’ is not found internally,

original: phyi rol na'ang med /
analyzed: phyi rol na'ang med /
translated: nor is it found externally,🔽nor is it found between the two.

original: gnyi ga med par yang mi dmigs so //
analyzed: gnyi ga med par yang mi dmigs so //
translated: It is also not apprehended as neither of those two.

original: rab 'byor / mig gi khams zhes bya ba de ni chos su btags pa tsam du zad la /🔽chos su btags pa de la ni ming gi brda tsam gyis tha snyad du gdags pa ma gtogs par skye ba med /
analyzed: rab 'byor / mig gi khams zhes bya ba de ni chos su btags pa tsam du zad la / chos su btags pa de la ni ming gi brda tsam gyis tha snyad du gdags pa ma gtogs par skye ba med /
translated: “Subhūti, what is called the eye constituent is just a label for a dharma.

original: 'gag pa med de /
analyzed: 'gag pa med de /
translated: That label for a dharma is not produced and does not stop, except for the designation by means of a name and symbol.

original: mig gi khams zhes bya ba'i ming de'ang nang na'ang med /
analyzed: mig gi khams zhes bya ba'i ming de'ang nang na'ang med /
translated: “The name ‘eye constituent’ is not inside,

original: phyi rol na'ang med /
analyzed: phyi rol na'ang med /
translated: not outside,

original: gnyi ga med par yang mi dmigs so //
analyzed: gnyi ga med par yang mi dmigs so //
translated: and not in between.

original: rab 'byor gzugs kyi khams zhes bya ba de ni chos su btags pa tsam du zad la /🔽chos su btags pa de la ni ming gi brda tsam gyis tha snyad du gdags pa ma gtogs par skye @88a *//
analyzed: rab 'byor gzugs kyi khams zhes bya ba de ni chos su btags pa tsam du zad la / chos su btags pa de la ni ming gi brda tsam gyis tha snyad du gdags pa ma gtogs par skye @88a *//
translated: “Subhūti, what is called the form constituent is just a label for a dharma.

original: ba med / 'gag pa med do //
analyzed: ba med / 'gag pa med do //
translated: That label for a dharma is not produced and does not stop, except for the designation by means of a name and symbol.

original: gzugs kyi khams zhes bya ba'i ming de'ang nang na'ang med /
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams zhes bya ba'i ming de'ang nang na'ang med /
translated: “The name ‘form constituent’ is not inside,

original: phyi rol na'ang med /🔽gnyi ga med par yang mi dmigs so //
analyzed: phyi rol na'ang med /🔽gnyi ga med par yang mi dmigs so //
translated: not outside,🔽and not in between.

original: rab 'byor / mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams zhes bya ba de ni chos su btags pa tsam du zad la /🔽chos su btags pa de la ni ming gi brda tsam gyis tha snyad du gdags pa ma gtogs par skye ba med /
analyzed: rab 'byor / mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams zhes bya ba de ni chos su btags pa tsam du zad la / chos su btags pa de la ni ming gi brda tsam gyis tha snyad du gdags pa ma gtogs par skye ba med /
translated: Subhūti, the so-called eye-consciousness element is just a label for a phenomenon.

original: 'gag pa med de /
analyzed: 'gag pa med de /
translated: That label for a phenomenon is not produced and does not stop, except for the verbal designation by means of a nominal designation.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams zhes bya ba'i ming de'ang nang na'ang med /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams zhes bya ba'i ming de'ang nang na'ang med /
translated: The name ‘eye-consciousness element’ does not exist internally,

original: phyi rol na'ang med /
analyzed: phyi rol na'ang med /
translated: does not exist externally,

original: gnyi ga med par yang mi dmigs so //
analyzed: gnyi ga med par yang mi dmigs so //
translated: and is not apprehended to be somewhere in between the two.

original: rab 'byor / de bzhin du rna ba'i khams dang / sgra'i khams dang / rna ba'i rnam par shes pa'i khams dang / sna'i khams dang / dri'i khams dang / sna'i rnam par shes pa'i khams dang / lce'i khams dang / ro'i khams dang / lce'i rnam par shes pa'i khams dang /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin du rna ba'i khams dang / sgra'i khams dang / rna ba'i rnam par shes pa'i khams dang / sna'i khams dang / dri'i khams dang / sna'i rnam par shes pa'i khams dang / lce'i khams dang / ro'i khams dang / lce'i rnam par shes pa'i khams dang /
translated: Subhūti, similarly, the ear element, sound element, and ear-consciousness element; the nose element, smell element, and nose-consciousness element; the tongue element, taste element, and tongue-consciousness element;

original: lus kyi khams dang / reg bya'i khams dang / lus kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang / yid kyi khams dang / chos kyi khams dang; yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams zhes bya ba de ni chos su btags pa tsam du zad la /
analyzed: lus kyi khams dang / reg bya'i khams dang / lus kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang / yid kyi khams dang / chos kyi khams dang; yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams zhes bya ba de ni chos su btags pa tsam du zad la /
translated: the element of the body, the element of tangibles, the element of the body-consciousness, the element of the mind, the element of mental objects, and the element of mind-consciousness are simply conceptualized as mental objects.

original: chos su btags pa de la ni ming gi brda tsam gyis tha snyad du gdags pa ma gtogs par skye ba med; 'gag pa med de /
analyzed: chos su btags pa de la ni ming gi brda tsam gyis tha snyad du gdags pa ma gtogs par skye ba med; 'gag pa med de /
translated: In those conceptualized mental objects, apart from being designated by names and symbols, there is no arising and no ceasing.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams zhes bya ba'i ming de'ang nang na'ang med /
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams zhes bya ba'i ming de'ang nang na'ang med /
translated: The name ‘element of mind-consciousness’ does not exist internally,

original: phyi rol na'ang med /
analyzed: phyi rol na'ang med /
translated: nor does it exist externally,

original: gnyi ga med par yang mi dmigs so //
analyzed: gnyi ga med par yang mi dmigs so //
translated: nor is it apprehended apart from both.

original: rab 'byor / de bzhin @88b du 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin @88b du 'di lta ste /
translated: “Subhūti, it is thus.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i ming zhes bya ba de ni /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i ming zhes bya ba de ni /
translated: The so-called perfection of wisdom, the so-called bodhisattva, and the so-called name of a bodhisattva

original: 'di ltar btags pa'i chos yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar btags pa'i chos yin la /
translated: are all conceptualized phenomena.

original: btags pa'i chos de la ni ming gi brda tsam gyis tha snyad du gdags pa ma gtogs par skye ba med /
analyzed: btags pa'i chos de la ni ming gi brda tsam gyis tha snyad du gdags pa ma gtogs par skye ba med /
translated: As for the phenomena that are designated, apart from being imputed by the mere labels of names, they are not produced

original: 'gag pa med de /
analyzed: 'gag pa med de /
translated: and do not cease.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i ming zhes bya ba de'ang nang na'ang med /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i ming zhes bya ba de'ang nang na'ang med /
translated: The so-called perfection of wisdom, the so-called bodhisattva, and the so-called name of a bodhisattva are not found within,

original: phyi rol na'ang med /
analyzed: phyi rol na'ang med /
translated: not found without,

original: gnyi ga med par yang mi dmigs so //
analyzed: gnyi ga med par yang mi dmigs so //
translated: and not found without being either of those two.

original: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /
translated: “Subhūti, it is like this:

original: dper na / nang gi lus zhes bya ba 'di ni ming tsam gyis tha snyad gdags pa ste /
analyzed: dper na / nang gi lus zhes bya ba 'di ni ming tsam gyis tha snyad gdags pa ste /
translated: The so-called inner body is merely a name that is imputed by convention.

original: mgo bo dang / mjing pa dang / phrag pa dang / lag pa dang / rgal tshigs dang / rtsib ma dang / dpyi dang / brla dang / rje ngar dang / rkang pa'i rus pa zhes bya bar ming gis tha snyad du 'dogs pa de dag ni chos su btags pa tsam du zad la /
analyzed: mgo bo dang / mjing pa dang / phrag pa dang / lag pa dang / rgal tshigs dang / rtsib ma dang / dpyi dang / brla dang / rje ngar dang / rkang pa'i rus pa zhes bya bar ming gis tha snyad du 'dogs pa de dag ni chos su btags pa tsam du zad la /
translated: The head, neck, shoulders, arms, spine, ribs, hips, thighs, calves, and bones of the feet are merely imputed as phenomena by the labels of names.

original: chos su btags pa de dag ni ming gi brda tsam gyis tha snyad du btags pa ma gtogs par skye ba med /
analyzed: chos su btags pa de dag ni ming gi brda tsam gyis tha snyad du btags pa ma gtogs par skye ba med /
translated: These phenomena that are imputed are not produced, except for the mere imputation of terms by names and symbols.

original: 'gag pa med de /
analyzed: 'gag pa med de /
translated: Those phenomena that are designated are not produced and do not stop, except for the nominal designation by way of mere nominal convention.

original: ming de'ang nang na'ang med /
analyzed: ming de'ang nang na'ang med /
translated: That name also is not apprehended as being internal,

original: phyi rol na'ang med /
analyzed: phyi rol na'ang med /
translated: or external,

original: gnyi ga med par yang mi dmigs so //🔽rab 'byor / de bzhin du 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gnyi ga med par yang mi dmigs so // rab 'byor / de bzhin du 'di lta ste /
translated: or other than those two.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i ming zhes bya ba de dag thams cad ni btags pa'i chos yin la /🔽btags pa'i chos de dag la ni ming gi brda tsam gyis tha snyad du gdags pa ma gtogs par skye ba med /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i ming zhes bya ba de dag thams cad ni btags pa'i chos yin la / btags pa'i chos de dag la ni ming gi brda tsam gyis tha snyad du gdags pa ma gtogs par skye ba med /
translated: Similarly, Subhūti, all those—that is, the perfection of wisdom, the bodhisattva, and the name of a bodhisattva—are phenomena that are designations.

original: @89a *// 'gag pa med de /🔽ming de'ang nang na'ang med /🔽phyi rol na'ang med /
analyzed: @89a *// 'gag pa med de / ming de'ang nang na'ang med / phyi rol na'ang med /
translated: Those phenomena that are designations are not produced and do not stop, except for the nominal designation by way of mere nominal convention.🔽That name also is not apprehended as being internal,🔽or external,

original: gnyi ga med par yang mi dmigs so //
analyzed: gnyi ga med par yang mi dmigs so //
translated: or other than those two.

original: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste dper na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste dper na /
translated: Subhūti, it is just as, for example,

original: phyi rol gyi rtsva dang / shing dang / yal ga dang / lo ma dang / 'dab ma zhes bya ba gang yin pa de dag thams cad ni ming sna tshogs kyis tha snyad du gdags par zad la /🔽ming de dag kyang ming gi brda tsam gyis tha snyad du gdags pa ma gtogs par skye ba med /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi rtsva dang / shing dang / yal ga dang / lo ma dang / 'dab ma zhes bya ba gang yin pa de dag thams cad ni ming sna tshogs kyis tha snyad du gdags par zad la / ming de dag kyang ming gi brda tsam gyis tha snyad du gdags pa ma gtogs par skye ba med /
translated: “All those so-called external grasses, trees, branches, leaves, and petals are simply designated by various names.

original: 'gag pa med de /🔽ming de dag kyang nang na'ang med /🔽phyi rol na'ang med /
analyzed: 'gag pa med de / ming de dag kyang nang na'ang med / phyi rol na'ang med /
translated: Those names are not produced and do not cease, except for the conventional designation by the mere conventional symbol of a name.🔽Those names are not apprehended as being internal,

original: gnyi ga med par yang mi dmigs so //
analyzed: gnyi ga med par yang mi dmigs so //
translated: external, or in between.

original: rab 'byor / de bzhin du 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin du 'di lta ste /
translated: “Subhūti, it is like this:

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i ming zhes bya ba de dag thams cad ni btags pa'i chos yin la /🔽btags pa'i chos de dag la ni ming gi brda tsam gyis tha snyad du gdags pa ma gtogs par skye ba med /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i ming zhes bya ba de dag thams cad ni btags pa'i chos yin la / btags pa'i chos de dag la ni ming gi brda tsam gyis tha snyad du gdags pa ma gtogs par skye ba med /
translated: All those so-called perfection of wisdom, bodhisattva, and name of a bodhisattva are imputed phenomena.

original: 'gag pa med de /
analyzed: 'gag pa med de /
translated: Those imputed phenomena are not produced and do not cease, except for the conventional designation by the mere conventional symbol of a name.

original: ming de'ang nang na'ang med /
analyzed: ming de'ang nang na'ang med /
translated: That name also does not exist internally,

original: phyi rol na'ang med /
analyzed: phyi rol na'ang med /
translated: does not exist externally,

original: gnyi ga med par yang mi dmigs so //
analyzed: gnyi ga med par yang mi dmigs so //
translated: and is not apprehended apart from both.

original: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /🔽dper na / 'das pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi mtshan ni ming gi brda tsam gyis tha snyad du gdags pa ma gtogs par skye ba med /

translated: “Subhūti, it is like this:

original: 'gag pa med de /
analyzed: 'gag pa med de /
translated: For example, the names of the past buddha bhagavāns are merely designated by the conventional term ‘name,’ and apart from that, they are not produced and do not cease.

original: mtshan de dag kyang nang na med /
analyzed: mtshan de dag kyang nang na med /
translated: Those names do not exist internally,

original: phyi rol na'ang med /
analyzed: phyi rol na'ang med /
translated: do not exist externally,

original: gnyi ga med par yang mi dmigs so //
analyzed: gnyi ga med par yang mi dmigs so //
translated: and are not apprehended apart from both.

original: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /
translated: “Subhūti, it is like this:

original: dper na / rmi lam dang / brag ca dang / mig yor dang / sgyu ma dang / smig rgyu dang / chu zla @89b dang; de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa zhes bya ba'i chos de dag thams cad ni btags pa tsam du zad la /🔽btags pa de dag la ni ming gi brda tsam gyis tha snyad du gdags pa ma gtogs par skye ba med /
analyzed: dper na / rmi lam dang / brag ca dang / mig yor dang / sgyu ma dang / smig rgyu dang / chu zla @89b dang; de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa zhes bya ba'i chos de dag thams cad ni btags pa tsam du zad la / btags pa de dag la ni ming gi brda tsam gyis tha snyad du gdags pa ma gtogs par skye ba med /
translated: For example, all those dharmas called ‘dream,’ ‘echo,’ ‘optical aberration,’ ‘illusion,’ ‘mirage,’ ‘reflection of the moon in water,’ and ‘tathāgata emanation’ are merely designations,

original: 'gag pa med de /
analyzed: 'gag pa med de /
translated: and apart from those designations, which are merely designated by the conventional term ‘name,’ they are not produced and do not cease.

original: ming de'ang nang na'ang med /
analyzed: ming de'ang nang na'ang med /
translated: That name also does not exist internally,

original: phyi rol na'ang med /
analyzed: phyi rol na'ang med /
translated: does not exist externally,

original: gnyi ga med par yang mi dmigs so //
analyzed: gnyi ga med par yang mi dmigs so //
translated: and is not apprehended apart from both.

original: rab 'byor / de bzhin du 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin du 'di lta ste /
translated: “Subhūti, it is just so.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i ming zhes bya ba'i chos 'di dag thams cad ni btags pa tsam du zad la /🔽btags pa'i chos de la ni ming gi brda tsam gyis tha snyad du gdags pa ma gtogs par skye ba med /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i ming zhes bya ba'i chos 'di dag thams cad ni btags pa tsam du zad la / btags pa'i chos de la ni ming gi brda tsam gyis tha snyad du gdags pa ma gtogs par skye ba med /
translated: All these phenomena—that is to say, the perfection of wisdom, the bodhisattva, and the name of a bodhisattva—are mere designations.

original: 'gag pa med de /
analyzed: 'gag pa med de /
translated: That designated phenomenon has no arising and no ceasing, apart from being a mere designation by way of a nominal convention.

original: ming de'ang nang na'ang med /
analyzed: ming de'ang nang na'ang med /
translated: That name also does not exist internally,

original: phyi rol na'ang med /
analyzed: phyi rol na'ang med /
translated: does not exist externally,

original: gnyi ga med par yang mi dmigs so //
analyzed: gnyi ga med par yang mi dmigs so //
translated: and is not apprehended apart from both.

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar spyod pas ming gi brdar btags pa dang / gdams ngag tu brtags pa dang / chos su btags pa la bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar spyod pas ming gi brdar btags pa dang / gdams ngag tu brtags pa dang / chos su btags pa la bslab par bya'o //
translated: Subhuti : A Bodhisattva, a great being who courses in perfect wisdom, should train in the designation of a dharma, in the designation of a non-dharma, and in the designation of a non-entity.

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar spyod pa ni /🔽gzugs rtag ces bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //🔽gzugs mi rtag ces bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar spyod pa ni / gzugs rtag ces bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo // gzugs mi rtag ces bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: Subhuti : A Bodhisattva, a great being who courses in perfect wisdom, should train in the designation of a dharma, in the designation of a non-dharma, and in the designation of a non-entity.🔽He should not review form as permanent or impermanent, as ease or ill, as self or not self, as calm or not calm, as void or not void, as signless or as signless, as wish or as wishless, as compounded or uncompounded.

original: gzugs bde zhes bya ba dang / sdug bsngal zhes bya ba dang / bdag yod ces bya ba dang / bdag med ces bya ba dang / zhi zhes bya ba dang / ma zhi zhes bya ba dang / @90a *//
analyzed: gzugs bde zhes bya ba dang / sdug bsngal zhes bya ba dang / bdag yod ces bya ba dang / bdag med ces bya ba dang / zhi zhes bya ba dang / ma zhi zhes bya ba dang / @90a *//
translated: He should not review feeling, perception, will, consciousness as permanent or impermanent, as ease or ill, as self or not self, as calm or not calm, as void or not void, as signless or as signless, as wish or as wishless, as compounded or uncompounded.

original: stong zhes bya ba dang / mi stong zhes bya ba dang / mtshan ma yod ces bya ba dang / mtshan ma med ces bya ba dang / smon pa yod ces bya ba dang / smon pa med ces bya ba dang / 'dus byas zhes bya ba dang /
analyzed: stong zhes bya ba dang / mi stong zhes bya ba dang / mtshan ma yod ces bya ba dang / mtshan ma med ces bya ba dang / smon pa yod ces bya ba dang / smon pa med ces bya ba dang / 'dus byas zhes bya ba dang /
translated: “empty” and “nonempty,” “with signs” and “signless,” “having aspirations” and “having no aspirations,” “conditioned” and “unconditioned,”🔽“arising” and “ceasing,” “isolated” and “not isolated,” “virtuous” and “nonvirtuous,” “sordid” and “unsordid,”

original: 'dus ma byas zhes bya ba dang / skye ba zhes bya ba dang / 'gag pa zhes bya ba dang / dben pa zhes bya ba dang / mi dben pa zhes bya ba dang / dge ba dang; mi dge ba dang / kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa dang /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas zhes bya ba dang / skye ba zhes bya ba dang / 'gag pa zhes bya ba dang / dben pa zhes bya ba dang / mi dben pa zhes bya ba dang / dge ba dang; mi dge ba dang / kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa dang /
translated: “defiled” and “undefiled,” “afflictive” and “non-afflictive,” “mundane” and “supramundane,”🔽“worldly” and “otherworldly,”🔽“real” and “unreal,”🔽“attained” and “unattained,”🔽“realized” and “unrealized,”🔽“nirvāṇa” and “not nirvāṇa,”🔽“tathāgata” and “not tathāgata,”🔽“arhat” and “not arhat,”🔽“saṃgha” and “not saṃgha,”🔽“dharma” and “not dharma,”🔽“saṃskṛta” and “asaṃskṛta,”🔽“saṃsāra” and “nirvāṇa,”🔽“mundane” and “supramundane,”🔽“mundane” and “otherworldly,”🔽“real” and “unreal,”🔽“attained” and “unattained,”🔽“realized” and “unrealized,”🔽“nirvāṇa” and “not nirvāṇa,”🔽“tathāgata” and “not tathāgata,”🔽“arhat” and “not arhat,”🔽“saṃgha” and “not saṃgha,”🔽“dharma” and “not dharma,”🔽“saṃskṛta” and “asaṃskṛta,”🔽“saṃsāra” and “nirvāṇa,”🔽“mundane” and “supramundane,”

original: kha na ma tho ba med pa dang / zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa dang / nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa dang / nyon mongs pa med pa dang / 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa dang /
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba med pa dang / zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa dang / nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa dang / nyon mongs pa med pa dang / 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa dang /
translated: “mundane” and “otherworldly,”🔽“real” and “unreal,”🔽“attained” and “unattained,”🔽“realized” and “unrealized,”🔽“nirvāṇa” and “not nirvāṇa,”🔽“tathāgata” and “not tathāgata,”🔽“arhat” and “not arhat,”🔽“saṃgha” and “not saṃgha,”🔽“dharma” and “not dharma,”🔽“saṃskṛta” and “asaṃskṛta,”

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba dang / gzugs 'khor ba zhes bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo; ;gzugs mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba dang / gzugs 'khor ba zhes bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo; ;gzugs mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: He does not see the form as defiled or purified, as cyclic existence or beyond suffering.

original: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa rtag ces bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //🔽mi rtag ces bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa rtag ces bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo // mi rtag ces bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: Similarly, he does not see feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness as permanent or impermanent,

original: de bzhin du bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag yod pa dang / bdag med pa dang / zhi ba dang; ma zhi ba dang / stong pa dang / mi stong pa dang / mtshan ma yod pa dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag yod pa dang / bdag med pa dang / zhi ba dang; ma zhi ba dang / stong pa dang / mi stong pa dang / mtshan ma yod pa dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /
translated: as happiness or suffering, as self or not self, as peaceful or not peaceful, as empty or not empty, as with signs or signless, as having wishes or without wishes, or as calm or not calm.

original: smon pa yod pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas dang / @90b skye ba dang / 'gag pa dang / dben pa dang / mi dben pa dang / dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa dang /🔽kha na ma tho ba med pa dang / zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa dang; nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa dang / nyon mongs pa med pa dang / 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang /
analyzed: smon pa yod pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas dang / @90b skye ba dang / 'gag pa dang / dben pa dang / mi dben pa dang / dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa dang / kha na ma tho ba med pa dang / zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa dang; nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa dang / nyon mongs pa med pa dang / 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang /
translated: He does not see the conditioned or the unconditioned, arising or cessation, seclusion or non-seclusion, virtue or non-virtue, the reproachable or the blameless, the mundane or the supramundane, the contaminated or the uncontaminated, the afflictive or the unafflictive, saṃsāra or nirvāṇa.🔽“He does not see the conditioned or the unconditioned, arising or cessation, seclusion or non-seclusion, virtue or non-virtue, the reproachable or the blameless, the mundane or the supramundane, the contaminated or the uncontaminated, the afflictive or the unafflictive, saṃsāra or nirvāṇa.
