original: rnam par byang ba dang / 'khor ba dang; mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: rnam par byang ba dang / 'khor ba dang; mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: “He does not see the conditioned or the unconditioned, arising or cessation, seclusion or non-seclusion, virtue or non-virtue, the reproachable or the blameless, the mundane or the supramundane, the contaminated or the uncontaminated, the afflictive or the unafflictive, saṃsāra or nirvāṇa.🔽“He does not see the conditioned or the unconditioned, arising or cessation, seclusion or non-seclusion, virtue or non-virtue, the reproachable or the blameless, the mundane or the supramundane, the contaminated or the uncontaminated, the afflictive or the unafflictive, saṃsāra or nirvāṇa.🔽“He does not see the conditioned or the unconditioned, arising or cessation, seclusion or non-seclusion, virtue or non-virtue, the reproachable or the blameless, the mundane or the supramundane, the contaminated or the uncontaminated, the afflictive or the unafflictive, saṃsāra or nirvāṇa.🔽“He does not see the conditioned or the unconditioned, arising or cessation, seclusion or non-seclusion, virtue or non-virtue, the reproachable or the blameless, the mundane or the supramundane, the contaminated or the uncontaminated, the afflictive or the unafflictive, saṃsāra or nirvāṇa.🔽“He does not see the conditioned or the unconditioned, arising or cessation, seclusion or non-seclusion, virtue or non-virtue, the reproachable or the blameless, the mundane or the supramundane, the contaminated or the uncontaminated, the afflictive or the unafflictive, saṃsāra or

original: de bzhin du mig gi khams rtag ces bya ba dang / mi rtag ces bya ba dang / gzugs kyi khams rtag ces bya ba dang; mi rtag ces bya ba dang / mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams rtag ces bya ba dang / mi rtag ces bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du mig gi khams rtag ces bya ba dang / mi rtag ces bya ba dang / gzugs kyi khams rtag ces bya ba dang; mi rtag ces bya ba dang / mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams rtag ces bya ba dang / mi rtag ces bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
translated: In the same way, they do not see the eye constituent as permanent or impermanent, and they do not see the form constituent as permanent or impermanent, and they do not see the eye consciousness constituent as permanent or impermanent.

original: 'khor ba zhes bya ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba'i bar du yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: 'khor ba zhes bya ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba'i bar du yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: They do not see anything up to and including saṃsāra and nirvāṇa.

original: de bzhin du rna ba'i khams dang / sgra'i khams dang / rna ba'i rnam par shes pa'i khams dang / sna'i khams dang / dri'i khams dang / sna'i rnam par shes pa'i khams dang / lce'i khams dang / ro'i khams dang / lce'i rnam par shes pa'i khams dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du rna ba'i khams dang / sgra'i khams dang / rna ba'i rnam par shes pa'i khams dang / sna'i khams dang / dri'i khams dang / sna'i rnam par shes pa'i khams dang / lce'i khams dang / ro'i khams dang / lce'i rnam par shes pa'i khams dang /
translated: In the same way, they do not see the ear constituent, the sound constituent, and the ear consciousness constituent; they do not see the nose constituent, the smell constituent, and the nose consciousness constituent; they do not see the tongue constituent, the taste constituent, and the tongue consciousness constituent;

original: lus kyi khams dang / reg bya'i khams dang / lus kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang / yid kyi khams dang / chos kyi khams dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams rtag ces bya ba dang / mi rtag ces bya bar yang dag par @91a *//
analyzed: lus kyi khams dang / reg bya'i khams dang / lus kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang / yid kyi khams dang / chos kyi khams dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams rtag ces bya ba dang / mi rtag ces bya bar yang dag par @91a *//
translated: the element of the body, the element of tangibles, and the element of body-consciousness; the element of the mind, the element of mental phenomena, and the element of mind-consciousness.

original: rjes su mi mthong ste /
analyzed: rjes su mi mthong ste /
translated: They do not see them as permanent or impermanent.

original: 'khor ba zhes bya ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba'i bar du yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: 'khor ba zhes bya ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba'i bar du yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: They do not see them as cyclic existence or as nirvana.🔽They do not see the eye, forms, or the feeling that arises from the condition of the contact of the eye-consciousness as either permanent or impermanent.🔽They do not see it as blissful or as suffering.🔽They do not see it as self or not self.🔽They do not see it as empty or not empty.

original: mig dang / gzugs dang / mig gi rnam par shes pa 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis byung ba'i tshor ba bde ba'am /
analyzed: mig dang / gzugs dang / mig gi rnam par shes pa 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis byung ba'i tshor ba bde ba'am /
translated: They do not see it as with signs or signless.🔽They do not see it as having aspirations or lacking aspirations.🔽They do not see it as calm or not calm.🔽They do not see it as void or not void.

original: sdug bsngal ba'am /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba'am /
translated: They do not see it as afflicted or purified.🔽They do not see it as produced or destroyed.

original: bde ba'ang ma yin /
analyzed: bde ba'ang ma yin /
translated: They do not see it as increased or decreased.🔽They do not see it as arisen or ceased.🔽They do not see it as compounded or uncompounded.🔽They do not see it as defiled or immaculate.🔽They do not see it as mundane or supramundane.🔽They do not see it as contaminated or uncontaminated.🔽They do not see it as conditioned or unconditioned.

original: sdug bsngal ba'ang ma yin pa gang yin pa de'ang rtag ces bya ba dang / mi rtag ces bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba'ang ma yin pa gang yin pa de'ang rtag ces bya ba dang / mi rtag ces bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
translated: They do not see it as past, future, or present.🔽They do not see it as internal or external.🔽They do not see it as small or large.🔽They do not see it as far or near.🔽They do not see it as form, feeling, perception, formation, or consciousness.🔽They do not see it as the eyes, ears, nose, tongue, body, or mind.🔽They do not see it as form, sound, smell, taste, touch, or mental phenomena.🔽They do not see it as the earth, water, fire, or wind elements.🔽They do not see it as the realm of desire, the realm of form, or the formless realm.🔽They do not see it as the perfection of generosity, the perfection of discipline, the perfection of patience, the perfection of diligence, the perfection of concentration, or the perfection of wisdom.🔽They do not see it as the applications of mindfulness, the right efforts, the legs of miraculous power, the faculties, the powers, the branches of awakening, or the

original: 'khor ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba'i bar du yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: 'khor ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba'i bar du yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: up to and including saṃsāra and nirvāṇa.

original: de bzhin du rna ba dang / sgra dang / rna ba'i rnam par shes pa dang / sna dang / dri dang / sna'i rnam par shes pa dang / lce dang / ro dang / lce'i rnam par shes pa dang / lus dang / reg bya dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du rna ba dang / sgra dang / rna ba'i rnam par shes pa dang / sna dang / dri dang / sna'i rnam par shes pa dang / lce dang / ro dang / lce'i rnam par shes pa dang / lus dang / reg bya dang /
translated: Similarly, he does not see the ear, sounds, and ear-consciousness, the nose, smells, and nose-consciousness, the tongue, tastes, and tongue-consciousness, the body, tactility,

original: lus kyi rnam par shes pa dang / yid dang / chos dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis byung ba'i tshor ba bde ba'am /🔽sdug bsngal ba'am /
analyzed: lus kyi rnam par shes pa dang / yid dang / chos dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis byung ba'i tshor ba bde ba'am / sdug bsngal ba'am /
translated: and body-consciousness, the mind, phenomena, and mind-consciousness as meeting and touching, and he does not see the feeling that arises from the condition of the meeting and touching of the eye, form, and eye-consciousness as either pleasant,

original: bde ba'ang ma yin /
analyzed: bde ba'ang ma yin /
translated: unpleasant,

original: sdug bsngal ba'ang ma yin pa de'ang rtag ces bya ba dang / mi rtag ces bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba'ang ma yin pa de'ang rtag ces bya ba dang / mi rtag ces bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
translated: or neither pleasant nor unpleasant, as either permanent or impermanent,

original: 'khor ba zhes bya ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba'i bar du yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: 'khor ba zhes bya ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba'i bar du yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: up to and including saṃsāra and nirvāṇa.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de @91b dang; byang chub sems dpa' de dang / byang chub sems dpa'i ming de 'dus byas kyi khams sam /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de @91b dang; byang chub sems dpa' de dang / byang chub sems dpa'i ming de 'dus byas kyi khams sam /
translated: If you ask why, it is because bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom do not see that perfection of wisdom, or that bodhisattva, or that name ‘bodhisattva’ as the conditioned element or the unconditioned element.

original: 'dus ma byas kyi khams na yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba'i phyir ro //🔽de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas kyi khams na yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba'i phyir ro // de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: If you ask why, it is because the bodhisattva great being who practices the perfection of wisdom does not see that perfection of wisdom, that bodhisattva, or the name of a bodhisattva in the compounded element or the uncompounded element.

original: rab 'byor; 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa chos de dag thams cad la mi rtog cing rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rab 'byor; 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa chos de dag thams cad la mi rtog cing rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If you ask why, it is because, Subhūti, the bodhisattva great being who practices the perfection of wisdom does not conceptualize or falsely project any of those dharmas.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i chos la gnas te /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i chos la gnas te /
translated: Abiding in the dharma of non-conceptualization,

original: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams sgom zhing /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams sgom zhing /
translated: he cultivates the applications of mindfulness,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa de /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa de /
translated: and practices the perfection of wisdom.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i ming yang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i ming yang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: He does not see the perfection of wisdom, nor does he see the name ‘perfection of wisdom.’

original: byang chub sems dpa' dang / byang chub sems dpa'i ming yang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //🔽de bzhin du yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / lam dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' dang / byang chub sems dpa'i ming yang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo // de bzhin du yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / lam dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
translated: He does not see a bodhisattva, nor does he see the name ‘bodhisattva.’🔽Similarly, he cultivates the applications of mindfulness, the right efforts, the legs of miraculous power, the faculties, the powers, the seven aspects of enlightenment, the noble eightfold path, the perfection of generosity, the perfection of conduct,

original: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang; brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa'i bar du sgom zhing /
analyzed: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang; brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa'i bar du sgom zhing /
translated: the perfection of patience, the perfection of diligence, the perfection of concentration, the perfection of wisdom, the powers, the fearlessnesses, up to the distinct attributes of a buddha,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /🔽rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yid la byed pa ma gtogs par shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes @92a *//
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yid la byed pa ma gtogs par shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes @92a *//
translated: When they practice the perfection of wisdom,🔽except for paying attention to the knowledge of all aspects, they do not see the perfection of wisdom,

original: rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i ming dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / byang chub sems dpa'i ming yang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i ming dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / byang chub sems dpa'i ming yang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: the name of the perfection of wisdom, the bodhisattva, or the name of the bodhisattva.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa des chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid shin tu rtogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa des chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid shin tu rtogs par 'gyur te /
translated: “Those bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom will understand the defining characteristics of dharmas.

original: chos rnams kyi chos kyi mtshan nyid gang yin pa de'ang kun nas nyon mongs par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi chos kyi mtshan nyid gang yin pa de'ang kun nas nyon mongs par mi 'gyur /
translated: The defining characteristic of dharmas is that it is not defiled

original: rnam par byang bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam par byang bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: and it is not purified.

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar spyod pas chos su btags pa'i ming gi brda can yin par khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar spyod pas chos su btags pa'i ming gi brda can yin par khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: “Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom like that should understand that it is a mere designation of a dharma, a mere name, a mere conventional term.

original: des chos su btags pa'i ming gi brda can yin par khong du chud na gzugs la mngon par zhen par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des chos su btags pa'i ming gi brda can yin par khong du chud na gzugs la mngon par zhen par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: When they understand that it is a mere designation of a dharma, a mere name, a mere conventional term, they will not settle down on form.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa la mngon par zhen par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa la mngon par zhen par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: They will not settle down on feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness.

original: mig la mngon par zhen par mi 'gyur ro //🔽gzugs dang / mig gi rnam par shes pa dang; mig gi 'dus te reg pa la mngon par zhen par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mig la mngon par zhen par mi 'gyur ro // gzugs dang / mig gi rnam par shes pa dang; mig gi 'dus te reg pa la mngon par zhen par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: They will not settle down on the eyes.🔽They will not settle down on a form, an eye consciousness, or an eye contact.

original: mig gi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis byung ba'i tshor ba bde ba'am /
analyzed: mig gi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis byung ba'i tshor ba bde ba'am /
translated: They will not settle down on the feeling that arises from the condition of eye contact, whether pleasant,

original: sdug bsngal ba'am /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba'am /
translated: unpleasant, or neutral.

original: sdug bsngal ba'ang ma yin; bde ba'ang ma yin pa de la'ang mngon par zhen par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba'ang ma yin; bde ba'ang ma yin pa de la'ang mngon par zhen par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: They should not settle down on the feeling that arises from the condition of eye contact as being pleasant or painful or neither painful nor pleasant.

original: de bzhin du rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid dang / chos dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang / @92b yid kyi 'dus te reg pa la mngon par zhen par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid dang / chos dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang / @92b yid kyi 'dus te reg pa la mngon par zhen par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Similarly, they should not settle down on the ear, nose, tongue, body, or thinking mind, on a dharma, or on the thinking-mind consciousness, or on thinking-mind contact.

original: yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis byung ba'i tshor ba bde ba'am /
analyzed: yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis byung ba'i tshor ba bde ba'am /
translated: They should not settle down on the feeling that arises from the condition of thinking-mind contact as being pleasant or painful or neither painful nor pleasant.🔽They should not settle down on the form skandha,🔽the feeling skandha,🔽the perception skandha,

original: sdug bsngal ba'am /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba'am /
translated: the formation skandha, or the consciousness skandha.

original: sdug bsngal ba'ang ma yin /🔽bde ba'ang ma yin pa gang yin pa de la'ang mngon par zhen par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba'ang ma yin / bde ba'ang ma yin pa gang yin pa de la'ang mngon par zhen par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: They should not settle down on the eye constituent,🔽the form constituent, or the eye consciousness constituent.🔽They should not settle down on the ear constituent, the sound constituent, or the ear consciousness constituent.🔽They should not settle down on the nose constituent, the smell constituent, or the nose consciousness constituent.🔽They should not settle down on the tongue constituent, the taste constituent, or the tongue consciousness constituent.🔽They should not settle down on the body constituent, the feeling of touch constituent, or the body consciousness constituent.

original: 'dus byas kyi khams dang / 'dus ma byas kyi khams la'ang mngon par zhen par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi khams dang / 'dus ma byas kyi khams la'ang mngon par zhen par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: They should not settle down on the thinking-mind constituent, the dharma constituent, or the thinking-mind consciousness constituent.

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la'ang mngon par zhen par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la'ang mngon par zhen par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: They should not settle down on the perfection of giving.

original: tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la'ang mngon par zhen par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la'ang mngon par zhen par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: They will not settle down on the perfection of morality, patience, perseverance, concentration, or wisdom.

original: de dag gi ming dang / mtshan nyid la'ang mngon par zhen par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag gi ming dang / mtshan nyid la'ang mngon par zhen par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: They will not settle down on their names or their characteristics.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i lus la'ang mngon par zhen par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i lus la'ang mngon par zhen par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: They will not settle down on the body of a bodhisattva.

original: sha'i mig dang / lha'i mig dang / shes rab kyi mig dang / chos kyi mig dang / sangs rgyas kyi mig la'ang mngon par zhen par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sha'i mig dang / lha'i mig dang / shes rab kyi mig dang / chos kyi mig dang / sangs rgyas kyi mig la'ang mngon par zhen par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: They will not settle down on the fleshly eye, the divine eye, the eye of wisdom, the eye of Dharma, or the eye of a buddha.

original: de bzhin du mngon par shes pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / nang stong pa nyid dang / phyi stong pa nyid dang / phyi nang stong pa nyid la'ang mngon par zhen par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du mngon par shes pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / nang stong pa nyid dang / phyi stong pa nyid dang / phyi nang stong pa nyid la'ang mngon par zhen par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Similarly, they will not settle down on the perfection of the superknowledges, on inner emptiness, on outer emptiness, or on inner and outer emptiness.

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar la'ang mngon par zhen par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar la'ang mngon par zhen par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: They will not settle down on . . . up to the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature.

original: de bzhin nyid la'ang mngon par zhen par mi 'gyur ro //🔽yang dag pa'i mtha' la'ang mngon par zhen par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid la'ang mngon par zhen par mi 'gyur ro // yang dag pa'i mtha' la'ang mngon par zhen par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: they do not settle down on the reality limit,🔽they do not settle down on the dharma-constituent,🔽they do not settle down on the perfection of wisdom,🔽they do not settle down on the perfection of concentration,

original: chos kyi dbyings la'ang mngon par zhen par mi 'gyur ro //🔽sems can yongs su smin par bya ba @93a *//
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings la'ang mngon par zhen par mi 'gyur ro // sems can yongs su smin par bya ba @93a *//
translated: they do not settle down on the perfection of perseverance,🔽they do not settle down on the perfection of patience,🔽they do not settle down on the perfection of morality,🔽they do not settle down on the perfection of giving,🔽they do not settle down on the applications of mindfulness,🔽they do not settle down on the right efforts,🔽they do not settle down on the legs of miraculous power,🔽they do not settle down on the faculties,🔽they do not settle down on the powers,🔽they do not settle down on the limbs of awakening,🔽they do not settle down on the path,🔽they do not settle down on the ten powers of a tathāgata,🔽they do not settle down on the four fearlessnesses,🔽they do not settle down on the four detailed and thorough knowledges,🔽they do not settle down on the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha,🔽they do not settle down on the knowledge of all aspects,

original: dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bya ba dang / thabs la mkhas pa la'ang mngon par zhen par mi 'gyur ro //🔽de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bya ba dang / thabs la mkhas pa la'ang mngon par zhen par mi 'gyur ro // de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: they do not settle down on the knowledge of paths,🔽they do not settle down on the knowledge of all bases,🔽they do not settle down on the perfection of giving,🔽they do not settle down on the perfection of morality,🔽they do not settle down on the perfection of patience,

original: 'di ltar gang mngon par zhen par 'gyur ba dang / gang gis mngon par zhen par 'gyur ba dang / gang la mngon par zhen par 'gyur ba'i chos de dag thams cad med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar gang mngon par zhen par 'gyur ba dang / gang gis mngon par zhen par 'gyur ba dang / gang la mngon par zhen par 'gyur ba'i chos de dag thams cad med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: they do not settle down on the perfection of perseverance,🔽they do not settle down on the perfection of concentration,🔽they do not settle down on the perfection of wisdom,🔽they do not settle down on the perfection of skill in means,🔽they do not settle down on the perfection of aspiration,🔽they do not settle down on the perfection of power,🔽they do not settle down on the perfection of knowledge,🔽they do not settle down on the emptiness of emptiness,🔽they do not settle down on the emptiness of great extent,

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar spyod pa ni chos thams cad la mngon par zhen pa med pas /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar spyod pa ni chos thams cad la mngon par zhen pa med pas /
translated: they do not settle down on the emptiness of ultimate reality,🔽they do not settle down on the emptiness of the compounded,🔽they do not settle down on the emptiness of the uncompounded,🔽they do not settle down on the emptiness of what is beyond extremes,🔽they do not settle down on the emptiness of no beginning or end,🔽they do not settle down on the emptiness of nature,

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pas rnam par 'phel lo //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pas rnam par 'phel lo //
translated: He grows through the perfection of generosity.

original: tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas rnam par 'phel te /
analyzed: tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas rnam par 'phel te /
translated: He grows through the perfections of morality, patience, effort, meditation, and wisdom.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa la 'jug cing /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa la 'jug cing /
translated: He enters into the certainty of the bodhisattva.

original: phyir mi ldog pa'i sa gnon te /
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa'i sa gnon te /
translated: He reaches the irreversible stage.

original: mngon par shes pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: He perfects the superknowledges.

original: de mngon par shes pa yongs su rdzogs par byas nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bya ba dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la blta ba'i phyir sems can rnams ni yongs su smin par byed /
analyzed: de mngon par shes pa yongs su rdzogs par byas nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bya ba dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la blta ba'i phyir sems can rnams ni yongs su smin par byed /
translated: Having perfected the superknowledges, he ripens beings in order to purify a buddha-field and to see the lord buddhas.🔽He honors the lord buddhas,

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la ni bsti stang du byed /🔽bla mar byed /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la ni bsti stang du byed / bla mar byed /
translated: he reveres them,

original: ri mor byed /
analyzed: ri mor byed /
translated: he worships them,

original: mchod pa byed cing sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing du 'gro bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: mchod pa byed cing sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing du 'gro bar 'gyur te /
translated: he makes offerings to them, and he goes from buddha-field to buddha-field.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das @93b de dag mthong nas kyang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das @93b de dag mthong nas kyang /
translated: Having seen those blessed buddhas,

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba gang dag gis sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag la bsti stang du bya ba dang / bla mar bya ba dang / ri mor bya ba dang / mchod pa bya bar 'dod pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag kyang de la 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba gang dag gis sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag la bsti stang du bya ba dang / bla mar bya ba dang / ri mor bya ba dang / mchod pa bya bar 'dod pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag kyang de la 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: they will also give rise to the roots of virtue that they wish to honor, venerate, respect, and make offerings to those blessed buddhas.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba de nyid kyis sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gi thad du skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba de nyid kyis sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gi thad du skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Through those very roots of virtue, they will be reborn in the presence of those blessed buddhas.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag las chos kyang thos par 'gyur ro //🔽des chos thos pa de dag kyang byang chub kyi snying po la thug gi bar du /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag las chos kyang thos par 'gyur ro // des chos thos pa de dag kyang byang chub kyi snying po la thug gi bar du /
translated: They will hear the Dharma from those blessed buddhas.🔽They will never be separated from those teachings they have heard,

original: nam yang rgyun chad par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nam yang rgyun chad par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: until they reach the seat of awakening.

original: gzungs kyi sgo rnams kyang 'thob par 'gyur ro; ;ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo rnams kyang 'thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzungs kyi sgo rnams kyang 'thob par 'gyur ro; ;ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo rnams kyang 'thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will attain the dhāraṇī gateways and the gateways of meditative absorption.

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar spyod pas chos su btags pa ming gi brda can yin par khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar spyod pas chos su btags pa ming gi brda can yin par khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: “Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom like that should understand that the designation of dharmas is a name with a conventional symbol.

original: rab 'byor / 'di ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ji snyam du sems /
translated: “Subhūti, what do you think?

original: gang byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba gzugs byang chub sems dpa' yin snyam mam; gzugs las gzhan zhig byang chub sems dpa' yin snyam mam /
analyzed: gang byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba gzugs byang chub sems dpa' yin snyam mam; gzugs las gzhan zhig byang chub sems dpa' yin snyam mam /
translated: Is the bodhisattva the form, or is the bodhisattva other than the form?

original: gzugs la byang chub sems dpa' yod snyam mam /
analyzed: gzugs la byang chub sems dpa' yod snyam mam /
translated: Is the bodhisattva in the form,

original: byang chub sems dpa' la gzugs yod snyam mam; gzugs can ma yin pa zhig byang chub sems dpa' yin snyam mam /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' la gzugs yod snyam mam; gzugs can ma yin pa zhig byang chub sems dpa' yin snyam mam /
translated: or is the form in the bodhisattva, or is the bodhisattva in the formless?

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das de ni ma lags so //
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das de ni ma lags so //
translated: ” He replied, “Lord, it is not.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: ” The Lord said,

original: @94a *// rab 'byor /
analyzed: @94a *// rab 'byor /
translated: “Subhūti,

original: 'di ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: 'di ji snyam du sems /
translated: what do you think?

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa byang chub sems dpa' yin snyam mam /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa byang chub sems dpa' yin snyam mam /
translated: Is feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness a bodhisattva?

original: rnam par shes pa las gzhan zhig byang chub sems dpa' yin snyam mam /🔽rnam par shes pa la byang chub sems dpa' yod snyam mam /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa las gzhan zhig byang chub sems dpa' yin snyam mam / rnam par shes pa la byang chub sems dpa' yod snyam mam /
translated: Is a bodhisattva other than consciousness?🔽Is a bodhisattva in consciousness?

original: byang chub sems dpa' la rnam par shes pa yod snyam mam /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' la rnam par shes pa yod snyam mam /
translated: Is consciousness in a bodhisattva?

original: rnam par shes pa med pa zhig byang chub sems dpa' yin snyam mam /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa med pa zhig byang chub sems dpa' yin snyam mam /
translated: Is a bodhisattva without consciousness?

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das de ni ma lags so //
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das de ni ma lags so //
translated: Śāriputra replied, “No, Lord.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

original: rab 'byor / 'di ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ji snyam du sems /
translated: “What do you think, Subhūti,

original: mig byang chub sems dpa' yin snyam mam /
analyzed: mig byang chub sems dpa' yin snyam mam /
translated: is the eye a bodhisattva?

original: mig las gzhan zhig byang chub sems dpa' yin snyam mam /🔽mig la byang chub sems dpa' yod snyam mam /
analyzed: mig las gzhan zhig byang chub sems dpa' yin snyam mam / mig la byang chub sems dpa' yod snyam mam /
translated: Is a bodhisattva other than the eye?🔽Is a bodhisattva in the eye?

original: byang chub sems dpa' la mig yod snyam mam /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' la mig yod snyam mam /
translated: Is the eye in a bodhisattva?

original: mig med pa zhig byang chub sems dpa' yin snyam mam /
analyzed: mig med pa zhig byang chub sems dpa' yin snyam mam /
translated: Is a bodhisattva without the eye?

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das de ni ma lags so //
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das de ni ma lags so //
translated: He replied, “No, Blessed One.🔽”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / 'di ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ji snyam du sems /
translated: “What do you think, Subhūti?

original: rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid byang chub sems dpa' yin snyam mam /
analyzed: rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid byang chub sems dpa' yin snyam mam /
translated: Is the ear, nose, tongue, body, or mind a bodhisattva?

original: yid las gzhan zhig byang chub sems dpa' yin snyam mam /🔽yid la byang chub sems dpa' yod snyam mam /
analyzed: yid las gzhan zhig byang chub sems dpa' yin snyam mam / yid la byang chub sems dpa' yod snyam mam /
translated: Is a bodhisattva other than the mind?🔽Is a bodhisattva in the mind?

original: byang chub sems dpa' la yid yod @94b snyam mam /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' la yid yod @94b snyam mam /
translated: Is a bodhisattva in a bodhisattva?

original: yid med pa zhig byang chub sems dpa' yin snyam mam /
analyzed: yid med pa zhig byang chub sems dpa' yin snyam mam /
translated: Is a bodhisattva without a mind?🔽”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das de ni ma lags so //
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das de ni ma lags so //
translated: He replied, “No, Blessed One.🔽”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / 'di ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ji snyam du sems /
translated: “What do you think, Subhūti?

original: gzugs byang chub sems dpa' yin snyam mam /
analyzed: gzugs byang chub sems dpa' yin snyam mam /
translated: Is form a bodhisattva?

original: gzugs las gzhan zhig byang chub sems dpa' yin snyam mam /🔽gzugs la byang chub sems dpa' yod snyam mam /
analyzed: gzugs las gzhan zhig byang chub sems dpa' yin snyam mam / gzugs la byang chub sems dpa' yod snyam mam /
translated: Is a bodhisattva other than form?🔽Is a bodhisattva in form?

original: byang chub sems dpa' la gzugs yod snyam mam /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' la gzugs yod snyam mam /
translated: Is form in a bodhisattva?

original: gzugs med pa zhig byang chub sems dpa' yin snyam mam /
analyzed: gzugs med pa zhig byang chub sems dpa' yin snyam mam /
translated: Or do you think that something formless is a bodhisattva?

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das de ni ma lags so //
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das de ni ma lags so //
translated: He replied, “No, Blessed One.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / 'di ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ji snyam du sems /
translated: “What do you think, Subhūti?

original: sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya dang / chos rnams byang chub sems dpa' yin snyam mam /
analyzed: sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya dang / chos rnams byang chub sems dpa' yin snyam mam /
translated: Do you think that sounds, smells, tastes, textures, and mental phenomena are a bodhisattva?

original: chos rnams las gzhan zhig byang chub sems dpa' yin snyam mam /🔽chos rnams la byang chub sems dpa' yod snyam mam /
analyzed: chos rnams las gzhan zhig byang chub sems dpa' yin snyam mam / chos rnams la byang chub sems dpa' yod snyam mam /
translated: Or do you think that something other than mental phenomena is a bodhisattva?🔽Or do you think that a bodhisattva exists in mental phenomena?

original: byang chub sems dpa' la chos rnams yod snyam mam /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' la chos rnams yod snyam mam /
translated: Or do you think that mental phenomena exist in a bodhisattva?

original: chos rnams med pa zhig byang chub sems dpa' yin snyam mam /
analyzed: chos rnams med pa zhig byang chub sems dpa' yin snyam mam /
translated: Or do you think that something that is not mental phenomena is a bodhisattva?”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das de ni ma lags so //
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das de ni ma lags so //
translated: He replied, “No, Blessed One.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / 'di ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ji snyam du sems /
translated: “What do you think, Subhūti?

original: mig dang / gzugs dang / mig gi rnam par shes pa rnams byang chub sems dpa' yin snyam mam /
analyzed: mig dang / gzugs dang / mig gi rnam par shes pa rnams byang chub sems dpa' yin snyam mam /
translated: Do you think that the eyes, visual forms, and visual consciousness are a bodhisattva?

original: de dag las gzhan zhig yin snyam mam /🔽de dag la de yod snyam mam /
analyzed: de dag las gzhan zhig yin snyam mam / de dag la de yod snyam mam /
translated: Or do you think it is something other than those?🔽Or do you think it is in those?

original: de la de dag yod snyam mam /
analyzed: de la de dag yod snyam mam /
translated: Or do you think those are in it?

original: mig dang / gzugs @95a *//
analyzed: mig dang / gzugs @95a *//
translated: Are the eye, form,

original: dang; mig gi rnam par shes pa rnams med pa zhig byang chub sems dpa' yin snyam mam /
analyzed: dang; mig gi rnam par shes pa rnams med pa zhig byang chub sems dpa' yin snyam mam /
translated: and eye consciousness the bodhisattva?

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das de ni ma lags so //
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das de ni ma lags so //
translated: He replied, “No, Blessed One.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / 'di ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ji snyam du sems /
translated: “Subhūti, what do you think?

original: rna ba dang / sgra dang / rna ba'i rnam par shes pa dang / sna dang / dri dang / sna'i rnam par shes pa dang / lce dang / ro dang / lce'i rnam par shes pa dang / lus dang / reg bya dang / lus kyi rnam par shes pa dang /
analyzed: rna ba dang / sgra dang / rna ba'i rnam par shes pa dang / sna dang / dri dang / sna'i rnam par shes pa dang / lce dang / ro dang / lce'i rnam par shes pa dang / lus dang / reg bya dang / lus kyi rnam par shes pa dang /
translated: Are the ear, sound, and ear consciousness, the nose, smell, and nose consciousness, the tongue, taste, and tongue consciousness, the body, tactile objects, and body consciousness,

original: yid dang / chos dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa rnams byang chub sems dpa' yin snyam mam /
analyzed: yid dang / chos dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa rnams byang chub sems dpa' yin snyam mam /
translated: and the mind, mental phenomena, and mind consciousness the bodhisattva?

original: de dag las gzhan zhig yin snyam mam /
analyzed: de dag las gzhan zhig yin snyam mam /
translated: Or do you think it is something other than those?

original: de dag la de yod snyam mam /
analyzed: de dag la de yod snyam mam /
translated: Or do you think it is in those?🔽Or do you think those are in it?

original: de la de dag yod snyam mam /
analyzed: de la de dag yod snyam mam /
translated: Do you think that they exist?

original: yid dang / chos dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa rnams med pa zhig byang chub sems dpa' yin snyam mam /
analyzed: yid dang / chos dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa rnams med pa zhig byang chub sems dpa' yin snyam mam /
translated: Do you think that the mind, dharmas, and mind consciousness are not nonexistent?

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das de ni ma lags so //
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das de ni ma lags so //
translated: He replied, “Blessed One, they are not.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / 'di ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ji snyam du sems /
translated: “What do you think, Subhūti?

original: sa'i khams byang chub sems dpa' yin snyam mam /
analyzed: sa'i khams byang chub sems dpa' yin snyam mam /
translated: Do you think that the earth element is a bodhisattva?

original: sa'i khams las gzhan zhig byang chub sems dpa' yin snyam mam /
analyzed: sa'i khams las gzhan zhig byang chub sems dpa' yin snyam mam /
translated: Do you think that something other than the earth element is a bodhisattva?

original: sa'i khams la byang chub sems dpa' yod snyam mam; byang chub sems dpa' la sa'i khams yod snyam mam /
analyzed: sa'i khams la byang chub sems dpa' yod snyam mam; byang chub sems dpa' la sa'i khams yod snyam mam /
translated: Do you think that the earth element exists in a bodhisattva, or that a bodhisattva exists in the earth element, or that the earth element is a bodhisattva, or that a bodhisattva is the earth element?

original: sa'i khams med pa zhig byang chub sems dpa' yin snyam mam /
analyzed: sa'i khams med pa zhig byang chub sems dpa' yin snyam mam /
translated: Do you think that something that is not the earth element is a bodhisattva?

original: rab 'byor / 'di ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ji snyam du sems /
translated: What do you think, Subhūti?

original: chu'i khams @95b dang; me'i khams dang / rlung gi khams dang / nam mkha'i khams dang / rnam par shes pa'i khams byang chub sems dpa' yin snyam mam /
analyzed: chu'i khams @95b dang; me'i khams dang / rlung gi khams dang / nam mkha'i khams dang / rnam par shes pa'i khams byang chub sems dpa' yin snyam mam /
translated: Do you think that the water element, the fire element, the wind element, the space element, and the consciousness element are a bodhisattva?

original: rnam par shes pa'i khams las gzhan zhig byang chub sems dpa' yin snyam mam /🔽rnam par shes pa'i khams la byang chub sems dpa' yod snyam mam /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i khams las gzhan zhig byang chub sems dpa' yin snyam mam / rnam par shes pa'i khams la byang chub sems dpa' yod snyam mam /
translated: Or do you think that something other than the consciousness element is a bodhisattva?🔽Or do you think that the consciousness element is a bodhisattva?🔽Or do you think that a bodhisattva is in the consciousness element?

original: byang chub sems dpa' la rnam par shes pa'i khams yod snyam mam; rnam par shes pa'i khams med pa zhig byang chub sems dpa' yin snyam mam /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' la rnam par shes pa'i khams yod snyam mam; rnam par shes pa'i khams med pa zhig byang chub sems dpa' yin snyam mam /
translated: Or do you think that a bodhisattva is not in the consciousness element?

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das de ni ma lags so //
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das de ni ma lags so //
translated: Śāriputra replied, “Blessed One, it is not like that.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / 'di ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ji snyam du sems /
translated: “What do you think, Subhūti?

original: ma rig pa byang chub sems dpa' yin snyam mam /
analyzed: ma rig pa byang chub sems dpa' yin snyam mam /
translated: Do you think that ignorance is a bodhisattva?

original: ma rig pa las gzhan zhig byang chub sems dpa' yin snyam mam /🔽ma rig pa la byang chub sems dpa' yod snyam mam /
analyzed: ma rig pa las gzhan zhig byang chub sems dpa' yin snyam mam / ma rig pa la byang chub sems dpa' yod snyam mam /
translated: Or do you think that something other than ignorance is a bodhisattva?🔽Or do you think that a bodhisattva is in ignorance?

original: byang chub sems dpa' la ma rig pa yod snyam mam /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' la ma rig pa yod snyam mam /
translated: Or do you think that ignorance is in a bodhisattva?

original: ma rig pa med pa zhig byang chub sems dpa' yin snyam mam /
analyzed: ma rig pa med pa zhig byang chub sems dpa' yin snyam mam /
translated: Or do you think that a bodhisattva is not in ignorance?

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das de ni ma lags so; ;bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das de ni ma lags so; ;bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / 'di ji snyam du sems /🔽'du byad  dang / rnam par shes pa dang / ming dang gzugs dang / skye mched drug dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba dang / sred pa dang / len pa dang / srid pa dang / skye ba dang / rga shi byang chub sems dpa' yin snyam mam /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ji snyam du sems / 'du byad  dang / rnam par shes pa dang / ming dang gzugs dang / skye mched drug dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba dang / sred pa dang / len pa dang / srid pa dang / skye ba dang / rga shi byang chub sems dpa' yin snyam mam /
translated: “What do you think, Subhūti?🔽Are form, feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness the bodhisattva?🔽Is the bodhisattva other than form, feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness?

original: rga shi las gzhan zhig byang chub sems dpa' yin snyam mam /🔽rga shi la @96a *//🔽byang chub sems dpa' yod snyam mam /
analyzed: rga shi las gzhan zhig byang chub sems dpa' yin snyam mam / rga shi la @96a *// byang chub sems dpa' yod snyam mam /
translated: Is form, feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness in the bodhisattva?

original: byang chub sems dpa' la rga shi yod snyam mam /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' la rga shi yod snyam mam /
translated: Is the bodhisattva in form, feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness?

original: rga shi med pa zhig byang chub sems dpa' yin snyam mam /
analyzed: rga shi med pa zhig byang chub sems dpa' yin snyam mam /
translated: Is the bodhisattva without form, feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness?”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das de ni ma lags so //
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das de ni ma lags so //
translated: He replied, “No, Blessed One.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / 'di ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ji snyam du sems /
translated: “What do you think, Subhūti?

original: gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de byang chub sems dpa' yin snyam mam /
analyzed: gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de byang chub sems dpa' yin snyam mam /
translated: Do you think that the suchness of form is the bodhisattva,

original: gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid las gzhan zhig byang chub sems dpa' yin snyam mam /🔽gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid la byang chub sems dpa' yod snyam mam /
analyzed: gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid las gzhan zhig byang chub sems dpa' yin snyam mam / gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid la byang chub sems dpa' yod snyam mam /
translated: or that the bodhisattva is other than the suchness of form,🔽or that the bodhisattva is in the suchness of form,

original: byang chub sems dpa' la gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid yod snyam mam /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' la gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid yod snyam mam /
translated: or that the suchness of form is in the bodhisattva,

original: gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid med pa zhig byang chub sems dpa' yin snyam mam /
analyzed: gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid med pa zhig byang chub sems dpa' yin snyam mam /
translated: or that the bodhisattva is in the absence of the suchness of form?”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das de ni ma lags so; ;bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das de ni ma lags so; ;bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: “No, Blessed One,” he replied.

original: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'i de bzhin nyid byang chub sems dpa' yin snyam mam /
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'i de bzhin nyid byang chub sems dpa' yin snyam mam /
translated: The Blessed One said, “Similarly, do you think that the suchness of feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness is the bodhisattva,🔽or that the bodhisattva is other than the suchness of consciousness,🔽or that the bodhisattva is in the suchness of consciousness,🔽or that the suchness of consciousness is in the bodhisattva,

original: rnam par shes pa'i de bzhin nyid las gzhan zhig byang chub sems dpa' yin snyam mam /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i de bzhin nyid las gzhan zhig byang chub sems dpa' yin snyam mam /
translated: or that the bodhisattva is in the absence of the suchness of consciousness?”🔽“No, Blessed One,” he replied.

original: rnam par shes pa'i de bzhin nyid la byang chub sems dpa' yod snyam mam /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i de bzhin nyid la byang chub sems dpa' yod snyam mam /
translated: Is the suchness of consciousness the bodhisattva?🔽Is the suchness of consciousness other than the bodhisattva?🔽Is there a bodhisattva in the suchness of consciousness?🔽Is the suchness of consciousness in the bodhisattva?

original: byang chub sems dpa' la rnam par shes pa'i de bzhin nyid yod snyam mam /🔽rnam par shes pa'i de bzhin nyid med pa zhig byang chub sems dpa' yin snyam mam /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' la rnam par shes pa'i de bzhin nyid yod snyam mam / rnam par shes pa'i de bzhin nyid med pa zhig byang chub sems dpa' yin snyam mam /
translated: Is the bodhisattva in the suchness of form?🔽Is the suchness of form other than the bodhisattva?🔽Is there a bodhisattva in the suchness of form?🔽Is the suchness of form in the bodhisattva?🔽Is the bodhisattva in the suchness of feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness?🔽Is the suchness of consciousness other than the bodhisattva?🔽Is there a bodhisattva in the suchness of consciousness?

original: gsol pa / bcom @96b ldan 'das de ni ma lags so //
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom @96b ldan 'das de ni ma lags so //
translated: Is the suchness of consciousness in the bodhisattva?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord:

original: de bzhin du khams dang / skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rga shi'i bar gyi de bzhin nyid byang chub sems dpa' yin snyam mam /🔽rga shi'i de bzhin nyid las gzhan zhig byang chub sems dpa' yin snyam mam /🔽rga shi'i de bzhin nyid la byang chub sems dpa' yod snyam mam /🔽byang chub sems dpa' la rga shi'i de bzhin nyid yod snyam mam /
analyzed: de bzhin du khams dang / skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rga shi'i bar gyi de bzhin nyid byang chub sems dpa' yin snyam mam /🔽rga shi'i de bzhin nyid las gzhan zhig byang chub sems dpa' yin snyam mam /🔽rga shi'i de bzhin nyid la byang chub sems dpa' yod snyam mam /🔽byang chub sems dpa' la rga shi'i de bzhin nyid yod snyam mam /
translated: Do you think that the suchness of the constituents, the sense fields, and dependent origination up to aging and death is the bodhisattva?

original: rga shi'i de bzhin nyid med pa zhig byang chub sems dpa' yin snyam mam /
analyzed: rga shi'i de bzhin nyid med pa zhig byang chub sems dpa' yin snyam mam /
translated: Is the suchness of aging and death a bodhisattva?

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
translated: Subhūti replied,🔽“Blessed One, it is not.”

original: bcom ldan 'das de ni ma lags so; ;bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de ni ma lags so; ;bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor khyod don gyi dbang gang nye bar bzung nas gzugs byang chub sems dpa' ma yin /
analyzed: rab 'byor khyod don gyi dbang gang nye bar bzung nas gzugs byang chub sems dpa' ma yin /
translated: “Subhūti, what is the meaning that you are grasping at when you say that form is not a bodhisattva,

original: phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rga shi'i bar gyi de bzhin nyid byang chub sems dpa' ma yin zhes zer /
analyzed: phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rga shi'i bar gyi de bzhin nyid byang chub sems dpa' ma yin zhes zer /
translated: and that the suchness of the aggregates, elements, sense sources, and dependent origination up to aging and death is not a bodhisattva?”

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
translated: Subhūti replied,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: sems can gtan ma mchis shing mi dmigs na /🔽gzugs de byang chub sems dpar 'gyur ba lta ga la mchis /🔽gzugs las gzhan zhig byang chub sems dpar 'gyur ba lta ga la mchis //
analyzed: sems can gtan ma mchis shing mi dmigs na / gzugs de byang chub sems dpar 'gyur ba lta ga la mchis / gzugs las gzhan zhig byang chub sems dpar 'gyur ba lta ga la mchis //
translated: if sentient beings are utterly nonexistent and not apprehended,🔽how could form be a bodhisattva?🔽How could anything other than form be a bodhisattva?

original: gzugs la byang chub sems dpa' mchis par 'gyur ba lta ga la mchis /
analyzed: gzugs la byang chub sems dpa' mchis par 'gyur ba lta ga la mchis /
translated: How could a bodhisattva exist in form?

original: byang chub sems dpa' la gzugs mchis par 'gyur pa lta ga la mchis /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' la gzugs mchis par 'gyur pa lta ga la mchis /
translated: How could a bodhisattva be form?

original: gzugs ma mchis pa zhig byang chub sems @97a *//🔽dpar 'gyur ba lta ga la mchis /
analyzed: gzugs ma mchis pa zhig byang chub sems @97a *// dpar 'gyur ba lta ga la mchis /
translated: How could a bodhisattva be formless?

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa byang chub sems dpar 'gyur ba lta ga la mchis /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa byang chub sems dpar 'gyur ba lta ga la mchis /
translated: How could feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness be a bodhisattva?

original: rnam par shes pa las gzhan zhig byang chub sems dpar 'gyur ba lta ga la mchis /🔽rnam par shes pa la byang chub sems dpa' mchis par 'gyur ba lta ga la mchis /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa las gzhan zhig byang chub sems dpar 'gyur ba lta ga la mchis / rnam par shes pa la byang chub sems dpa' mchis par 'gyur ba lta ga la mchis /
translated: How could something other than consciousness be a bodhisattva?🔽How could a bodhisattva be in consciousness?

original: byang chub sems dpa' la rnam par shes pa mchis par 'gyur ba lta ga la mchis /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' la rnam par shes pa mchis par 'gyur ba lta ga la mchis /
translated: How could consciousness be in a bodhisattva?

original: rnam par shes pa ma mchis pa zhig byang chub sems dpar 'gyur ba lta ga la mchis /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ma mchis pa zhig byang chub sems dpar 'gyur ba lta ga la mchis /
translated: How could a bodhisattva be without consciousness?

original: khams dang / skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba rnams la'ang de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: khams dang / skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba rnams la'ang de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: The same goes for the constituents, the sense fields, and dependent origination.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: sems can gtan ma mchis shing mi dmigs na /
analyzed: sems can gtan ma mchis shing mi dmigs na /
translated: If sentient beings do not exist and are not apprehended,

original: rga shi byang chub sems dpar 'gyur ba lta ga la mchis /
analyzed: rga shi byang chub sems dpar 'gyur ba lta ga la mchis /
translated: how could aging and death be a bodhisattva?

original: rga shi las gzhan zhig byang chub sems dpar 'gyur ba lta ga la mchis /🔽rga shi la byang chub sems dpa' mchis par 'gyur ba lta ga la mchis /
analyzed: rga shi las gzhan zhig byang chub sems dpar 'gyur ba lta ga la mchis / rga shi la byang chub sems dpa' mchis par 'gyur ba lta ga la mchis /
translated: How could something other than aging and death be a bodhisattva?🔽How could a bodhisattva exist in aging and death?

original: byang chub sems dpa' la rga shi mchis par 'gyur ba lta ga la mchis /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' la rga shi mchis par 'gyur ba lta ga la mchis /
translated: How could aging and death exist in a bodhisattva?

original: rga shi ma mchis pa zhig byang chub sems dpar 'gyur ba lta ga la mchis /
analyzed: rga shi ma mchis pa zhig byang chub sems dpar 'gyur ba lta ga la mchis /
translated: How could something that is not aging and death be a bodhisattva?

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: sems can gtan ma mchis shing mi dmigs na /
analyzed: sems can gtan ma mchis shing mi dmigs na /
translated: if sentient beings do not exist and are not apprehended,

original: 'di la gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid dmigs par 'gyur ba lta ga la mchis /
analyzed: 'di la gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid dmigs par 'gyur ba lta ga la mchis /
translated: how could the suchness of form be apprehended in this regard?

original: phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rnams @97b la'ang de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rnams @97b la'ang de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: The same goes for the aggregates, constituents, sense fields, and dependent origination.

original: bcom ldan 'das sems can gtan ma mchis shing mi dmigs na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das sems can gtan ma mchis shing mi dmigs na /
translated: Blessed One, if sentient beings do not exist and are not apprehended,

original: de la rga shi'i de bzhin nyid dmigs par 'gyur ba lta ga la mchis te /
analyzed: de la rga shi'i de bzhin nyid dmigs par 'gyur ba lta ga la mchis te /
translated: How could the suchness of old age and death be apprehended?

original: de ni gnas ma mchis so //
analyzed: de ni gnas ma mchis so //
translated: That is not the case.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /🔽rab 'byor / legs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa / rab 'byor / legs so //
translated: The Blessed One said,🔽“Subhūti, excellent, excellent!

original: legs so // rab 'byor /🔽byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sems can mi dmigs pas /
analyzed: legs so // rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sems can mi dmigs pas /
translated: Subhūti,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar bslab par bya'o //
translated: bodhisattva great beings should train in the perfection of wisdom like that, without apprehending sentient beings.

original: rab 'byor / khyod gang yang 'di skad du /
analyzed: rab 'byor / khyod gang yang 'di skad du /
translated: Subhūti, you asked,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: ‘Blessed One,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: what is the meaning of the term

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zhes bgyi na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zhes bgyi na /
translated: “bodhisattva great being”?

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zhes bgyi ba de chos gang gi tshig bla dvags lags /🔽zhes zer ba la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zhes bgyi ba de chos gang gi tshig bla dvags lags / zhes zer ba la /
translated: What is the term “bodhisattva great being” a designation for?’

original: rab 'byor / 'di ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ji snyam du sems /
translated: Subhūti, what do you think?

original: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba de gzugs kyi tshig bla dvags yin snyam mam /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba de gzugs kyi tshig bla dvags yin snyam mam /
translated: Is the term “bodhisattva” a designation for form?

original: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba de tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'i tshig bla dvags yin snyam mam /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba de tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'i tshig bla dvags yin snyam mam /
translated: Subhūti, do you think that the word ‘bodhisattva’ is a designation for feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness?

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
translated: Subhūti replied,

original: bcom ldan 'das de ni ma lags so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de ni ma lags so //
translated: “No, Blessed One.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / 'di ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ji snyam du sems /
translated: “Subhūti, what do you think?

original: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba de gzugs rtag pa nyid kyi tshig bla dvags yin snyam mam /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba de gzugs rtag pa nyid kyi tshig bla dvags yin snyam mam /
translated: Is the word ‘bodhisattva’ a designation for the permanence of form?

original: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba de gzugs mi rtag pa nyid kyi tshig bla dvags yin snyam mam /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba de gzugs mi rtag pa nyid kyi tshig bla dvags yin snyam mam /
translated: Is the word ‘bodhisattva’ a designation for the impermanence of form?

original: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba de gzugs bde ba nyid dang / gzugs sdug bsngal ba nyid @98a *//
analyzed: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba de gzugs bde ba nyid dang / gzugs sdug bsngal ba nyid @98a *//
translated: Similarly, is the word ‘bodhisattva’ a designation for the happiness of form, the suffering of form,

original: dang / gzugs bdag yod pa nyid dang / gzugs bdag med pa nyid dang / gzugs zhi ba nyid dang / gzugs ma zhi ba nyid kyi tshig bla dvags yin snyam mam /
analyzed: dang / gzugs bdag yod pa nyid dang / gzugs bdag med pa nyid dang / gzugs zhi ba nyid dang / gzugs ma zhi ba nyid kyi tshig bla dvags yin snyam mam /
translated: and the words ‘form is not empty of form,’ ‘form is not non-form,’ ‘form is not with signs,’ ‘form is not signless,’ ‘form is not having aspirations,’ and ‘form is not without aspirations’—are these words the bodhisattva great being’s perfection of wisdom?

original: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba de tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa rtag pa nyid dang / rnam par shes pa mi rtag pa nyid dang / rnam par shes pa bde ba nyid dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba de tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa rtag pa nyid dang / rnam par shes pa mi rtag pa nyid dang / rnam par shes pa bde ba nyid dang /
translated: Similarly, Subhūti, are the words ‘feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are permanent’ and ‘consciousness is impermanent,’ ‘consciousness is happiness’

original: rnam par shes pa sdug bsngal ba nyid dang / rnam par shes pa bdag yod pa nyid dang / rnam par shes pa bdag med pa nyid dang / rnam par shes pa zhi ba nyid dang / rnam par shes pa ma zhi ba nyid kyi tshig bla dvags yin snyam mam /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa sdug bsngal ba nyid dang / rnam par shes pa bdag yod pa nyid dang / rnam par shes pa bdag med pa nyid dang / rnam par shes pa zhi ba nyid dang / rnam par shes pa ma zhi ba nyid kyi tshig bla dvags yin snyam mam /
translated: and ‘consciousness is suffering,’ ‘consciousness is a self’ and ‘consciousness is not a self,’ ‘consciousness is peace’ and ‘consciousness is not peace’ the bodhisattva great being’s perfection of wisdom?

original: rab 'byor / 'di ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ji snyam du sems /
translated: Subhūti, what do you think?

original: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba de gzugs stong pa nyid dang / gzugs mi stong pa nyid dang; gzugs mtshan ma yod pa nyid dang / gzugs mtshan ma med pa nyid dang / gzugs smon pa yod pa nyid dang / gzugs smon pa med pa nyid kyi tshig bla dvags yin snyam mam /🔽rab 'byor / 'di ji snyam du sems /🔽byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba de tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa stong pa nyid dang / rnam par shes pa mi stong pa nyid dang / rnam par shes pa mtshan ma yod pa nyid dang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba de gzugs stong pa nyid dang / gzugs mi stong pa nyid dang; gzugs mtshan ma yod pa nyid dang / gzugs mtshan ma med pa nyid dang / gzugs smon pa yod pa nyid dang / gzugs smon pa med pa nyid kyi tshig bla dvags yin snyam mam / rab 'byor / 'di ji snyam du sems / byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba de tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa stong pa nyid dang / rnam par shes pa mi stong pa nyid dang / rnam par shes pa mtshan ma yod pa nyid dang /
translated: Is the bodhisattva a designation for form’s emptiness or non-emptiness, its having a sign or being signless, having aspirations or lacking aspirations, being afflicted or purified, or arising or ceasing?

original: rnam par shes pa mtshan ma med pa nyid dang / rnam par shes pa smon pa yod pa nyid dang / rnam par shes pa smon pa med @98b pa nyid kyi tshig bla dvags yin snyam mam /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa mtshan ma med pa nyid dang / rnam par shes pa smon pa yod pa nyid dang / rnam par shes pa smon pa med @98b pa nyid kyi tshig bla dvags yin snyam mam /
translated: Is the bodhisattva a designation for feeling, perception, formation, or consciousness’s emptiness or non-emptiness, its having a sign or being signless, having aspirations or lacking aspirations, being afflicted or purified, or arising or ceasing?”

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
translated: Subhūti replied,🔽“No, Venerable Śāriputra.”

original: bcom ldan 'das de ni ma lags so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de ni ma lags so //
translated: “No, Blessed One, it would not.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / khyod don gyi dbang gang nye bar bzung nas /
analyzed: rab 'byor / khyod don gyi dbang gang nye bar bzung nas /
translated: “Subhūti, what is the meaning that you are grasping at

original: 'di skad du byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba de gzugs rtag pa'i tshig bla dvags ma yin /
analyzed: 'di skad du byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba de gzugs rtag pa'i tshig bla dvags ma yin /
translated: when you say that the word ‘bodhisattva’ is not a designation for form as permanent

original: mi rtag pa'i tshig bla dvags ma yin /
analyzed: mi rtag pa'i tshig bla dvags ma yin /
translated: or impermanent,

original: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba de gzugs bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba'i tshig bla dvags ma yin /
analyzed: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba de gzugs bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba'i tshig bla dvags ma yin /
translated: and similarly, that the word ‘bodhisattva’ is not a designation for form as happiness or suffering,

original: bdag yod pa'i tshig bla dvags ma yin /🔽bdag med pa'i tshig bla dvags ma yin /
analyzed: bdag yod pa'i tshig bla dvags ma yin / bdag med pa'i tshig bla dvags ma yin /
translated: as a self or not a self,

original: zhi ba'i tshig bla dvags ma yin /🔽ma zhi ba'i tshig bla dvags ma yin /🔽stong pa nyid kyi tshig bla dvags ma yin /🔽mi stong pa'i tshig bla dvags ma yin /
analyzed: zhi ba'i tshig bla dvags ma yin / ma zhi ba'i tshig bla dvags ma yin / stong pa nyid kyi tshig bla dvags ma yin / mi stong pa'i tshig bla dvags ma yin /
translated: as peace or not peace,🔽as empty or not empty,🔽as with signs or signless,

original: mtshan ma yod pa'i tshig bla dvags ma yin /🔽mtshan ma med pa'i tshig bla dvags ma yin /
analyzed: mtshan ma yod pa'i tshig bla dvags ma yin /🔽mtshan ma med pa'i tshig bla dvags ma yin /
translated: as having aspirations or lacking aspirations,🔽or as calm or not calm?

original: smon pa yod pa'i tshig bla dvags ma yin /
analyzed: smon pa yod pa'i tshig bla dvags ma yin /
translated: It is not a term for the existent,

original: smon pa med pa'i tshig bla dvags ma yin /
analyzed: smon pa med pa'i tshig bla dvags ma yin /
translated: nor is it a term for the nonexistent.

original: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa rtag pa'i tshig bla dvags ma yin /
analyzed: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa rtag pa'i tshig bla dvags ma yin /
translated: Similarly, Subhūti, feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are not a term for permanence,

original: mi rtag pa'i tshig bla dvags ma yin /
analyzed: mi rtag pa'i tshig bla dvags ma yin /
translated: nor are they a term for impermanence.

original: bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag yod pa dang / bdag med pa dang / zhi ba dang / ma zhi pa dang / stong pa dang / mi stong pa dang / mtshan ma yod pa dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /
analyzed: bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag yod pa dang / bdag med pa dang / zhi ba dang / ma zhi pa dang / stong pa dang / mi stong pa dang / mtshan ma yod pa dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /
translated: They are not a term for happiness, suffering, self, not self, peace, not peace, empty, not empty, sign, signless,

original: smon pa yod pa dang / smon pa med pa'i tshig bla dvags ma yin /
analyzed: smon pa yod pa dang / smon pa med pa'i tshig bla dvags ma yin /
translated: existent, or nonexistent.🔽”

original: zhes zer / rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: zhes zer / rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
translated: Subhūti said,

original: bcom @99a *// ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom @99a *// ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: gzugs gtan ma mchis shing mi dmigs na /
analyzed: gzugs gtan ma mchis shing mi dmigs na /
translated: if form is utterly nonexistent and not apprehended,

original: byang chub sems dpa' gzugs kyi tshig bla dvags su 'gyur ba lta ga la mchis /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gzugs kyi tshig bla dvags su 'gyur ba lta ga la mchis /
translated: how could a bodhisattva be a term for form?

original: bcom ldan 'das tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa gtan ma mchis shing /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa gtan ma mchis shing /
translated: Blessed One, feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness are utterly nonexistent.

original: mi dmigs na /
analyzed: mi dmigs na /
translated: Blessed One, if feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness are utterly nonexistent and not apprehended,

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnam par shes pa'i tshig bla dvags su 'gyur ba lta ga la mchis /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnam par shes pa'i tshig bla dvags su 'gyur ba lta ga la mchis /
translated: how could a bodhisattva be a designation for consciousness?

original: bcom ldan 'das /🔽rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa gtan ma mchis shing /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das / rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa gtan ma mchis shing /
translated: Blessed One,

original: mi dmigs na /
analyzed: mi dmigs na /
translated: if permanence and impermanence are utterly nonexistent and not apprehended,

original: byang chub sems dpa' gzugs rtag pa'i tshig bla dvags su 'gyur ba lta ga la mchis /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gzugs rtag pa'i tshig bla dvags su 'gyur ba lta ga la mchis /
translated: how could a bodhisattva be a designation for the permanence of form?

original: de bzhin du bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag mchis pa dang / bdag ma mchis pa dang / zhi ba dang / ma zhi ba dang / stong pa dang / mi stong pa dang / mtshan ma mchis pa dang; mtshan ma ma mchis pa dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag mchis pa dang / bdag ma mchis pa dang / zhi ba dang / ma zhi ba dang / stong pa dang / mi stong pa dang / mtshan ma mchis pa dang; mtshan ma ma mchis pa dang /
translated: Similarly, if happiness and suffering, self and non-self, peace and non-peace, emptiness and non-emptiness, sign and signlessness,

original: smon pa mchis pa dang / smon pa ma mchis pa gtan ma mchis shing mi dmigs na /
analyzed: smon pa mchis pa dang / smon pa ma mchis pa gtan ma mchis shing mi dmigs na /
translated: wish and wishlessness are utterly nonexistent and not apprehended,🔽how could a bodhisattva be a designation for the wishlessness of form?

original: byang chub sems dpa' gzugs smon pa ma mchis pa'i tshig bla dvags su 'gyur ba lta ga la mchis /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gzugs smon pa ma mchis pa'i tshig bla dvags su 'gyur ba lta ga la mchis /
translated: How could the word ‘bodhisattva’ be a description of form as having aspirations?

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: de bzhin du rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa gtan ma mchis shing mi dmigs na /
analyzed: de bzhin du rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa gtan ma mchis shing mi dmigs na /
translated: in the same way, if permanence and impermanence are completely non-existent and non-apprehensible,

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnam par shes pa rtag pa dang mi rtag pa'i tshig bla dvags su 'gyur ba lta ga la mchis /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnam par shes pa rtag pa dang mi rtag pa'i tshig bla dvags su 'gyur ba lta ga la mchis /
translated: how could the word ‘bodhisattva’ be a description of consciousness as permanent or impermanent?

original: de bzhin du bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag mchis pa dang / bdag ma mchis pa dang / zhi ba dang / ma @99b zhi ba dang / stong pa dang / mi stong pa dang / mtshan ma mchis pa dang / mtshan ma ma mchis pa dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag mchis pa dang / bdag ma mchis pa dang / zhi ba dang / ma @99b zhi ba dang / stong pa dang / mi stong pa dang / mtshan ma mchis pa dang / mtshan ma ma mchis pa dang /
translated: Similarly, if happiness and suffering, self and no self, peace and not peace, emptiness and not emptiness, signs and signlessness,

original: smon pa mchis pa dang / smon pa ma mchis pa gtan ma mchis shing mi dmigs na /
analyzed: smon pa mchis pa dang / smon pa ma mchis pa gtan ma mchis shing mi dmigs na /
translated: aspirations and no aspirations are completely non-existent and non-apprehensible,

original: byang chub sems dpa' smon pa ma mchis pa'i tshig bla dvags su 'gyur ba lta ga la mchis /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' smon pa ma mchis pa'i tshig bla dvags su 'gyur ba lta ga la mchis /
translated: how could the word ‘bodhisattva’ be a description of aspirations?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,🔽“Excellent, Subhūti!

original: rab 'byor / legs so //
analyzed: rab 'byor / legs so //
translated: Subhuti: Good, O Lord, good!

original: legs so // byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar spyod pas gzugs kyi tshig bla dvags mi dmigs /
analyzed: legs so // byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar spyod pas gzugs kyi tshig bla dvags mi dmigs /
translated: A Bodhisattva, a great being who thus courses in the perfection of wisdom, does not apprehend the designation of form,

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa mi rtag pa'i tshig bla dvags mi dmigs /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa mi rtag pa'i tshig bla dvags mi dmigs /
translated: nor the designation of feeling, perception, will, or consciousness as impermanent,

original: gzugs rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa dang / bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag yod pa dang / bdag med pa dang / zhi ba dang / ma zhi ba dang / stong pa dang / mi stong pa dang / mtshan ma yod pa dang /🔽mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa yod pa dang / smon pa med pa'i tshig bla dvags mi dmigs /
analyzed: gzugs rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa dang / bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag yod pa dang / bdag med pa dang / zhi ba dang / ma zhi ba dang / stong pa dang / mi stong pa dang / mtshan ma yod pa dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa yod pa dang / smon pa med pa'i tshig bla dvags mi dmigs /
translated: nor the designation of form as permanent or impermanent, as ease or ill, as self or not-self, as quiet or not quiet, as empty or not empty, as with signs or signless, as having or not having a core.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa rtag pa'i tshig bla dvags mi dmigs /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa rtag pa'i tshig bla dvags mi dmigs /
translated: He does not apprehend the designation of feeling, perception, will, or consciousness as permanent or impermanent, as ease or ill, as self or not-self, as quiet or not quiet, as empty or not empty, as with signs or signless, as having or not having a core.

original: rnam par shes pa mi rtag pa dang / bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag yod pa dang / bdag med pa dang / zhi ba dang / ma zhi ba dang / stong pa dang / mi stong pa dang / mtshan ma yod pa dang /
