analyzed: rnam par shes pa mi rtag pa dang / bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag yod pa dang / bdag med pa dang / zhi ba dang / ma zhi ba dang / stong pa dang / mi stong pa dang / mtshan ma yod pa dang /
translated: the impermanence of consciousness, the happiness of consciousness, the suffering of consciousness, the self of consciousness, the nonself of consciousness, the peace of consciousness, the nonpeace of consciousness, the emptiness of consciousness, the nonemptiness of consciousness, the sign of consciousness,

original: mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa yod pa dang / smon pa med pa'i bar gyi tshig bla dvags mi dmigs par shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya'o //🔽@100a *// rab 'byor khyod kyis 'di lta ste /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa yod pa dang / smon pa med pa'i bar gyi tshig bla dvags mi dmigs par shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya'o // @100a *// rab 'byor khyod kyis 'di lta ste /
translated: the signless of consciousness, the wish of consciousness, and the wishless of consciousness.

original: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bgyi ba'i chos de bdag gis yang dag par rjes su ma mthong ngo //🔽zhes de skad ces zer ba'ang /🔽rab 'byor / chos kyis chos kyi dbyings yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bgyi ba'i chos de bdag gis yang dag par rjes su ma mthong ngo // zhes de skad ces zer ba'ang / rab 'byor / chos kyis chos kyi dbyings yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: “Subhūti, you have said, ‘I do not see that dharma called a bodhisattva.’🔽“Subhūti, a dharma does not see the dharma-constituent.

original: chos kyi dbyings kyis chos yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyis chos yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: The dharma-constituent does not see a dharma.

original: rab 'byor / gzugs kyi khams kyis chos kyi dbyings yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzugs kyi khams kyis chos kyi dbyings yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: Subhuti, the element of form does not see the dharma-element.

original: chos kyi dbyings kyis kyang gzugs kyi khams yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyis kyang gzugs kyi khams yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: And the dharma-element does not see the element of form.

original: rab 'byor / de bzhin du tshor ba'i khams dang / 'du shes kyi khams dang / 'du byed kyi khams dang / rnam par shes pa'i khams kyis chos kyi dbyings yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin du tshor ba'i khams dang / 'du shes kyi khams dang / 'du byed kyi khams dang / rnam par shes pa'i khams kyis chos kyi dbyings yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: Subhuti, in the same way, the element of feeling, the element of perception, the element of volitional factors, and the element of consciousness do not see the dharma-element.

original: chos kyi dbyings kyis kyang rnam par shes pa'i khams yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo; ;mig gi khams kyi chos kyi dbyings yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyis kyang rnam par shes pa'i khams yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo; ;mig gi khams kyi chos kyi dbyings yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: And the dharma-element does not see the element of consciousness. The dharma-element does not see the eye constituent.

original: de bzhin du rna ba'i khams dang / sna'i khams dang / lce'i khams dang / lus kyi khams dang / yid kyi khams kyis chos kyi dbyings yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du rna ba'i khams dang / sna'i khams dang / lce'i khams dang / lus kyi khams dang / yid kyi khams kyis chos kyi dbyings yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: In the same way, the dharma-element does not see the ear constituent, the nose constituent, the tongue constituent, the body constituent, or the thinking-mind constituent.

original: chos kyi dbyings kyis kyang yid kyi khams yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyis kyang yid kyi khams yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: the dharma-constituent does not see the mind-constituent.

original: rab 'byor / 'dus byas kyi khams kyis 'dus ma byas kyi khams yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'dus byas kyi khams kyis 'dus ma byas kyi khams yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: Subhūti, the compounded element does not see the uncompounded element.

original: 'dus ma byas kyi khams kyis kyang 'dus byas kyi khams yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas kyi khams kyis kyang 'dus byas kyi khams yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: The uncompounded element does not see the compounded element.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽'dus byas la @100b ma gtogs par yang 'dus ma byas gdags par mi nus la /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / 'dus byas la @100b ma gtogs par yang 'dus ma byas gdags par mi nus la /
translated: If you ask why,

original: 'dus ma byas la ma gtogs par yang 'dus byas gdags par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas la ma gtogs par yang 'dus byas gdags par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Subhūti, it is because apart from the compounded it is not possible to designate the uncompounded, and apart from the uncompounded it is not possible to designate the compounded.

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar spyod pas chos gang yang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar spyod pas chos gang yang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
translated: Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom like that do not see any dharma at all.

original: yang dag par rjes su ma mthong bas /
analyzed: yang dag par rjes su ma mthong bas /
translated: Not seeing,

original: mi skrag mi dngang zhing dbang bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: mi skrag mi dngang zhing dbang bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: they do not tremble, feel frightened, or become terrified.

original: chos gang la'ang de'i sems mi zhum /
analyzed: chos gang la'ang de'i sems mi zhum /
translated: One's mind does not become discouraged with regard to any phenomenon.

original: mi 'gong zhing /
analyzed: mi 'gong zhing /
translated: He does not become disheartened or timid about any dharma,

original: de'i yid 'gyod par yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i yid 'gyod par yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: and he does not become regretful.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rab 'byor / 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas gzugs yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas gzugs yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
translated: Subhūti, it is because bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom do not see form,

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
translated: do not see feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness,

original: mig yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
analyzed: mig yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
translated: do not see the eyes,

original: rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
analyzed: rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
translated: do not see the ears, nose, tongue, body, or mind,

original: gzugs yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
analyzed: gzugs yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
translated: do not see a form,

original: sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang; reg bya dang / chos yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
analyzed: sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang; reg bya dang / chos yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
translated: do not see a sound, a smell, a taste, a feeling, or a dharma,

original: ma rig pa yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
analyzed: ma rig pa yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
translated: do not see ignorance,

original: 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa dang / ming dang gzugs dang / skye mched drug dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba dang / sred pa dang / len pa dang / srid pa dang / skye ba dang / rga shi yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
analyzed: 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa dang / ming dang gzugs dang / skye mched drug dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba dang / sred pa dang / len pa dang / srid pa dang / skye ba dang / rga shi yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
translated: They do not see volitional factors, consciousness, name and form, the six sense sources, contact, feeling, craving, grasping, becoming, birth, and aging and death.

original: 'dod chags yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
analyzed: 'dod chags yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
translated: They do not see desire.

original: @101a *// zhe sdang dang / gti mug yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
analyzed: @101a *// zhe sdang dang / gti mug yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
translated: They do not see anger or ignorance.

original: bdag yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
analyzed: bdag yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
translated: They do not see a self.

original: sems can dang / srog dang / gso ba dang / skyes bu dang; gang zag dang / skye ba po dang / shed las skyes dang / shed bu dang / byed pa po dang / tshor ba po dang / shes pa po dang / mthong ba po yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
analyzed: sems can dang / srog dang / gso ba dang / skyes bu dang; gang zag dang / skye ba po dang / shed las skyes dang / shed bu dang / byed pa po dang / tshor ba po dang / shes pa po dang / mthong ba po yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
translated: They do not see a being, a living being, a creature, a person, an individual, one born of Manu, a child of Manu, an agent, a feeler, a knower, or a viewer.

original: 'dod pa'i khams yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
translated: They do not see the desire realm.

original: gzugs kyi khams dang / gzugs med pa'i khams yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams dang / gzugs med pa'i khams yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
translated: He does not see the form realm, and he does not see the formless realm.

original: nyan thos dang / nyan thos kyi chos rnams yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
analyzed: nyan thos dang / nyan thos kyi chos rnams yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
translated: He does not see the śrāvakas, and he does not see the śrāvaka teachings.

original: rang sangs rgyas dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
translated: He does not see the pratyekabuddhas, and he does not see the pratyekabuddha teachings.

original: byang chub sems dpa' yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
translated: He does not see the bodhisattvas.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i chos rnams yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /🔽sangs rgyas yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i chos rnams yang dag par rjes su mi mthong / sangs rgyas yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
translated: He does not see the bodhisattva teachings.🔽He does not see the buddhas.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
translated: He does not see the buddha teachings.

original: byang chub yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /🔽chos thams cad kyi bar du yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byang chub yang dag par rjes su mi mthong / chos thams cad kyi bar du yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: He does not see awakening.🔽He does not see any phenomena at all.

original: de chos thams cad yang dag par rjes su ma mthong bas /
analyzed: de chos thams cad yang dag par rjes su ma mthong bas /
translated: Since he does not see any phenomena,

original: mi skrag mi dngang zhing dngang bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi skrag mi dngang zhing dngang bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: he is not frightened, terrified, or gripped by fear.

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
translated: Subhūti replied:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa @101b la spyod pa /🔽ci'i slad du chos thams cad la sems mi zhum /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa @101b la spyod pa / ci'i slad du chos thams cad la sems mi zhum /
translated: when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom,

original: ma 'gong ba lags /
analyzed: ma 'gong ba lags /
translated: why do they not become disheartened or discouraged about all phenomena?”🔽“Blessed One, why is that?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: rab 'byor / 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams mi dmigs shing yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams mi dmigs shing yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
translated: “Subhūti, it is because bodhisattva great beings do not observe or see the mind and mental factors.

original: rab 'byor / de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /
translated: Subhūti, therefore, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom,

original: chos thams cad la sems zhum par mi 'gyur zhing 'gong bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos thams cad la sems zhum par mi 'gyur zhing 'gong bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: they do not become disheartened or discouraged about all phenomena.”

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
translated: Subhūti asked:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i yid skrag par mi 'gyur ba lags /
analyzed: ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i yid skrag par mi 'gyur ba lags /
translated: how do bodhisattva great beings’ minds not become frightened?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

original: rab 'byor / 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sems dang sems kyi chos rnams dang / yid dang yid kyi chos rnams mi dmigs shing yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sems dang sems kyi chos rnams dang / yid dang yid kyi chos rnams mi dmigs shing yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
translated: Subhuti, it is because the Bodhisattva, the great being, does not apprehend or see mind and mental factors, or thought and mental factors.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i yid skrag par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i yid skrag par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Subhuti, in that way the Bodhisattva, the great being, does not become frightened.

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos de ltar chos thams cad mi dmigs pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos de ltar chos thams cad mi dmigs pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bya'o //
translated: Subhuti, the Bodhisattva, the great being, should practice the perfection of wisdom by not apprehending all dharmas in that way.

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa gal te shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mi dmigs shing /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa gal te shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mi dmigs shing /
translated: Subhuti, if the Bodhisattva, the great being, practicing the perfection of wisdom, does not apprehend the perfection of wisdom,

original: byang @102a *// chub sems dpa' de dang / byang chub sems dpa'i ming de dang / byang chub kyi sems de'ang mi dmigs na /
analyzed: byang @102a *// chub sems dpa' de dang / byang chub sems dpa'i ming de dang / byang chub kyi sems de'ang mi dmigs na /
translated: and that bodhisattva, and that name of a bodhisattva, and that thought of awakening are not apprehended.

original: 'di nyid byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gdams pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di nyid byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gdams pa yin te /
translated: This is the instruction in the perfection of wisdom of bodhisattva great beings.

original: 'di nyid rjes su bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di nyid rjes su bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is the instruction.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khri brgyad stong pa las /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khri brgyad stong pa las /
translated: In the Perfection of Wisdom in Eighteen Thousand Lines,

original: rab 'byor gyi le'u zhes bya ste drug pa'o ////
analyzed: rab 'byor gyi le'u zhes bya ste drug pa'o ////
translated: the chapter called “Subhūti” is the sixth.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la /
translated: Then the Lord

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: said to the venerable Subhūti:

original: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gzugs yongs su rtogs par 'tshal bas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gzugs yongs su rtogs par 'tshal bas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi'o //
translated: “Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings who want to fully understand form should train in the perfection of wisdom.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa yongs su rtogs par 'tshal bas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa yongs su rtogs par 'tshal bas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi'o //
translated: “Bodhisattva great beings who want to fully understand feelings, perceptions, formative predispositions, and consciousness should train in the transcendent perfection of wisdom.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po mig yongs su rtogs par 'tshal bas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po mig yongs su rtogs par 'tshal bas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi'o //
translated: Bodhisattva great beings who want to fully understand the eyes should train in the transcendent perfection of wisdom.

original: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid yongs su rtogs par 'tshal bas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid yongs su rtogs par 'tshal bas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi'o //
translated: Similarly, bodhisattva great beings who want to fully understand the ears, nose, tongue, body, and mental faculty should train in the transcendent perfection of wisdom.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gzugs yongs su rtogs par @102b 'tshal bas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gzugs yongs su rtogs par @102b 'tshal bas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi'o //
translated: Bodhisattva great beings who want to fully understand forms should train in the transcendent perfection of wisdom.

original: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya dang / chos yongs su rtogs par 'tshal bas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya dang / chos yongs su rtogs par 'tshal bas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi'o //
translated: “Similarly, Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings who want to fully understand sounds, smells, tastes, tangibles, and dharmas should train in the perfection of wisdom.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po mig gi rnam par shes pa yongs su rtogs par 'tshal bas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po mig gi rnam par shes pa yongs su rtogs par 'tshal bas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi'o //
translated: “Bodhisattva great beings who want to fully understand eye consciousness should train in the perfection of wisdom.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i bar du yongs su rtogs par 'tshal bas /🔽shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i bar du yongs su rtogs par 'tshal bas /🔽shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi'o //
translated: Bodhisattva great beings who want to fully understand up to mind consciousness should train in the perfection of wisdom.🔽“Bodhisattva great beings who want to fully understand the eye sense-sphere should train in the perfection of wisdom.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po mig gi 'dus te reg pa yongs su rtogs par 'tshal ba dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i bar du yongs su rtogs par 'tshal bas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po mig gi 'dus te reg pa yongs su rtogs par 'tshal ba dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i bar du yongs su rtogs par 'tshal bas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi'o //
translated: “Bodhisattva great beings who want to fully understand eye contact should train in the perfection of wisdom.🔽Bodhisattva great beings who want to fully understand the contact that arises from the combination of eye, form, and consciousness, up to the contact that arises from the combination of mind, phenomena, and consciousness should train in the perfection of wisdom.🔽Bodhisattva great beings who want to fully understand eye consciousness should train in the perfection of wisdom.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po mig gi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba yongs su rtogs par 'tshal ba dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba'i bar du yongs su rtogs par 'tshal bas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po mig gi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba yongs su rtogs par 'tshal ba dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba'i bar du yongs su rtogs par 'tshal bas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi'o //
translated: Bodhisattva great beings who want to fully understand the consciousnesses of the ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind should train in the perfection of wisdom.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ma rig pa yongs su rtogs par 'tshal bas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi'o //🔽de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'du byed @103a *//
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ma rig pa yongs su rtogs par 'tshal bas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi'o //🔽de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'du byed @103a *//
translated: Bodhisattva great beings who want to fully understand the ignorance that is the cause of the six consciousnesses should train in the perfection of wisdom.🔽Bodhisattva great beings who want to fully understand the formations that are the cause of the six consciousnesses should train in the perfection of wisdom.

original: dang / rnam par shes pa dang / ming dang gzugs dang / skye mched drug dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba dang / sred pa dang / len pa dang / srid pa dang / skye ba dang / rga shi yongs su rtogs par 'tshal bas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi'o //
analyzed: dang / rnam par shes pa dang / ming dang gzugs dang / skye mched drug dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba dang / sred pa dang / len pa dang / srid pa dang / skye ba dang / rga shi yongs su rtogs par 'tshal bas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi'o //
translated: and to fully understand consciousness, name and form, the six sense sources, contact, feeling, craving, grasping, becoming, birth, and old age and death, one should train in the perfection of wisdom.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang; gti mug spang bar 'tshal bas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang; gti mug spang bar 'tshal bas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi'o //
translated: “Bodhisattva mahāsattvas who wish to abandon desire, anger, and ignorance should train in the perfection of wisdom.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'jig tshogs la lta ba spang bar 'tshal ba dang / the tshom dang / tshul khrims dang / brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang / gnod sems spang bar 'tshal ba dang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'jig tshogs la lta ba spang bar 'tshal ba dang / the tshom dang / tshul khrims dang / brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang / gnod sems spang bar 'tshal ba dang /
translated: Bodhisattva mahāsattvas who wish to abandon the view of the transitory collection, doubt, holding as paramount the view of rules and ritual, desire, and malice,

original: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang / gzugs kyi 'dod chags dang / gzugs med pa'i 'dod chags yongs su rtogs par 'tshal ba dang / kun tu sbyor ba dang / bag la nyal dang / kun nas ldang ba rnams spang bar 'tshal bas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi'o //🔽gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyor ba bzhi dang / chu bo bzhi dang / mdud pa bzhi dang / len pa bzhi dang / phyin ci log bzhi'i bar du spang bar 'tshal bas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang / gzugs kyi 'dod chags dang / gzugs med pa'i 'dod chags yongs su rtogs par 'tshal ba dang / kun tu sbyor ba dang / bag la nyal dang / kun nas ldang ba rnams spang bar 'tshal bas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi'o // gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyor ba bzhi dang / chu bo bzhi dang / mdud pa bzhi dang / len pa bzhi dang / phyin ci log bzhi'i bar du spang bar 'tshal bas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi'o //
translated: “Moreover, Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings who want to fully understand desire for the desire realm, desire for the form realm, and desire for the formless realm, and who want to abandon fetters, latent impulses, and entanglements, should train in the perfection of wisdom.🔽“Moreover, Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings who want to abandon the four bonds, the four rivers, the four knots, the four graspings, and so on up to the four errors, should train in the perfection of wisdom.

original: byang chub sems @103b dpa' sems dpa' chen po mi dge ba'i las kyi lam bcu spang bar 'tshal bas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems @103b dpa' sems dpa' chen po mi dge ba'i las kyi lam bcu spang bar 'tshal bas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi'o //
translated: “Moreover, Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings who want to abandon the ten unwholesome courses of action should train in the perfection of wisdom.”

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam yongs su rdzogs par bgyi bar 'tshal bas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam yongs su rdzogs par bgyi bar 'tshal bas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi'o //
translated: “Bodhisattva great beings who want to complete the path of the ten virtuous actions should train in the perfection of wisdom.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par bgyi bar 'tshal bas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par bgyi bar 'tshal bas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi'o //
translated: Bodhisattva great beings who want to complete the perfection of generosity should train in the perfection of wisdom.

original: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
translated: Similarly, bodhisattva great beings who want to complete the perfection of moral discipline, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of concentration,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par bgyi bar 'tshal bas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par bgyi bar 'tshal bas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi'o //
translated: and the perfection of wisdom should train in the perfection of wisdom.”

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bsam gtan bzhi dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang / dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi dang / yang dag par spong ba bzhi dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi dang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bsam gtan bzhi dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang / dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi dang / yang dag par spong ba bzhi dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi dang /
translated: “Those bodhisattva great beings who wish to perfect the four concentrations, the four immeasurables, the four formless absorptions, the four establishments of mindfulness, the four right efforts, the four legs of miraculous power,

original: dbang po lnga dang / stobs lnga dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / mngon par shes pa drug dang /🔽de bzhin gshegs @104a *//
analyzed: dbang po lnga dang / stobs lnga dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / mngon par shes pa drug dang / de bzhin gshegs @104a *//
translated: the five faculties, the five powers, the seven branches of enlightenment, the noble eightfold path, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, the four fearlessnesses, the six clairvoyances,

original: pa'i stobs bcu dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad yongs su rdzogs par bgyi bar 'tshal bas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi'o //
analyzed: pa'i stobs bcu dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad yongs su rdzogs par bgyi bar 'tshal bas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi'o //
translated: the ten tathāgata powers, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha should train in the perfection of wisdom.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byang chub kyi yan lag yod pa'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug par 'tshal bas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byang chub kyi yan lag yod pa'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug par 'tshal bas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi'o //
translated: “Bodhisattva great beings who want to attain the meditative stabilization called the branch of awakening should train in the perfection of wisdom.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sengge rnam par rtse ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug par 'tshal ba dang / sengge rnam par bsgyings pa'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug par 'tshal ba dang / gzungs kyi sgo dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo thams cad thob par 'tshal ba dang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sengge rnam par rtse ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug par 'tshal ba dang / sengge rnam par bsgyings pa'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug par 'tshal ba dang / gzungs kyi sgo dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo thams cad thob par 'tshal ba dang /
translated: “Bodhisattva great beings who want to attain the meditative stabilization called the lion’s sport, who want to attain the meditative stabilization called the lion’s stride, and who want to attain all the dhāraṇī gateways and meditative stabilization gateways

original: dpa' bar 'gro ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug par 'tshal ba dang / rin chen phyag rgya'i ting nge 'dzin dang / zla ba'i 'od kyi ting nge 'dzin dang / zla ba'i rgyal mtshan tog gi ting nge 'dzin dang / chos thams cad kyi phyag rgyar gyur pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang /
analyzed: dpa' bar 'gro ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug par 'tshal ba dang / rin chen phyag rgya'i ting nge 'dzin dang / zla ba'i 'od kyi ting nge 'dzin dang / zla ba'i rgyal mtshan tog gi ting nge 'dzin dang / chos thams cad kyi phyag rgyar gyur pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang /
translated: the samādhi of the heroic gait, the samādhi of the precious seal, the samādhi of the light of the moon, the samādhi of the banner of the moon’s victory, the samādhi that is the seal of all phenomena,

original: kun tu lta ba'i phyag rgya'i ting nge 'dzin dang / chos kyi dbyings su nges pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / nges pa'i rgyal mtshan tog gi ting nge 'dzin dang / rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin dang / chos thams cad la 'jug pa'i sgo'i ting nge 'dzin dang /
analyzed: kun tu lta ba'i phyag rgya'i ting nge 'dzin dang / chos kyi dbyings su nges pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / nges pa'i rgyal mtshan tog gi ting nge 'dzin dang / rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin dang / chos thams cad la 'jug pa'i sgo'i ting nge 'dzin dang /
translated: the samādhi of the seal of all-seeing, the samādhi of the ascertainment of the realm of phenomena, the samādhi of the banner of ascertainment’s victory, the vajra-like samādhi, the samādhi of the gateway to engaging with all phenomena,

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyal po'i ting nge 'dzin dang / rgyal po'i phyag rgya'i ting nge 'dzin dang / dpung bkod pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / yang dag par 'phags pa'i ting nge @104b 'dzin dang / chos thams cad kyi nges pa'i tshig la gdon mi za bar 'jug pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyal po'i ting nge 'dzin dang / rgyal po'i phyag rgya'i ting nge 'dzin dang / dpung bkod pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / yang dag par 'phags pa'i ting nge @104b 'dzin dang / chos thams cad kyi nges pa'i tshig la gdon mi za bar 'jug pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang /
translated: the king of samādhis, the samādhi of the king’s mudrā, the samādhi of the arrayed army, the samādhi of perfect elevation, the samādhi of the definitive words of all phenomena,

original: chos thams cad shes pa'i bzod pa la 'jug pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / phyogs bcur rnam par lta ba'i ting nge 'dzin dang / chos thams cad kyi gzungs kyi sgo'i phyag rgya'i ting nge 'dzin dang / chos thams cad brjed pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang /
analyzed: chos thams cad shes pa'i bzod pa la 'jug pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / phyogs bcur rnam par lta ba'i ting nge 'dzin dang / chos thams cad kyi gzungs kyi sgo'i phyag rgya'i ting nge 'dzin dang / chos thams cad brjed pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang /
translated: the samādhi of the acceptance of the knowledge of all phenomena, the samādhi of looking in the ten directions, the samādhi of the seal of the dhāraṇī of all phenomena, the samādhi of the nonforgetfulness of all phenomena,

original: chos thams cad yang dag par 'du ba'i rnam pa'i phyag rgya'i ting nge 'dzin dang / nam mkha'i gnas la gnas pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / mngon par shes pa mi nyams pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang /
analyzed: chos thams cad yang dag par 'du ba'i rnam pa'i phyag rgya'i ting nge 'dzin dang / nam mkha'i gnas la gnas pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / mngon par shes pa mi nyams pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang /
translated: the samadhi of the seal of the aspect of the perfect gathering of all phenomena, the samadhi of abiding in the abode of space, the samadhi of the complete purity of the three spheres, the samadhi of undiminishing superknowledge,🔽the samadhi of becoming a vessel, the samadhi of the victory banner’s crown ornament, the samadhi of definitely burning all afflictions, the samadhi of definitely destroying the power of the four maras,

original: snod du gyur pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / rgyal mtshan gyi rtse mo'i dpung rgyan gyi ting nge 'dzin dang / nyon mongs pa thams cad nges par sreg pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / bdud bzhi'i dpung stobs nges par med par byed pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang /
analyzed: snod du gyur pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / rgyal mtshan gyi rtse mo'i dpung rgyan gyi ting nge 'dzin dang / nyon mongs pa thams cad nges par sreg pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / bdud bzhi'i dpung stobs nges par med par byed pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang /
translated: and the samadhi of the lion’s play.

original: ye shes sgron ma'i ting nge 'dzin dang / stobs bcu'i stobs kyis 'phags pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / nam mkha' ltar chags pa med pas rnam par grol zhing gos pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug par 'tshal bas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi'o //
analyzed: ye shes sgron ma'i ting nge 'dzin dang / stobs bcu'i stobs kyis 'phags pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / nam mkha' ltar chags pa med pas rnam par grol zhing gos pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug par 'tshal bas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi'o //
translated: the Samādhi of the Lamp of Wisdom, the Samādhi of the Noble One with the Power of the Ten Powers, and the Samādhi of Unattached Liberation and Untaintedness like Space.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo de dag dang / gzhan dag kyang thob par 'tshal bas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi'o ////
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo de dag dang / gzhan dag kyang thob par 'tshal bas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi'o ////
translated: Bodhisattva Mahāsattvas who wish to attain these and other samādhi gates should train in the perfection of wisdom.

original: @105a *// shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khri brgyad stong pa /
analyzed: @105a *// shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khri brgyad stong pa /
translated: The Perfection of Wisdom in Eighteen Thousand Lines

original: bam po drug pa /
analyzed: bam po drug pa /
translated: Fascicle Six

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems can thams cad kyi bsam pa yongs su rdzogs par bgyi bar 'tshal bas /
analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems can thams cad kyi bsam pa yongs su rdzogs par bgyi bar 'tshal bas /
translated: Furthermore, Bodhisattva Mahāsattvas who wish to fulfill the aspirations of all sentient beings,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi'o //
translated: I should train in the perfection of wisdom.

original: bcom ldan 'das /🔽gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dge ba'i rtsa ba gang dag yongs su rdzogs pas ngan song rnams su mi ltung ba dang / rigs dma' ba rnams su mi skye ba dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sar mi ltung ba dang /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dge ba'i rtsa ba gang dag yongs su rdzogs pas ngan song rnams su mi ltung ba dang / rigs dma' ba rnams su mi skye ba dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sar mi ltung ba dang /
translated: Blessed One,🔽Furthermore, Blessed One, bodhisattva great beings who want to complete all the wholesome roots so that they do not fall into the lower realms, are not born in low-caste families, do not fall to the śrāvaka or pratyekabuddha levels,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon spyi gtsug tu mi ltung ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad yongs su rdzogs par bgyi bar 'tshal bas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon spyi gtsug tu mi ltung ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad yongs su rdzogs par bgyi bar 'tshal bas /
translated: and do not fall to the bodhisattva faults should

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi'o //
translated: train in the perfection of wisdom.”

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus /
translated: Then the venerable Śāriputra

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: said to the venerable Subhūti,

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa'i skyon spyi gtsug tu ltung ba yin /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa'i skyon spyi gtsug tu ltung ba yin /
translated: “Venerable Subhūti, what are the bodhisattva faults?”

original: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
translated: Subhūti replied,🔽“Venerable Śāriputra, bodhisattvas should not be afraid of any faults.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /🔽byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po thabs la mi mkhas pas pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod cing /🔽thabs la mi mkhas pas stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin la brten te nyan thos kyi sa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sar yang mi ltung la /🔽byang chub sems @105b dpa'i skyon med par yang mi 'jug pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i skyon zhes bya'o //🔽sh'a ri'i bus smras pa /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po thabs la mi mkhas pas pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod cing / thabs la mi mkhas pas stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin la brten te nyan thos kyi sa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sar yang mi ltung la / byang chub sems @105b dpa'i skyon med par yang mi 'jug pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i skyon zhes bya'o // sh'a ri'i bus smras pa /
translated: The Venerable Śāriputra

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor ci'i phyir /🔽'di byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i skyon du 'gyur /🔽rab 'byor gyis smras pa /🔽tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /🔽byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i skyon zhes bya ba ni /🔽'di lta ste /🔽chos la sred pa'o //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor ci'i phyir /🔽'di byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i skyon du 'gyur /🔽rab 'byor gyis smras pa /🔽tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /🔽byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i skyon zhes bya ba ni /🔽'di lta ste /🔽chos la sred pa'o //

original: sh'a ri'i bus smras pa; tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bus smras pa; tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor /
translated: Śāriputra said, Venerable Subhūti,

original: chos la sred pa gang yin /
analyzed: chos la sred pa gang yin /
translated: what is the craving for dharmas?

original: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
translated: Subhūti said,

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa na gzugs la stong zhes bya bar mngon par zhen cing gnas te /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa na gzugs la stong zhes bya bar mngon par zhen cing gnas te /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra, here when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom, they settle down on and get attached to the idea that 'form is empty,'

original: kun tu shes pa dang / de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa la stong zhes bya bar mngon par zhen cing gnas te /🔽kun tu shes pa de ni /
analyzed: kun tu shes pa dang / de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa la stong zhes bya bar mngon par zhen cing gnas te / kun tu shes pa de ni /
translated: and similarly, they settle down on and get attached to the idea that 'feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are empty,'🔽and they settle down on and get attached to the idea that 'the eyes are empty,' and they settle down on and get attached to the idea that 'the ears, nose, tongue, body, and thinking mind are empty.'

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i mthun pa'i chos la sred pa ste skyon zhes bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i mthun pa'i chos la sred pa ste skyon zhes bya'o //
translated: that is the craving for dharmas that is a fault for bodhisattva great beings.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra,

original: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' gzugs la mi rtag ces bya bar mngon par zhen cing gnas te kun tu shes pa dang / gzugs sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med pa dang / mi sdug pa dang / zhi ba dang / stong pa dang /
analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' gzugs la mi rtag ces bya bar mngon par zhen cing gnas te kun tu shes pa dang / gzugs sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med pa dang / mi sdug pa dang / zhi ba dang / stong pa dang /
translated: Moreover, if bodhisattvas settle down on, fixate on, and are attached to the idea that form is impermanent,🔽and if they settle down on, fixate on, and are attached to the ideas that form is suffering, is not a self, is unpleasant, is peaceful, is empty,

original: mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa zhes bya bar mngon par zhen cing gnas te kun tu shes pa de ni /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa zhes bya bar mngon par zhen cing gnas te kun tu shes pa de ni /
translated: is signless, and is wishless,

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra,

original: byang @106a *// chub sems dpa'i mthun pa'i chos la sred pa ste skyon no //
analyzed: byang @106a *// chub sems dpa'i mthun pa'i chos la sred pa ste skyon no //
translated: this is a bodhisattva’s craving for the concordant teachings, and it is a fault.

original: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa la mi rtag ces bya bar mngon par zhen cing gnas te kun tu shes pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med pa dang / mi sdug pa dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa la mi rtag ces bya bar mngon par zhen cing gnas te kun tu shes pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med pa dang / mi sdug pa dang /
translated: Similarly, if they settle down on, fixate on, and are attached to the ideas that feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness are impermanent, are suffering, are not a self, are unpleasant,

original: zhi ba dang / stong pa dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa zhes bya bar mngon par zhen cing gnas te kun tu shes pa de ni /
analyzed: zhi ba dang / stong pa dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa zhes bya bar mngon par zhen cing gnas te kun tu shes pa de ni /
translated: He abides in and is attached to the ideas of peace, emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i rjes su mthun pa'i chos la sred pa ste skyon no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i rjes su mthun pa'i chos la sred pa ste skyon no //
translated: this is the bodhisattvas’ fault of craving for the Dharma that is in accordance with the Dharma.

original: gal te 'di ltar gzugs spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: gal te 'di ltar gzugs spang bar bya'o //
translated: “If he thinks, ‘Form should be abandoned,’

original: 'dis gzugs spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'dis gzugs spang bar bya'o //
translated: ‘This is the abandonment of form,’

original: 'di ltar tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa spang bar bya'o //
translated: ‘Feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness should be abandoned,’

original: 'dis spang bar bya'o //🔽'di ltar sdug bsngal yongs su shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dis spang bar bya'o // 'di ltar sdug bsngal yongs su shes par bya'o //
translated: ‘This is the abandonment of those,’🔽‘Suffering should be fully known,’

original: 'dis sdug bsngal ba yongs su shes par bya'o //🔽'di ltar kun 'byung ba spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'dis sdug bsngal ba yongs su shes par bya'o // 'di ltar kun 'byung ba spang bar bya'o //
translated: ‘This is the full knowledge of suffering,’🔽‘Origination should be abandoned,’

original: 'dis kun 'byung ba spang bar bya'o //🔽'di ltar 'gog pa mngon sum du bya'o //
analyzed: 'dis kun 'byung ba spang bar bya'o // 'di ltar 'gog pa mngon sum du bya'o //
translated: ‘This is the abandonment of origination,’🔽‘Cessation should be realized,’

original: 'dis 'gog pa mngon sum du bya'o //
analyzed: 'dis 'gog pa mngon sum du bya'o //
translated: ‘This is the realization of cessation,’

original: 'di ltar lam bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar lam bsgom par bya'o //
translated: ‘The path should be cultivated,’

original: 'dis lam bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dis lam bsgom par bya'o //
translated: This is the path to be cultivated.

original: 'di ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'o //
translated: This is defilement.

original: 'di ni rnam par byang ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni rnam par byang ba'o //
translated: This is purification.

original: chos 'di dag ni bsten par bya ba'o //
analyzed: chos 'di dag ni bsten par bya ba'o //
translated: These are the dharmas to be relied upon.

original: chos 'di dag ni bsten par mi bya ba'o //
analyzed: chos 'di dag ni bsten par mi bya ba'o //
translated: These are the dharmas not to be relied upon.

original: 'di la ni byang chub sems dpas spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di la ni byang chub sems dpas spyad par bya'o //
translated: Here the bodhisattva should practice.

original: 'di la ni spyad par mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'di la ni spyad par mi bya'o //
translated: Here he should not practice.

original: 'di ni @106b byang chub sems dpa'i lam mo //
analyzed: 'di ni @106b byang chub sems dpa'i lam mo //
translated: This is the bodhisattva path.

original: 'di ni lam ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni lam ma yin no //
translated: This is not the path.

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa'o //
translated: This is the bodhisattva training.

original: 'di ni bslab pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni bslab pa ma yin no //
translated: This is not the training.

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: This is the bodhisattva perfection of generosity.

original: 'di ni tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: This is the perfection of morality, patience, perseverance, concentration, and wisdom.

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang; brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang; brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma yin no //
translated: This is not the perfection of generosity, morality, patience, diligence, concentration, or wisdom of a bodhisattva.

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i thabs la mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i thabs la mkhas pa'o //
translated: This is the skill in means of a bodhisattva.

original: 'di ni thabs la mkhas pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni thabs la mkhas pa ma yin no //
translated: This is not skill in means.

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa'o //🔽'di ni skyon no zhes bya bar chos de dag la mngon par zhen cing gnas te kun tu shas  na /
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa'o // 'di ni skyon no zhes bya bar chos de dag la mngon par zhen cing gnas te kun tu shas  na /
translated: This is the faultlessness of a bodhisattva.🔽This is a fault.’

original: de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i mthun pa'i chos la sred pa ste skyon no //
analyzed: de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i mthun pa'i chos la sred pa ste skyon no //
translated: “Śāriputra, this is the fault of bodhisattva great beings who crave for the Dharma that is in accord with the Dharma.

original: sh'a ri'i bus smras pa /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bus smras pa /
translated: Śāriputra said,

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor /
translated: “Venerable Subhūti,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i skyon med pa gang yin /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i skyon med pa gang yin /
translated: what is the faultlessness of bodhisattva great beings?”

original: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
translated: Subhūti said,

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: “Venerable Śāriputra,

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa nang stong pa nyid la phyi stong pa nyid yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa nang stong pa nyid la phyi stong pa nyid yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
translated: Here bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom do not see inner emptiness in outer emptiness,

original: phyi stong pa nyid la nang stong pa nyid yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /🔽phyi nang stong pa nyid la stong pa nyid stong pa nyid yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
analyzed: phyi stong pa nyid la nang stong pa nyid yang dag par rjes su mi mthong / phyi nang stong pa nyid la stong pa nyid stong pa nyid yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
translated: do not see outer emptiness in inner emptiness,🔽do not see emptiness of emptiness in inner and outer emptiness,

original: stong pa nyid stong pa nyid la phyi nang stong pa nyid yang dag par rjes su mi @107a *//🔽mthong / stong pa nyid stong pa nyid la chen po stong pa nyid yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
analyzed: stong pa nyid stong pa nyid la phyi nang stong pa nyid yang dag par rjes su mi @107a *// mthong / stong pa nyid stong pa nyid la chen po stong pa nyid yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
translated: do not see inner and outer emptiness in emptiness of emptiness,🔽do not see emptiness of emptiness in great emptiness,

original: chen po stong pa nyid la stong pa nyid stong pa nyid yang dag par rjes su mi mthong; chen po stong pa nyid la don dam pa stong pa nyid yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
analyzed: chen po stong pa nyid la stong pa nyid stong pa nyid yang dag par rjes su mi mthong; chen po stong pa nyid la don dam pa stong pa nyid yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
translated: do not see great emptiness in emptiness of emptiness, do not see great emptiness in ultimate emptiness,

original: don dam pa stong pa nyid la chen po stong pa nyid yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /🔽don dam pa stong pa nyid la 'dus byas stong pa nyid yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
analyzed: don dam pa stong pa nyid la chen po stong pa nyid yang dag par rjes su mi mthong / don dam pa stong pa nyid la 'dus byas stong pa nyid yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
translated: They do not see the emptiness of the great in the emptiness of the ultimate.🔽They do not see the emptiness of the conditioned in the emptiness of the ultimate.

original: 'dus byas stong pa nyid la don dam pa stong pa nyid yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
analyzed: 'dus byas stong pa nyid la don dam pa stong pa nyid yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
translated: They do not see the emptiness of the ultimate in the emptiness of the conditioned.

original: 'dus byas stong pa nyid la 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /🔽'dus ma byas stong pa nyid la 'dus byas stong pa nyid yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /🔽'dus ma byas stong pa nyid la mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
analyzed: 'dus byas stong pa nyid la 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid yang dag par rjes su mi mthong / 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid la 'dus byas stong pa nyid yang dag par rjes su mi mthong / 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid la mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
translated: They do not see the emptiness of the unconditioned in the emptiness of the conditioned.🔽They do not see the emptiness of the conditioned in the emptiness of the unconditioned.

original: mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid la 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
analyzed: mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid la 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
translated: They do not see the emptiness of what is beyond extremes in the emptiness of the unconditioned.🔽They do not see the emptiness of the unconditioned in the emptiness of what is beyond extremes.

original: mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid la thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /🔽thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid la mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid yang dag par rjes su mi mthong; thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid la dor ba med pa stong pa nyid yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /🔽dor ba med pa stong pa nyid la thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid yang dag par @107b rjes su mi mthong /
analyzed: mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid la thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid yang dag par rjes su mi mthong / thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid la mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid yang dag par rjes su mi mthong; thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid la dor ba med pa stong pa nyid yang dag par rjes su mi mthong / dor ba med pa stong pa nyid la thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid yang dag par @107b rjes su mi mthong /
translated: They do not see the emptiness of beginningless and endless suchness in the emptiness of the extreme of non-apprehension.

original: dor ba med pa stong pa nyid la rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
analyzed: dor ba med pa stong pa nyid la rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
translated: They do not see the emptiness of the extreme of non-apprehension in the emptiness of beginningless and endless suchness.🔽They do not see the emptiness of beginningless and endless suchness
