original: rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid la dor ba med pa stong pa nyid yang dag par rjes su mi mthong; rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid la rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /🔽rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid la rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid yang dag par rjes su mi mthong; rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid la chos thams cad stong pa nyid yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid la dor ba med pa stong pa nyid yang dag par rjes su mi mthong; rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid la rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid yang dag par rjes su mi mthong / rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid la rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid yang dag par rjes su mi mthong; rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid la chos thams cad stong pa nyid yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
translated: They do not see the emptiness of non-rejection in the emptiness of inherent existence.🔽They do not see the emptiness of inherent existence in the emptiness of its own mark.🔽They do not see the emptiness of its own mark in the emptiness of inherent existence.

original: chos thams cad stong pa nyid la rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid yang dag par rjes su mi mthong; chos thams cad stong pa nyid la dngos po med pa stong pa nyid yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
analyzed: chos thams cad stong pa nyid la rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid yang dag par rjes su mi mthong; chos thams cad stong pa nyid la dngos po med pa stong pa nyid yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
translated: They do not see the emptiness of inherent existence in the emptiness of all phenomena.🔽They do not see the emptiness of all phenomena in the emptiness of its own mark.🔽They do not see the emptiness of its own mark in the emptiness of all phenomena.🔽They do not see the emptiness of all phenomena in the emptiness of non-existence.

original: dngos po med pa stong pa nyid la chos thams cad stong pa nyid yang dag par rjes su mi mthong; dngos po med pa stong pa nyid la ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /🔽ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid la dngos po med pa stong pa nyid yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
analyzed: dngos po med pa stong pa nyid la chos thams cad stong pa nyid yang dag par rjes su mi mthong; dngos po med pa stong pa nyid la ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid yang dag par rjes su mi mthong / ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid la dngos po med pa stong pa nyid yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
translated: They do not see the emptiness of own-marks in the emptiness of non-things.🔽They do not see the emptiness of non-things in the emptiness of own-marks.

original: ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid la dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid la dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
translated: They do not see the emptiness of own-marks in the emptiness of the non-existence of own-being.

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid la ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid la ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
translated: They do not see the emptiness of the non-existence of own-being in the emptiness of own-marks.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar spyod na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar spyod na /
translated: when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom like this,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa la 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa la 'jug pa yin no //
translated: they enter into the secure state of a bodhisattva.

original: tshe dang @108a *//
analyzed: tshe dang @108a *//
translated: Venerable Śāriputra,

original: ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar slob pas gzugs shes par bya ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar slob pas gzugs shes par bya ste /
translated: Moreover, Śāriputra, bodhisattva great beings training like that in the perfection of wisdom should know form,

original: des rlom sems su'ang mi bya'o //
analyzed: des rlom sems su'ang mi bya'o //
translated: but they should not make assumptions about it.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa shes par bya ste /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa shes par bya ste /
translated: They should know feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness,

original: des rlom sems su'ang mi bya'o //
analyzed: des rlom sems su'ang mi bya'o //
translated: but they should not make assumptions about them.

original: mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang; lus dang / yid shes par bya ste /
analyzed: mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang; lus dang / yid shes par bya ste /
translated: They should know the eyes, ears, nose, tongue, body, and thinking mind,

original: des rlom sems su'ang mi bya'o //
analyzed: des rlom sems su'ang mi bya'o //
translated: but they should not make assumptions about them.

original: gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya dang / chos rnams shes par bya ste /
analyzed: gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya dang / chos rnams shes par bya ste /
translated: They should know a form, a sound, a smell, a taste, a feeling, and a dharma,

original: des rlom sems su'ang mi bya'o //
analyzed: des rlom sems su'ang mi bya'o //
translated: but they should not make assumptions about them.

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa shes par bya ste /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa shes par bya ste /
translated: They should know the perfection of giving,

original: des rlom sems su'ang mi bya'o //
analyzed: des rlom sems su'ang mi bya'o //
translated: but they should not make assumptions about it.

original: tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa shes par bya ste /
analyzed: tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa shes par bya ste /
translated: “One should know the perfection of generosity, the perfection of moral discipline, the perfection of patient acceptance, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of meditative concentration, and the perfection of wisdom.

original: de dag gis rlom sems su'ang mi bya'o //
analyzed: de dag gis rlom sems su'ang mi bya'o //
translated: But one should not become proud on account of them.🔽“One should know the meditative concentrations, the immeasurable aspirations, and the formless absorptions,

original: bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams shes par bya ste; de dag gis rlom sems su'ang mi bya'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams shes par bya ste; de dag gis rlom sems su'ang mi bya'o //
translated: but one should not become proud on account of them.

original: de bzhin du mngon par shes pa lnga dang / mig lnga dang / dran pa nye bar bzhag pa dang / yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du mngon par shes pa lnga dang / mig lnga dang / dran pa nye bar bzhag pa dang / yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang /
translated: Similarly, one should know the five powers, the five strengths, the seven aspects of enlightenment,

original: lam dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad po dag @108b shes par bya ste /
analyzed: lam dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad po dag @108b shes par bya ste /
translated: the noble eightfold path, the four forms of correct knowledge, the four forms of fearlessness, the four forms of intrepid confidence, and the eighteen distinct qualities of the buddhas.

original: de dag gis rlom sems su'ang mi bya'o //
analyzed: de dag gis rlom sems su'ang mi bya'o //
translated: But one should not become proud on account of them.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: The Venerable Śāriputra

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar spyod pas byang chub kyi sems kyis kyang rlom sems su mi bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar spyod pas byang chub kyi sems kyis kyang rlom sems su mi bya'o //
translated: said to the Lord: “Lord, when bodhisattva great beings thus practice the perfection of wisdom, they should not falsely project the thought of awakening.

original: mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i sems dang / rlabs po che'i sems kyis kyang rlom sems su mi bya'o //
analyzed: mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i sems dang / rlabs po che'i sems kyis kyang rlom sems su mi bya'o //
translated: They should not falsely project the thought of equality, the thought of greatness, or the thought of vastness.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar sems de sems ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar sems de sems ma yin te /
translated: Because that thought is not a thought.

original: sems kyi rang bzhin 'od gsal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems kyi rang bzhin 'od gsal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the nature of thought is clear light.🔽” Śāriputra said,

original: sh'a ri'i bus smras pa /🔽tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bus smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor /
translated: “Venerable Subhūti,

original: sems kyi rang bzhin 'od gsal ba gang yin /
analyzed: sems kyi rang bzhin 'od gsal ba gang yin /
translated: what is the clear light nature of thought?

original: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
translated: ” Subhūti said,

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: “Venerable Śāriputra,🔽a thought that is not conjoined with or disjoined from desire,

original: sems gang 'dod chags dang ldan pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: sems gang 'dod chags dang ldan pa'ang ma yin /
translated: that is not conjoined with or disjoined from anger,

original: bral ba'ang ma yin /
analyzed: bral ba'ang ma yin /
translated: that is not conjoined with or disjoined from ignorance,

original: zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang ldan pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang ldan pa'ang ma yin /
translated: that is not conjoined with or disjoined from the world systems of desire, form, and formlessness,🔽that is not conjoined with or disjoined from the world systems of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas,

original: bral ba'ang ma yin /
analyzed: bral ba'ang ma yin /
translated: that is not conjoined with or disjoined from the world systems of the buddhas,🔽that is not conjoined with or disjoined from the world systems of the bodhisattvas,🔽that is not conjoined with or disjoined from the world systems of the past,🔽that is not conjoined with or disjoined from the world systems of the future,🔽that is not conjoined with or disjoined from the world systems of the present,🔽that is not conjoined with or disjoined from the world systems of the three times,🔽that is not conjoined with or disjoined from the world systems of the uncompounded,🔽that is not conjoined with or disjoined from the world systems of the compounded,🔽that is not conjoined with or disjoined from the world systems of the compounded and the uncompounded,🔽that is not conjoined with or disjoined from the world systems of the compounded and the uncompounded,🔽that is not conjoined with or disjoined from the world systems of the compounded and the uncompounded,🔽that is not conjoined with or disjoined from the world systems of the compounded and the uncompounded,🔽that is not conjoined with or disjoined from the world systems of the compounded and the uncompounded,🔽that is not conjoined with or disjoined from the world systems of the compounded and the uncompounded,

original: kun nas ldang ba rnams dang / sgrib pa rnams dang / bag la nyal ba rnams dang / kun tu sbyor ba rnams dang / lta bar gyur pa rnams dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sems rnams dang ldan pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: kun nas ldang ba rnams dang / sgrib pa rnams dang / bag la nyal ba rnams dang / kun tu sbyor ba rnams dang / lta bar gyur pa rnams dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sems rnams dang ldan pa'ang ma yin /
translated: He is not associated with or dissociated from the mental afflictions, the entanglements, the envelopments, the fetters, the bad actions, the views, the thoughts of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas,🔽and so on up to

original: bral ba'ang ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: bral ba'ang ma yin pa ste /
translated: he is not associated with or dissociated from the knowledge of all modes.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: “Venerable Śāriputra,

original: de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sems kyi rang bzhin 'od gsal ba'o //
analyzed: de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sems kyi rang bzhin 'od gsal ba'o //
translated: this is the purity of the thought of the Bodhisattva, the Great Being.”

original: sh'a ri'i bus smras pa /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bus smras pa /
translated: Śāriputra said,

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor /
translated: “Venerable Subhūti,

original: sems gang la sems ma yin no zhes bya ba'i sems de yod dam /
analyzed: sems gang la sems ma yin no zhes bya ba'i sems de yod dam /
translated: is there a thought in which it is said, ‘This is not thought’?”

original: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
translated: Subhūti replied,

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu ci /🔽gang sems @109a *//
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu ci / gang sems @109a *//
translated: “Venerable Śāriputra,

original: ma yin pa de la yod pa'am med pa dmigs pa'am yod par 'gyur ram /
analyzed: ma yin pa de la yod pa'am med pa dmigs pa'am yod par 'gyur ram /
translated: is there an existent or nonexistent apprehension in that which is not thought, or is there an existent or nonexistent thought?”

original: sh'a ri'i bus smras pa /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bus smras pa /
translated: Śāriputra said,

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor /
translated: “Venerable Subhūti,

original: de ni med do //
analyzed: de ni med do //
translated: there is not.”

original: rab 'byor gyis smras pa; tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu gal te sems ma yin pa de la yod pa'am med pa med cing mi dmigs na /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis smras pa; tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu gal te sems ma yin pa de la yod pa'am med pa med cing mi dmigs na /
translated: Subhūti replied, “Venerable Śāriputra, if that which is not mind does not exist, is not found, and is not apprehended,

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu khyod kyis 'di skad smras te /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu khyod kyis 'di skad smras te /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra, is it appropriate for you to say,

original: sems gang la sems ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i sems de yod dam zhes brgal zhing brtag pa 'di ji ga rigs sam /
analyzed: sems gang la sems ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i sems de yod dam zhes brgal zhing brtag pa 'di ji ga rigs sam /
translated: ‘Is there a mind that is called not mind?’”

original: sh'a ri'i bus smras pa /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bus smras pa /
translated: Śāriputra asked,

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor sems ma yin pa de gang yin /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor sems ma yin pa de gang yin /
translated: “Venerable Subhūti, what is not mind?”

original: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
translated: Subhūti replied,

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: “Venerable Śāriputra,

original: sems ma yin pa ni 'gyur ba med cing rnam par mi rtog pa ste /
analyzed: sems ma yin pa ni 'gyur ba med cing rnam par mi rtog pa ste /
translated: that which is not mind is unchanging and nonconceptual.

original: de ni chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid de /
analyzed: de ni chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid de /
translated: It is the suchness of all phenomena.

original: 'di ni sems ma yin pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sems ma yin pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the inconceivable not mind.

original: sh'a ri'i bus smras pa /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bus smras pa /
translated: ” Śāriputra said,

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor /
translated: “Venerable Subhūti,

original: ji ltar sems 'gyur ba med cing rnam par rtog pa med pa de bzhin du gzugs kyang 'gyur ba med cing rnam par rtog pa med pa yin nam /🔽de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'ang 'gyur ba med cing rnam par rtog pa med pa yin nam /🔽ji ltar sems 'gyur ba med cing rnam par rtog pa med pa de bzhin du mig gi khams dang / gzugs kyi khams dang / mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams kyang 'gyur ba med cing rnam par rtog pa med dam /
analyzed: ji ltar sems 'gyur ba med cing rnam par rtog pa med pa de bzhin du gzugs kyang 'gyur ba med cing rnam par rtog pa med pa yin nam / de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'ang 'gyur ba med cing rnam par rtog pa med pa yin nam / ji ltar sems 'gyur ba med cing rnam par rtog pa med pa de bzhin du mig gi khams dang / gzugs kyi khams dang / mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams kyang 'gyur ba med cing rnam par rtog pa med dam /
translated: Are form, feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness also unchanging and nonconceptual in the same way that mind is unchanging and nonconceptual?🔽Are the eye constituent, form constituent, and eye-consciousness constituent unchanging and nonconceptual in the same way that mind is unchanging and nonconceptual?

original: de bzhin du rna ba'i khams dang / @109b sna'i khams dang / lce'i khams dang / lus kyi khams dang / yid kyi khams dang / chos kyi khams dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams kyang 'gyur ba med cing rnam par rtog pa med dam /
analyzed: de bzhin du rna ba'i khams dang / @109b sna'i khams dang / lce'i khams dang / lus kyi khams dang / yid kyi khams dang / chos kyi khams dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams kyang 'gyur ba med cing rnam par rtog pa med dam /
translated: Are the ear constituent, nose constituent, tongue constituent, body constituent, and thinking-mind constituent, the dharma constituent, and the ear-, nose-, tongue-, and body-consciousness constituents, and the thinking-mind consciousness constituent unchanging and nonconceptual in the same way that mind is unchanging and nonconceptual?

original: de bzhin du skye mched rnams dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba dang / pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang / mngon par shes pa rnams dang / dran pa nye bar bzhag pa dang / yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du skye mched rnams dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba dang / pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang / mngon par shes pa rnams dang / dran pa nye bar bzhag pa dang / yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang /
translated: Similarly, are the sense fields, dependent origination, perfections, higher knowledges, applications of mindfulness, right efforts, legs of miraculous power,

original: dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / lam dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / stobs dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyang 'gyur ba med cing rnam par rtog pa med pa yin nam /
analyzed: dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / lam dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / stobs dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyang 'gyur ba med cing rnam par rtog pa med pa yin nam /
translated: faculties, powers, branches of enlightenment, path, fearlessnesses, detailed and thorough knowledges, strengths, eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha, and unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening also unchanging and nonconceptual?”

original: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
translated: Subhūti replied,

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu; de de bzhin te /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu; de de bzhin te /
translated: “Venerable Śāriputra, it is so.

original: ji ltar sems 'gyur ba med cing rnam par rtog pa med pa de bzhin du phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang / pha rol tu phyin pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams dang /
analyzed: ji ltar sems 'gyur ba med cing rnam par rtog pa med pa de bzhin du phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang / pha rol tu phyin pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams dang /
translated: Just as the mind is unchanging and nonconceptual, so too are the aggregates, elements, sense fields, dependent origination, perfections, superknowledges, factors of awakening,

original: stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar yang 'gyur ba med cing rnam par rtog pa med do //
analyzed: stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar yang 'gyur ba med cing rnam par rtog pa med do //
translated: powers, fearlessnesses, unique qualities of a buddha, up to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: sh'a ri'i bus smras pa /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bus smras pa /
translated: Śāriputra said,

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor /
translated: “Venerable Subhūti,

original: legs so // legs so //
analyzed: legs so // legs so //
translated: excellent, excellent!

original: 'di lta ste /🔽khyod ni bcom @110a *//
analyzed: 'di lta ste / khyod ni bcom @110a *//
translated: It is so,

original: ldan 'das kyi sras /
analyzed: ldan 'das kyi sras /
translated: you are the Blessed One’s son,

original: thugs las skyes pa /
analyzed: thugs las skyes pa /
translated: born from his heart,

original: zhal nas skyes pa /🔽chos las skyes pa /🔽chos kyis sprul pa /
analyzed: zhal nas skyes pa / chos las skyes pa / chos kyis sprul pa /
translated: born from his mouth,🔽born from the Dharma,🔽created by the Dharma,

original: chos kyi bgo skal la spyod pa /
analyzed: chos kyi bgo skal la spyod pa /
translated: enjoying the Dharma’s inheritance.

original: zang zing gi bgo skal la spyod pa ma yin pa /
analyzed: zang zing gi bgo skal la spyod pa ma yin pa /
translated: He does not enjoy the share of material things.

original: chos rnams la mngon sum gyi mig dang ldan pa /
analyzed: chos rnams la mngon sum gyi mig dang ldan pa /
translated: He has the eye of direct knowledge of phenomena.

original: lus mngon sum du gyur pa ste /
analyzed: lus mngon sum du gyur pa ste /
translated: He has a body that is manifest.

original: nyan thos nyon mongs pa med par gnas pa rnams kyi mchog tu bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs te /
analyzed: nyan thos nyon mongs pa med par gnas pa rnams kyi mchog tu bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs te /
translated: The Blessed One has declared him to be the foremost of the hearers who dwell without afflictions.

original: bstan pa 'di'ang de'i tshul dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: bstan pa 'di'ang de'i tshul dang 'dra'o //
translated: This teaching is also in accord with that.

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar bslab par bya'o //
translated: The bodhisattva mahāsattva should train in the perfection of wisdom in that way.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po phyir mi ldog pa'ang 'di las yongs su shes par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po phyir mi ldog pa'ang 'di las yongs su shes par bya'o //
translated: The irreversible bodhisattva mahāsattva should be known from this.

original: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ma bral bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ma bral bar shes par bya'o //
translated: Thus should the bodhisattva mahāsattva be known as inseparable from the perfection of wisdom.

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor /
translated: Venerable Subhūti,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po nyan thos kyi sa la slob par 'dod pas kyang bsgrims te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po nyan thos kyi sa la slob par 'dod pas kyang bsgrims te /
translated: The bodhisattva mahāsattva who wishes to train in the stage of the śrāvakas should also be diligent.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid mnyan par bya /🔽gzung bar bya /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid mnyan par bya / gzung bar bya /
translated: “Moreover, Kauśika, if bodhisattva great beings wish to train in the level of the śrāvakas, they should listen to this perfection of wisdom,

original: bcang bar bya /🔽bklag par bya /
analyzed: bcang bar bya / bklag par bya /
translated: they should take it up,🔽they should bear it in mind,🔽they should read it aloud,

original: kun chub par bya /
analyzed: kun chub par bya /
translated: they should master it,

original: tshul bzhin du yid la bya'o //🔽byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rang sangs rgyas kyi sa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sa dang / sangs rgyas kyi sa la slob par 'dod pas kyang @110b bsgrims te /
analyzed: tshul bzhin du yid la bya'o // byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rang sangs rgyas kyi sa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sa dang / sangs rgyas kyi sa la slob par 'dod pas kyang @110b bsgrims te /
translated: and they should properly pay attention to it.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid mnyan par bya /🔽gzung bar bya /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid mnyan par bya / gzung bar bya /
translated: If bodhisattva great beings wish to train in the level of the pratyekabuddhas, the bodhisattva level, and the buddha level, they should listen to this perfection of wisdom,

original: bcang bar bya /🔽bklag par bya /
analyzed: bcang bar bya / bklag par bya /
translated: they should take it up,🔽they should bear it in mind,🔽they should read it aloud,

original: kun chub par bya /
analyzed: kun chub par bya /
translated: they should master it,

original: tshul bzhin du yid la bya'o //
analyzed: tshul bzhin du yid la bya'o //
translated: and they should properly pay attention to it.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyis nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / sangs rgyas kyi sa gang dag la bslab par bya ba'i theg pa gsum po dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di las rgya cher bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyis nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / sangs rgyas kyi sa gang dag la bslab par bya ba'i theg pa gsum po dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di las rgya cher bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because in this perfection of wisdom the three vehicles are revealed in detail, i.e. the vehicle of the Disciples, the vehicle of the Bodhisattvas, and the vehicle of the Tathagatas, in which the Bodhisattvas, the great beings, should train.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khri brgyad stong pa las /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khri brgyad stong pa las /
translated: In the Perfection of Wisdom in Eighteen Thousand Lines,

original: skyon med pa la 'jug pa'i le'u zhes bya ste bdun pa'o ////🔽de nas bcom ldan 'das la /
analyzed: skyon med pa la 'jug pa'i le'u zhes bya ste bdun pa'o //// de nas bcom ldan 'das la /
translated: the seventh chapter, called “Entering into the Absence of Error.”🔽Then the venerable Subhuti

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: said to the Lord:

original: bcom ldan 'das /🔽bdag gis byang chub sems dpa' dang; shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma 'tshal /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das / bdag gis byang chub sems dpa' dang; shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma 'tshal /
translated: “Lord,🔽I do not see the Bodhisattva,

original: ma dmigs / yang dag par rjes su ma mthong na /
analyzed: ma dmigs / yang dag par rjes su ma mthong na /
translated: do not apprehend him, do not find him, do not review him.

original: byang chub sems dpa' gang zhig shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang la gdams shing rjes su bstan par bgyi /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gang zhig shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang la gdams shing rjes su bstan par bgyi /
translated: “Bhagavān, what bodhisattva should I instruct and teach in what prajñāpāramitā?

original: bcom ldan 'das /🔽bdag gis dngos po ma 'tshal /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das / bdag gis dngos po ma 'tshal /
translated: Bhagavān,

original: ma dmigs / yang dag par rjes su ma mthong ste /
analyzed: ma dmigs / yang dag par rjes su ma mthong ste /
translated: I do not see, do not observe, and do not apprehend any thing.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Bhagavān,

original: bdag gis dngos po ma 'tshal /
analyzed: bdag gis dngos po ma 'tshal /
translated: I do not see, do not observe, and do not apprehend any thing.

original: ma dmigs / yang dag par rjes su ma mthong bzhin du chos gang gis chos gang la gdams shing rjes su bstan par bgyi ste /
analyzed: ma dmigs / yang dag par rjes su ma mthong bzhin du chos gang gis chos gang la gdams shing rjes su bstan par bgyi ste /
translated: Bhagavān, if I do not see, do not observe, and do not apprehend any thing, then by what Dharma should I instruct and teach in what Dharma?

original: 'di nyid bdag gi 'gyod par 'gyur lags so //
analyzed: 'di nyid bdag gi 'gyod par 'gyur lags so //
translated: That would be a regret for me.

analyzed: bcom ldan @111a *// 'das 'di ltar bdag gis chos thams cad ma 'tshal /
translated: Bhagavān,

analyzed: ma dmigs / yang dag par rjes su ma mthong na / byang chub sems dpa' zhes bgyi ba'am /

analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bgyi ba'i ming tsam gyis ji ltar 'phel ba dang 'grib par bgyi ste /

original: 'di nyid bdag gi 'gyod par 'gyur lags so //
analyzed: 'di nyid bdag gi 'gyod par 'gyur lags so //

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' zhes gang la ming du gdags par bgyi / bcom ldan 'das rnam grangs des ming de'ang gnas pa ma mchis /

analyzed: thug pa ma mchis pa lags so //

analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /

original: ming de ma mchis pas /
analyzed: ming de ma mchis pas /

analyzed: de ltar na ming de gnas pa ma mchis /

analyzed: thug pa ma mchis pa lags so //

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

analyzed: bdag gis mig gi 'phel ba dang 'grib pa ma dmigs yang dag par rjes su ma mthong /

analyzed: bdag gis rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi 'phel ba dang 'grib pa ma dmigs yang dag par rjes su ma mthong /

translated: Blessed One, the names of form, feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness, and the names of the eyes, ears, nose, tongue, body, and mind are not established.

original: thug pa ma mchis pa lags so //
analyzed: thug pa ma mchis pa lags so //

original: thug pa ma mchis pa lags so //
analyzed: thug pa ma mchis pa lags so //

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das; bdag gis mig gi rnam par shes pa'i 'phel ba dang 'grib pa ma dmigs yang dag par rjes su ma mthong /

translated: I do not apprehend or see any increase or decrease in the mindfulness of the Buddha, the mindfulness of the Dharma, the mindfulness of the Saṅgha, the mindfulness of morality, the mindfulness of giving, the mindfulness of the deities, the mindfulness of the body, the mindfulness of breathing, the mindfulness of the peace of passing into nirvāṇa, and the mindfulness of the body as a repulsiveness.

translated: I do not apprehend or see the increase or decrease of the recollection of the Buddha, the recollection of the Dharma, the recollection of the Saṅgha, the recollection of morality, the recollection of the deity, the recollection of the inhalation and exhalation of breath, or the recollection of death.

translated: I do not apprehend or see the increase or decrease of the five eyes, the six superknowledges, the ten powers, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, or the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: ming de ma mchis pas /🔽de ltar na ming de gnas pa ma mchis /
analyzed: ming de ma mchis pas / de ltar na ming de gnas pa ma mchis /
translated: Because that name does not exist.

original: thug pa ma mchis pa lags so //
analyzed: thug pa ma mchis pa lags so //
translated: In that way, that name has no location and no end.

original: @116b bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: @116b bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: gal te byang chub sems dpa' la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa brjod pa'i tshe /🔽sems zhum par mi 'gyur /🔽kun tu zhum par mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: gal te byang chub sems dpa' la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa brjod pa'i tshe / sems zhum par mi 'gyur / kun tu zhum par mi 'gyur la /
translated: if the perfection of wisdom is being taught to a bodhisattva,🔽their mind will not become timid,🔽it will not become completely timid,

original: 'gyod par mi 'gyur zhing; mi skrag /
analyzed: 'gyod par mi 'gyur zhing; mi skrag /
translated: and they will not be remorseful, afraid,

original: mi dngang la /
analyzed: mi dngang la /
translated: not be afraid,

original: dngang bar mi 'gyur na /
analyzed: dngang bar mi 'gyur na /
translated: and not be terrified,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni phyir mi ldog pa'i sa la mi gnas pa'i tshul gyis gnas nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du nges par 'byung bar rig par bgyi'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni phyir mi ldog pa'i sa la mi gnas pa'i tshul gyis gnas nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du nges par 'byung bar rig par bgyi'o //
translated: then one should know that this bodhisattva great being, standing on the irreversible level, will go forth to the knowledge of all aspects.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas gzugs la gnas par mi bgyi'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas gzugs la gnas par mi bgyi'o //
translated: further, bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom should not stand in form,

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa la gnas par mi bgyi'o //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa la gnas par mi bgyi'o //
translated: should not stand in feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness,

original: des mig la gnas par mi bgyi'o //
analyzed: des mig la gnas par mi bgyi'o //
translated: should not stand in the eyes,

original: rna ba dang; sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid la gnas par mi bgyi'o //
analyzed: rna ba dang; sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid la gnas par mi bgyi'o //
translated: should not stand in the ears, nose, tongue, body, or mind,

original: des gzugs la gnas par mi bgyi'o //
analyzed: des gzugs la gnas par mi bgyi'o //
translated: should not stand in a form,

original: sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya dang / chos la gnas par mi bgyi'o //
analyzed: sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya dang / chos la gnas par mi bgyi'o //
translated: should not stand in a sound, a smell, a taste, a feeling, or a dharma,

original: des mig gi rnam par shes pa la gnas par mi bgyi'o //
analyzed: des mig gi rnam par shes pa la gnas par mi bgyi'o //
translated: He should not settle down on the eye consciousness.

original: rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa la gnas par mi bgyi'o //
analyzed: rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa la gnas par mi bgyi'o //
translated: He should not settle down on the ear, nose, tongue, body, or mind consciousnesses.

original: des mig gi 'dus te reg pa la gnas par mi bgyi'o //
analyzed: des mig gi 'dus te reg pa la gnas par mi bgyi'o //
translated: He should not settle down on eye contact.

original: mig gi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba la gnas par mi bgyi'o //
analyzed: mig gi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba la gnas par mi bgyi'o //
translated: He should not settle down on the feeling that arises from the condition of eye contact.

original: rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa la gnas par @117a *//
analyzed: rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa la gnas par @117a *//
translated: He should not settle down on ear, nose, tongue, body, or mind contact.

original: mi bgyi'o // yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba la gnas par mi bgyi'o //
analyzed: mi bgyi'o // yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba la gnas par mi bgyi'o //
translated: He should not settle down on the feeling that arises from the condition of mind contact.

original: des sa'i khams la gnas par mi bgyi'o //
analyzed: des sa'i khams la gnas par mi bgyi'o //
translated: He should not settle down on the earth element.

original: chu'i khams dang / me'i khams dang / rlung gi khams dang / nam mkha'i khams dang / rnam par shes pa'i khams la gnas par mi bgyi'o //
analyzed: chu'i khams dang / me'i khams dang / rlung gi khams dang / nam mkha'i khams dang / rnam par shes pa'i khams la gnas par mi bgyi'o //
translated: He should not settle down on the water element, the fire element, the wind element, the space element, or the consciousness element.

original: des ma rig pa la gnas par mi bgyi'o //
analyzed: des ma rig pa la gnas par mi bgyi'o //
translated: He should not settle down on ignorance.

original: 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa dang / ming dang gzugs dang / skye mched drug dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba dang / sred pa dang / len pa dang / srid pa dang / skye ba dang / rga shi la gnas par mi bgyi'o //
analyzed: 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa dang / ming dang gzugs dang / skye mched drug dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba dang / sred pa dang / len pa dang / srid pa dang / skye ba dang / rga shi la gnas par mi bgyi'o //
translated: I will not stand in volitional factors, consciousness, name and form, the six sense sources, contact, feeling, craving, grasping, existence, birth, or old age and death.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: 'di ltar gzugs ni gzugs kyis stong zhing /
analyzed: 'di ltar gzugs ni gzugs kyis stong zhing /
translated: it is because form is empty of form,

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa ni rnam par shes pas stong pa'i slad du'o //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa ni rnam par shes pas stong pa'i slad du'o //
translated: and feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are empty of consciousness.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: gzugs kyi stong pa nyid gang lags pa de gzugs ma lags la /🔽gzugs las gud na'ang stong pa nyid ma mchis te /
analyzed: gzugs kyi stong pa nyid gang lags pa de gzugs ma lags la / gzugs las gud na'ang stong pa nyid ma mchis te /
translated: the emptiness of form is not form,🔽and emptiness is not apart from form.

original: gzugs nyid kyang stong pa nyid lags /
analyzed: gzugs nyid kyang stong pa nyid lags /
translated: Form itself is emptiness,

original: stong pa nyid kyang gzugs lags so //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyang gzugs lags so //
translated: and emptiness itself is form.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: tshor ba'i stong pa nyid gang lags pa de tshor ba ma lags la /
analyzed: tshor ba'i stong pa nyid gang lags pa de tshor ba ma lags la /
translated: the emptiness of feeling is not feeling,🔽and emptiness is not apart from feeling.

original: tshor ba las gud na'ang stong pa nyid ma mchis te /🔽tshor ba nyid kyang stong pa nyid lags /
analyzed: tshor ba las gud na'ang stong pa nyid ma mchis te / tshor ba nyid kyang stong pa nyid lags /
translated: emptiness is not other than feeling.🔽Feeling itself is emptiness.

original: stong pa nyid kyang tshor ba lags so //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyang tshor ba lags so //
translated: Emptiness itself is feeling.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: 'du shes kyi stong pa nyid gang lags pa de 'du shes ma lags la /
analyzed: 'du shes kyi stong pa nyid gang lags pa de 'du shes ma lags la /
translated: the emptiness of perception is not perception.

original: 'du @117b shes las gud na'ang stong pa nyid ma mchis te /🔽'du shes nyid kyang stong pa nyid lags /
analyzed: 'du @117b shes las gud na'ang stong pa nyid ma mchis te / 'du shes nyid kyang stong pa nyid lags /
translated: Emptiness is not other than perception.🔽Perception itself is emptiness.

original: stong pa nyid kyang 'du shes lags so //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyang 'du shes lags so //
translated: Emptiness itself is perception.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: 'du byed rnams kyi stong pa nyid gang lags pa de 'du byed rnams ma lags la /
analyzed: 'du byed rnams kyi stong pa nyid gang lags pa de 'du byed rnams ma lags la /
translated: the emptiness of volitional factors is not volitional factors.

original: 'du byed rnams las gud na'ang stong pa nyid ma mchis te /🔽'du byed rnams nyid kyang stong pa nyid lags /
analyzed: 'du byed rnams las gud na'ang stong pa nyid ma mchis te / 'du byed rnams nyid kyang stong pa nyid lags /
translated: Emptiness is not other than volitional factors.🔽Volitional factors themselves are emptiness.

original: stong pa nyid kyang 'du byed rnams lags so //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyang 'du byed rnams lags so //
translated: Emptiness itself is volitional factors.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: rnam par shes pa'i stong pa nyid gang lags pa de rnam par shes pa ma lags la /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i stong pa nyid gang lags pa de rnam par shes pa ma lags la /
translated: the emptiness of consciousness is not consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa las gud na'ang stong pa nyid ma mchis te /🔽rnam par shes pa nyid kyang stong pa nyid lags /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa las gud na'ang stong pa nyid ma mchis te / rnam par shes pa nyid kyang stong pa nyid lags /
translated: emptiness is not other than consciousness.🔽Consciousness itself is emptiness.

original: stong pa nyid kyang rnam par shes pa lags so //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyang rnam par shes pa lags so //
translated: Emptiness itself is consciousness.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: rnam grangs des na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas gzugs la gnas par mi bgyi'o //
analyzed: rnam grangs des na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas gzugs la gnas par mi bgyi'o //
translated: for these reasons, bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom should not settle on form.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa la gnas par mi bgyi'o //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa la gnas par mi bgyi'o //
translated: They should not settle on feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness.

original: khams dang / skye mched rnams la'ang de bzhin du sbyar ro //🔽sa'i khams ni sa'i khams kyis stong ste /
analyzed: khams dang / skye mched rnams la'ang de bzhin du sbyar ro // sa'i khams ni sa'i khams kyis stong ste /
translated: The same goes for the constituents and sense fields.🔽The earth element is empty of the earth element.

original: sa'i khams kyi stong pa nyid gang lags pa de sa'i khams ma lags la /
analyzed: sa'i khams kyi stong pa nyid gang lags pa de sa'i khams ma lags la /
translated: The emptiness of the earth element is not the earth element.

original: sa'i khams las gud na'ang stong pa nyid ma mchis te /
analyzed: sa'i khams las gud na'ang stong pa nyid ma mchis te /
translated: Emptiness is not other than the earth element.

original: sa'i khams nyid kyang stong pa nyid lags /
analyzed: sa'i khams nyid kyang stong pa nyid lags /
translated: The earth element itself is emptiness.

original: stong pa nyid kyang sa'i khams lags so //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyang sa'i khams lags so //
translated: Emptiness is the earth element.

original: chu'i khams dang / me'i khams dang / rlung gi khams dang / @118a *//
analyzed: chu'i khams dang / me'i khams dang / rlung gi khams dang / @118a *//
translated: The water element, the fire element, the wind element,

original: nam mkha'i khams dang / rnam par shes pa'i khams ni rnam par shes pa'i khams kyis stong ste /
analyzed: nam mkha'i khams dang / rnam par shes pa'i khams ni rnam par shes pa'i khams kyis stong ste /
translated: the space element, and the consciousness element are empty of the consciousness element.

original: rnam par shes pa'i khams kyi stong pa nyid gang lags pa de rnam par shes pa'i khams ma lags la /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i khams kyi stong pa nyid gang lags pa de rnam par shes pa'i khams ma lags la /
translated: The emptiness of the consciousness element is not the consciousness element,

original: rnam par shes pa'i khams las gud na'ang stong pa nyid ma mchis te /🔽rnam par shes pa'i khams nyid kyang stong pa nyid lags /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i khams las gud na'ang stong pa nyid ma mchis te / rnam par shes pa'i khams nyid kyang stong pa nyid lags /
translated: and emptiness is not apart from the consciousness element.🔽The consciousness element itself is emptiness,

original: stong pa nyid kyang rnam par shes pa'i khams lags so //🔽ma rig pa ni ma rig pas stong ste /
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyang rnam par shes pa'i khams lags so // ma rig pa ni ma rig pas stong ste /
translated: and emptiness itself is the consciousness element.🔽Ignorance is empty of ignorance.

original: ma rig pa'i stong pa nyid gang lags pa de ma rig pa ma lags la /🔽ma rig pa las gud na'ang stong pa nyid ma mchis te /
analyzed: ma rig pa'i stong pa nyid gang lags pa de ma rig pa ma lags la / ma rig pa las gud na'ang stong pa nyid ma mchis te /
translated: The emptiness of ignorance is not ignorance,🔽and emptiness is not apart from ignorance.

original: ma rig pa nyid kyang stong pa nyid lags /
analyzed: ma rig pa nyid kyang stong pa nyid lags /
translated: Ignorance itself is emptiness,🔽and emptiness itself is ignorance.

original: stong pa nyid kyang ma rig pa lags so //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyang ma rig pa lags so //
translated: Emptiness is ignorance.

original: 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa dang / ming dang gzugs dang / skye mched drug dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba dang / sred pa dang / len pa dang / srid pa dang / skye ba dang / rga shi ni rga shis stong ste /
analyzed: 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa dang / ming dang gzugs dang / skye mched drug dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba dang / sred pa dang / len pa dang / srid pa dang / skye ba dang / rga shi ni rga shis stong ste /
translated: Conditioned action, consciousness, name and form, the six sense spheres, contact, feeling, craving, grasping, becoming, birth, and old age and death are empty of old age and death.

original: rga shi'i stong pa nyid gang lags pa de rga shi ma lags la /
analyzed: rga shi'i stong pa nyid gang lags pa de rga shi ma lags la /
translated: The emptiness of old age and death is not old age and death.

original: rga shi las gud na'ang stong pa nyid ma mchis te /🔽rga shi nyid kyang stong pa nyid lags /
analyzed: rga shi las gud na'ang stong pa nyid ma mchis te / rga shi nyid kyang stong pa nyid lags /
translated: Emptiness is not apart from old age and death.🔽Old age and death is emptiness.

original: stong pa nyid kyang rga shi lags so //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyang rga shi lags so //
translated: Emptiness is old age and death.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: rnam grangs des na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas ma rig pa dang / rga shi'i bar la gnas par mi bgyi'o //
analyzed: rnam grangs des na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas ma rig pa dang / rga shi'i bar la gnas par mi bgyi'o //
translated: for these reasons, bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom should not dwell on ignorance, up to old age and death.

original: bcom ldan @118b 'das; gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams la gnas par mi bgyi'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan @118b 'das; gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams la gnas par mi bgyi'o //
translated: “Moreover, Blessed One, bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom should not stand in the applications of mindfulness.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: 'di ltar dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams ni dran pa nye bar bzhag pas stong ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams ni dran pa nye bar bzhag pas stong ste /
translated: it is because the applications of mindfulness are empty of the applications of mindfulness.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams kyi stong pa nyid gang lags pa de dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams ma lags la /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams kyi stong pa nyid gang lags pa de dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams ma lags la /
translated: the emptiness of the applications of mindfulness is not the applications of mindfulness.

original: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams las gud na'ang stong pa nyid ma mchis te /🔽dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams nyid kyang stong ba nyid lags /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams las gud na'ang stong pa nyid ma mchis te / dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams nyid kyang stong ba nyid lags /
translated: Apart from the applications of mindfulness, there is no emptiness.🔽The applications of mindfulness themselves are emptiness.

original: stong pa nyid kyang dran ba nye bar bzhag pa rnams lags pa'i slad du'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyang dran ba nye bar bzhag pa rnams lags pa'i slad du'o //
translated: Emptiness itself is the applications of mindfulness.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: rnam grangs des na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams la gnas par mi bgyi'o //
analyzed: rnam grangs des na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams la gnas par mi bgyi'o //
translated: For this reason, Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom should not stand in the applications of mindfulness.

original: de bzhin du yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / lam dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / lam dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang /
translated: Similarly, they should not stand in the right efforts, legs of miraculous power, faculties, powers, limbs of awakening, path, noble truths, concentrations, immeasurables,

original: gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma mchis pa dang / smon pa ma mchis pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang /
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma mchis pa dang / smon pa ma mchis pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang /
translated: formless absorptions, eight deliverances, nine serial absorptions, emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness, clairvoyances,

original: stobs bcu dang / mi @119a *//
analyzed: stobs bcu dang / mi @119a *//
translated: ten powers,

original: 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams la gnas par mi bgyi'o //🔽de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams la gnas par mi bgyi'o // de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: they should not stand in the ten powers of a tathāgata, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, great love, great compassion, or the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: 'di ltar sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa ni sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pas stong ste /🔽sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams kyi stong pa nyid gang lags pa de sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams ma lags la /
analyzed: 'di ltar sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa ni sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pas stong ste / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams kyi stong pa nyid gang lags pa de sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams ma lags la /
translated: If you ask why, it is because the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha are empty of the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.🔽The emptiness of the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha is not the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams las gud na'ang stong pa nyid ma mchis te /🔽sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams nyid kyang stong pa nyid lags /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams las gud na'ang stong pa nyid ma mchis te / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams nyid kyang stong pa nyid lags /
translated: Apart from the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha, there is no emptiness.🔽The eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha themselves are emptiness.

original: stong pa nyid kyang sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams lags pa'i slad du'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyang sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams lags pa'i slad du'o //
translated: Emptiness itself is the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: rnam grangs des na /
analyzed: rnam grangs des na /

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams la gnas par mi bgyi'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams la gnas par mi bgyi'o //
translated: “Lord, bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom should not stand in the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Lord,

original: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas par mi bgyi'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas par mi bgyi'o //
translated: bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom should not stand in the perfection of giving.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is it so?

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Lord,

original: 'di ltar sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni /
analyzed: 'di ltar sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni /
translated: it is because the perfection of giving

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pas stong ste /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pas stong ste /
translated: is empty of the perfection of giving.

original: bcom ldan 'das sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i stong pa nyid gang lags bde sbyin pa'i @119b pha rol tu phyin pa ma lags la /🔽sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa las gud na'ang stong pa nyid ma mchis te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i stong pa nyid gang lags bde sbyin pa'i @119b pha rol tu phyin pa ma lags la / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa las gud na'ang stong pa nyid ma mchis te /
translated: Lord, the emptiness of the perfection of giving is not the perfection of giving,🔽and emptiness is not other than the perfection of giving.

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa nyid kyang stong pa nyid lags /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa nyid kyang stong pa nyid lags /
translated: The perfection of giving itself is emptiness,🔽and emptiness itself is the perfection of giving.

original: stong pa nyid kyang sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa lags pa'i slad du'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyang sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa lags pa'i slad du'o //
translated: because emptiness is the perfection of generosity.

original: de bzhin du tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas par mi bgyi'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas par mi bgyi'o //
translated: Similarly, they should not stand in the perfection of morality, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of concentration, or the perfection of wisdom.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: If you ask why,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni /
analyzed: 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni /
translated: it is because the perfection of wisdom

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas stong ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas stong ste /
translated: is empty of the perfection of wisdom.

original: bcom ldan 'das /🔽shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i stong pa nyid gang lags pa de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma lags la /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i stong pa nyid gang lags pa de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma lags la /
translated: Blessed One,🔽the emptiness of the perfection of wisdom is not the perfection of wisdom,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las gud na'ang stong pa nyid ma mchis te /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las gud na'ang stong pa nyid ma mchis te /
translated: and emptiness is not other than the perfection of wisdom.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid kyang stong pa nyid lags /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid kyang stong pa nyid lags /
translated: The perfection of wisdom itself is emptiness.

original: stong pa nyid kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa lags pa'i slad du'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa lags pa'i slad du'o //
translated: Emptiness itself is the perfection of wisdom.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: rnam grangs des na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas /
analyzed: rnam grangs des na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas /
translated: for this reason, bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas par mi bgyi'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas par mi bgyi'o //
translated: should not stand in the perfection of wisdom.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas yi ge rnams la gnas par mi bgyi'o //🔽yi ge mngon par bsgrub pa rnams @120a *//
analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas yi ge rnams la gnas par mi bgyi'o // yi ge mngon par bsgrub pa rnams @120a *//
translated: further, bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom should not stand in the letters,

original: la gnas par mi bgyi'o //
analyzed: la gnas par mi bgyi'o //
translated: should not stand in the accomplishment of the letters,

original: gcig brjod pa dang / gnyis brjod pa dang / tha dad pa brjod ba la gnas par mi bgyi'o //
analyzed: gcig brjod pa dang / gnyis brjod pa dang / tha dad pa brjod ba la gnas par mi bgyi'o //
translated: should not stand in the expression of one, the expression of two, or the expression of many.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: 'di ltar yi ge rnams ni yi ge rnams kyis stong ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar yi ge rnams ni yi ge rnams kyis stong ste /
translated: In this way, letters are empty of letters.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: yi ge rnams kyi stong pa nyid gang lags pa de yi ge rnams ma lags la /
analyzed: yi ge rnams kyi stong pa nyid gang lags pa de yi ge rnams ma lags la /
translated: the emptiness of letters is not letters,

original: yi ge rnams las gud na'ang stong pa nyid ma mchis te /🔽yi ge rnams nyid kyang stong pa nyid lags /
analyzed: yi ge rnams las gud na'ang stong pa nyid ma mchis te / yi ge rnams nyid kyang stong pa nyid lags /
translated: and emptiness does not exist apart from letters.🔽Letters themselves are emptiness,

original: stong pa nyid kyang yi ge rnams lags ba'i slad du'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyang yi ge rnams lags ba'i slad du'o //
translated: and emptiness itself is letters.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: rnam grangs des na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas yi ge rnams la gnas par mi bgyi'o //
analyzed: rnam grangs des na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas yi ge rnams la gnas par mi bgyi'o //
translated: for this reason, bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom should not settle on letters.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas /
analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas /
translated: further, bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom

original: gzugs mi rtag go zhes bgyi bar gnas par mi bgyi'o //
analyzed: gzugs mi rtag go zhes bgyi bar gnas par mi bgyi'o //
translated: should not settle on the notion that ‘form is impermanent.’

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa mi rtag go /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa mi rtag go /
translated: They should not settle on the notion that ‘feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are impermanent.’

original: zhes bgyi bar gnas par mi bgyi'o //🔽de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: zhes bgyi bar gnas par mi bgyi'o // de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: So it is, Well-Gone One!”

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: The Blessed One said, “Subhūti, it is so!

original: de ltar gzugs mi rtag pa ni gzugs mi rtag pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis stong ste /
analyzed: de ltar gzugs mi rtag pa ni gzugs mi rtag pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis stong ste /
translated: Subhūti, form is impermanent because the intrinsic nature of form is empty.

original: mi rtag pa nyid kyi stong pa nyid gang lags pa de mi rtag pa nyid ma lags la /
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid kyi stong pa nyid gang lags pa de mi rtag pa nyid ma lags la /
translated: That emptiness of impermanence is not impermanence,

original: stong pa nyid las gud na'ang mi rtag pa nyid ma mchis te /🔽mi rtag pa nyid kyang stong pa nyid lags /
analyzed: stong pa nyid las gud na'ang mi rtag pa nyid ma mchis te / mi rtag pa nyid kyang stong pa nyid lags /
translated: and impermanence is not other than emptiness.🔽Impermanence itself is emptiness,

original: stong pa nyid kyang mi rtag pa nyid lags pa'i slad du'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyang mi rtag pa nyid lags pa'i slad du'o //
translated: and emptiness itself is impermanence.

original: @120b bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: @120b bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: rnam grangs des na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas gzugs mi rtag ces bgyi bar gnas par mi bgyi'o //
analyzed: rnam grangs des na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas gzugs mi rtag ces bgyi bar gnas par mi bgyi'o //
translated: for these reasons, bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom should not dwell on the notion that ‘form is impermanent.’

original: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa mi rtag ces bgyi bar gnas par mi bgyi'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa mi rtag ces bgyi bar gnas par mi bgyi'o //
translated: Similarly, they should not dwell on the notions that ‘feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness are impermanent.’

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: If you ask why,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: rnam par shes pa mi rtag pa ni rnam par shes pa mi rtag pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis stong ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa mi rtag pa ni rnam par shes pa mi rtag pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis stong ste /
translated: impermanent consciousness is empty of the intrinsic nature of impermanent consciousness.

original: mi rtag pa nyid kyi stong pa nyid gang lags pa de mi rtag pa nyid ma lags la /
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid kyi stong pa nyid gang lags pa de mi rtag pa nyid ma lags la /
translated: The emptiness of impermanence is not impermanence.

original: stong pa nyid las gud na'ang mi rtag pa nyid ma mchis te /🔽mi rtag pa nyid kyang stong pa nyid lags /
analyzed: stong pa nyid las gud na'ang mi rtag pa nyid ma mchis te / mi rtag pa nyid kyang stong pa nyid lags /
translated: Impermanence is not elsewhere from emptiness.

original: stong pa nyid kyang mi rtag pa nyid lags pa'i slad du'o //🔽bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyang mi rtag pa nyid lags pa'i slad du'o // bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Impermanence is emptiness, and emptiness is impermanence.

original: rnam grangs des na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas rnam par shes pa la gnas par mi bgyi'o //
analyzed: rnam grangs des na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas rnam par shes pa la gnas par mi bgyi'o //
translated: Blessed One, for that reason bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom should not stand in consciousness.

original: de bzhin du gzugs sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med pa dang / zhi ba dang / stong pa dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / dben pa zhes bgyi bar gnas par mi bgyi'o //🔽de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med pa dang / zhi ba dang / stong pa dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du gzugs sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med pa dang / zhi ba dang / stong pa dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / dben pa zhes bgyi bar gnas par mi bgyi'o // de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med pa dang / zhi ba dang / stong pa dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang /
translated: that it is not a self, that it is peaceful, that it is empty, that it is signless, that it is without wishes, or that it is void.🔽Similarly, they should not dwell on the notion that feelings, perceptions, formative predispositions, and consciousness are suffering,

original: dben pa zhes bgyi bar gnas par mi bgyi'o //
analyzed: dben pa zhes bgyi bar gnas par mi bgyi'o //
translated: that they are not a self, that they are peaceful, that they are empty, that they are signless, that they are without wishes, or that they are void.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: bcom @121a *// ldan 'das /🔽'di ltar rnam par shes pa'i dben pa ni rnam par shes pa'i dben pas stong ste /🔽rnam par shes pa'i dben pa nyid gang lags pa de rnam par shes pa ma lags la /
analyzed: bcom @121a *// ldan 'das / 'di ltar rnam par shes pa'i dben pa ni rnam par shes pa'i dben pas stong ste / rnam par shes pa'i dben pa nyid gang lags pa de rnam par shes pa ma lags la /
translated: Blessed One,🔽the voidness of consciousness is empty of the voidness of consciousness.🔽The very voidness of consciousness is not consciousness,

original: rnam par shes pa las gud na'ang dben pa nyid ma mchis te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa las gud na'ang dben pa nyid ma mchis te /
translated: and the voidness of consciousness is not elsewhere apart from consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa nyid kyang dben pa nyid lags /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa nyid kyang dben pa nyid lags /
translated: consciousness itself is voidness,

original: dben pa nyid kyang rnam par shes pa lags pa'i slad du'o //
analyzed: dben pa nyid kyang rnam par shes pa lags pa'i slad du'o //
translated: and voidness itself is consciousness.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: rnam grangs des na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas rnam par shes pa dben zhes bgyi bar gnas par mi bgyi'o //
analyzed: rnam grangs des na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas rnam par shes pa dben zhes bgyi bar gnas par mi bgyi'o //
translated: for this reason, great bodhisattva beings who practice the transcendent perfection of wisdom should not abide in the notion that consciousness is void.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas de bzhin nyid la gnas par mi bgyi'o;/🔽de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas de bzhin nyid la gnas par mi bgyi'o;/ de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: great bodhisattva beings who practice the transcendent perfection of wisdom should not abide in suchness.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: If one were to ask why, Blessed One,

original: 'di ltar de bzhin nyid ni de bzhin nyid kyis stong ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar de bzhin nyid ni de bzhin nyid kyis stong ste /
translated: it is because suchness is empty of suchness.

original: bcom ldan 'das /🔽de bzhin nyid kyi stong pa nyid gang lags pa de de bzhin nyid ma lags la /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das / de bzhin nyid kyi stong pa nyid gang lags pa de de bzhin nyid ma lags la /
translated: Blessed One,🔽the emptiness of suchness is not suchness,

original: stong pa nyid las gud na'ang de bzhin nyid ma mchis te /
analyzed: stong pa nyid las gud na'ang de bzhin nyid ma mchis te /
translated: and suchness is not other than emptiness.

original: de bzhin nyid kyang stong pa nyid lags /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid kyang stong pa nyid lags /
translated: Suchness is emptiness.

original: stong pa nyid kyang de bzhin nyid lags pa'i slad du'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyang de bzhin nyid lags pa'i slad du'o //
translated: Emptiness is suchness.

original: bcom ldan 'das; rnam grangs des na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas de bzhin nyid la gnas par mi bgyi'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das; rnam grangs des na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas de bzhin nyid la gnas par mi bgyi'o //
translated: Blessed One, for these reasons, bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom should not stand in suchness.

original: de bzhin du chos nyid @121b dang; chos kyi dbyings dang / chos skyon med pa nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' la gnas par mi bgyi'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du chos nyid @121b dang; chos kyi dbyings dang / chos skyon med pa nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' la gnas par mi bgyi'o //
translated: Similarly, they should not stand in the true nature, the realm of phenomena, the maturity of phenomena, or the very limit of reality.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas gzungs kyi sgo thams cad la gnas par mi bgyi'o //🔽de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas gzungs kyi sgo thams cad la gnas par mi bgyi'o // de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: further, bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom should not stand in any of the dhāraṇī gateways.

original: 'di ltar gzungs kyi sgo ni gzungs kyi sgos stong ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar gzungs kyi sgo ni gzungs kyi sgos stong ste /
translated: If you ask why, it is because the dhāraṇī gateways are empty of the dhāraṇī gateways.

original: bcom ldan 'das; gzungs kyi sgo'i stong pa nyid gang lags pa de gzungs kyi sgo ma lags la /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das; gzungs kyi sgo'i stong pa nyid gang lags pa de gzungs kyi sgo ma lags la /
translated: “Blessed One, the emptiness of the dhāraṇī gateway is not the dhāraṇī gateway.

original: stong pa nyid las gud na'ang gzungs kyi sgo ma mchis te /
analyzed: stong pa nyid las gud na'ang gzungs kyi sgo ma mchis te /
translated: Apart from emptiness there is no dhāraṇī gateway.
